title: Data Analyst
description: Job SummaryWe are looking for a Data Analyst that will work on extracting, creating, and analyzing information to get insights and behavioral patterns to provide actionable recommendations to improve the business. We are a product-centered company and all of our teams rely heavily on data to drive product development and decision-making.ImportantExpert in Tableau and SQLJABU Business Analytics Program (BAP)Jabu opens hub in LATAM and launches the Jabu Business Analytics Program. Located in Buenos Aires, the Jabu Business Analytics Hub will support the global growth and expansion strategies.We are looking for talented and driven Business and Data Analysts for the Jabu Business Analytics Program team. These are important roles that will contribute to the success of the business by enabling critical reporting, deep dive and data support for the growth and associated teams.Joining the team means partnering with a dynamic and creative group with a high bar for innovation and success in a fast-paced and changing environment.Jabu, southern Africa’s fastest growing e-commerce for small retailers is powering the way in which shop-owners, source and stock their products, and executing the last-mile of distribution for FMCG brands.Qualifications (Knowledge, Skills & Abilities)Looking for the opportunity to have a big impact at an early company.Be part of the decision process of establishing KPIs from a range of sources to measure the effectiveness of business decisions.Define data flow architecture and support their implementation.Create dashboards and reports based on your analysis of daily traffic flows, then transform those into key insights.Share and communicate the results of your analysis with relevant members of the organizationBuilding a deep understanding of data and pipelines.Advise on data architecture, identifying opportunities to better link our various data sources.Work closely with business areas to identify opportunities and ensure the strategy is aligned to the needs of the business.Understanding how to combine quantitative and qualitative insights in order to build a holistic picture that is closer to ground truth.Experience collaborating with a team of programmers and analysts made up of varying skill setsLooking for the opportunity to have a big impact at an early company.Use Jabu products to obtain data.Education And / Or ExperienceA strong analyst with at least 3 years of experience in growth-oriented data analysis.A graduate with a degree in data science, mathematics, statistics, or an IT-related background.Knowledgeable about gathering, cleaning, and transforming large data sets.Business-oriented, with great documentation skills, an inclination for problem-solving, high attention to detail – and equipped with excellent written and verbal communication skills.Solving problems and identifying business opportunities using data: analyzing the problem and breaking it down into various analytical components.Experience in logistics startups or companies (appreciated)

title: Data Analyst
description: If you are passionate about data, and you clearly visualize the business story and enjoy crafting intelligence reports that drive today's successful businesses, then we want to speak with you!The Level Access Accessibility Product Team places an emphasis on meaningful experiences that result in a phenomenal work environment that fosters success for all our employees.Traits And ExperiencesYou are a mix of data analyst, business analyst, analytics translator, visual presenter, and data artist, who is equally at home discussing business use cases with project owners and talking shop with the product and development team. You're deeply driven about accelerating growth through data-driven decision support across all our business functions.Through a combination of outstanding analytical and storytelling skills you'll help us better understand the value we deliver to our customers and partners, and drive key decisions that will craft the future of LAWe are a software company that is driven toward digital inclusion and accessibility for people with disabilities. Your role as a data analyst, will impact positively, enabling a better digital environment for all.Objectives And ResponsibilitiesPartnerPartner with product management and engineering to understand product instrumentation needs for insights and analyticsPartner with our outstanding product team and senior leadership, to understand their objectives and build data product experiences. Offering practical insights, that illuminate and accurately steer product direction, roadmaps, documentation efforts, training content, growth goals and retention strategiesPartner with product management and engineering to understand product instrumentation needs for insights and analyticsBuildProduce insights (e.g., performance drivers, retention analysis, behavioural personas) to accelerate adoption and business growth, and illuminate product strategyBuild, deploy, and/or maintain data management systems and back-end data infrastructure for our business intelligence pipelineBuild data visualisations; reports, dashboards, and data auditsDesign and build scalable data models to optimise internal and customer experiencesDesign and build a dashboard / real-time reports to gauge and monitor rapid growth patterns. Design and drive to deliver a process and data strategy for ongoing product usage analyticsDesign and implement repeatable frameworks to measure the impact of releases and experiments. This will include upcoming releases, product leadership decision support by providing periodical data driven visualization. Develop a framework for data maintenance for business reporting. Communicate, design / build a reporting repository to be consumed and used on a periodic basis by the Product teamTake full advantage of off-the-shelf as well as in-house technologies to build a best-in-class data management and presentation pipelineInfluenceInfluence and promote solid foundational data practices through demonstrated expertise and excellent knowledge with transfer management, through mentorship and applying your Domain Expertise, to all Product team membersBring intelligence to customer data through the power of: structured data (workflow state evolution, database tables), unstructured data (utterances, descriptions, documents, etc.) adapting to their outstanding, often sophisticated configurations and working at scale. Ability to see the story behind the data and work with product managers to craft effective narratives about our value that we're creating for our customers with our productsPassionate about automating data analysis, business intelligence and a drive to grow beyond BI as we grow into a significantly data driven future together.

title: Pricing & Data Analyst
description: About The JobAl asumir la posición de Pricing & Data Analyst para Lacteos tendrás el desafío de….Colaborar con la digitalizacion y ser referente en la automatizacion de procesos en el area de Pricing. Trabajar en el armado de las listas de precio a nivel nacional como así manejar grandes volumenes de bases de datos.Hacer seguimiento semanal del mercado para el equipo y proponer soluciones para el negocio.Armar y análizar dashboards e implementar estrategias para el area. About youREQUISITOSFormación Académica Graduados o estudiantes avanzados en ingenieria, contador, economia o carreras a fines2 años de experiencia en posiciones similares en el area de pricingNivel de Excel Avanzado.Manejo de base de datos AvanzadoBuscamos a alguien apasionado por los datos, proactivo, organizado y resiliente. About us"Danone es una empresa única, con una cultura enriquecedora, un ADN que nos distingue, fuertes raíces, grandes valores y una misión desafiante.En la unidad de negocios de lácteos y productos de base vegetal trabajamos todos los días con un único propósito entusiasmar a los argentinos a mejorar su alimentación, ofreciendo todos los días propuestas más saludables, tentadoras e innovadoras. Esta misión nos obliga a tener equipos flexibles, ágiles y resilientes, en permanente búsqueda de la creatividad e innovación.Sobre todas las cosas, en EDP somos amantes de nuestros productos ¿Querés conocerlos? Esencialidad, es la categoría que comprende los alimentos básicos de la nutrición diaria de los argentinos, con marcas como Danonino, Ser ,Yogurísimo y Gran Compra. Además, contamos con CasanCrem, un gran aliado en la cocina que ofrece versatilidad para hacer tus comidas más livianas. Nueva Salud, donde nos encontramos con Silk, que nos pone en la vanguardia de los alimentos de origen vegetal. Por otro lado, Actimel y Activia quienes nos brindan beneficios específicos para la salud. Por último tenemos a YoPro, rico en proteínas, especialmente pensado para los deportistas. Indulgencia, en donde lo irresistible se hace presente Cindor, Serenito y Danette son algunas de nuestras marcas.Buscamos a personas visionarias, las que se desafían para empujar a otros a desafiarse. Aquellas que saben bien que sólo animándose se puede cambiar, y tienen la convicción de que la salud es pasión. Es momento de cambiar el juego. ¿Te querés sumar?En Danone valoramos la diversidad y fomentamos la inclusión, reconociendo, respetando y aprovechando las diferentes opiniones, perspectivas y características, alentando a los Danoners, a ser su mejor versión. Todas las decisiones relacionadas con el reclutamiento, contratación, promoción, compensación, decisiones de desarrollo de los empleados como capacitación y todos los otros términos y condiciones del empleo, se tomarán sin importar la edad, etnia, color, género, origen nacional, religión, discapacidad, orientación sexual, identidad o expresión de género.¡POSTULATE!

title: Jr. Master Data Analyst
description: En AES, elevamos la calidad de vida en todo el mundo cambiando la forma en la que la energía funciona. Todos tienen un impacto cada día en nuestros equipos pequeños y globales. Postúlese aquí para iniciar una extraordinaria carrera hoy mismo. En AES, elevamos la calidad de vida en todo el mundo cambiando la forma en la que la energía funciona. Todos/as tienen un impacto cada día en nuestros equipos pequeños y globales. Postúlese aquí para iniciar una extraordinaria carrera hoy mismo. Estamos buscando un/a Jr. Master Data Analyst para sumarse a nuestro equipo de AES Argentina.Responsabilidades Principales Administración de datos maestros. Velar por el cumplimiento de controles. Preparación y controles de auditorías. Manejo y verificación de documentación y datos. Interacción con distintos proveedores y áreas. Responsable de gestionar preguntas y consultas referentes al área. Manejo diario de SAP y Excel.Requisitos Estudiante avanzado de Administración, Contador Público o carrera afín. (Excluyente) Experiencia de 2 años en posiciones similares. (Deseable) Manejo de SAP (Deseable) Conocimiento avanzado de todas las herramientas Microsoft Office. Inglés avanzado (Excluyente) Trabajo en equipo y responsabilidad. Buenas relaciones interpersonales.Mejoramos la vida de más de 10+ millones de personas a través de la entrega segura y confiable de energía. Uno de cada tres hogares se iluminan con nuestro trabajo. Mejoramos la vida de más de 10+ millones de personas a través de la entrega segura y confiable de energía. Uno de cada tres hogares se iluminan con nuestro trabajo.

title: Digital  Data Analyst
description: ENTORNO Y OBJETIVO GENERAL DEL PUESTO:Como parte de sus objetivos, MSF LAT lleva a cabo acciones de difusión proactivas a través de su departamento de Comunicación, desde una perspectiva regional, en los diferentes países de América del Sur de habla hispana, con el objetivo de incrementar el conocimiento sobre el trabajo y los valores de la organización, así como alertar y movilizar sobre las crisis humanitarias en las que interviene. A su vez, el departamento de Fundraising desarrolla acciones de recaudación de fondos en Argentina, Uruguay, Colombia y próximamente Chile, los cuales están destinados a financiar las intervenciones de MSF alrededor del mundo. La Unidad Digital de MSF LAT reúne a integrantes de ambos departamentos, localizados en Buenos Aires y Bogotá, que se especializan en ejecutar distintas acciones a través de los activos digitales de la organización: sus sitios web - para Argentina, Colombia, Uruguay; y próximamente también para Chile - y sus distintos canales digitales de carácter regional -Instagram, Facebook y Twitter; próximamente también Linkedin, Tik Tok y Youtube. Su objetivo es contribuir a potenciar la calidad y el impacto del engagement digital de MSF LAT con sus audiencias regionales, maximizar la consecución de donantes y dar soporte a distintas estrategias de reclutamiento. La Unidad trabaja además con las distintas áreas de la organización ayudando a identificar oportunidades y estrategias en las que los recursos digitales puedan ayudarlos a alcanzar sus objetivos. La persona que desempeñe el rol de Data Analyst formará parte de la Unidad Digital de MSF LAT. El Responsable de la Unidad Digital supervisará y orientará sus funciones, y trabajará además en estrecha sinergia con el Técnico de Campañas Digitales, a la vez que transversalmente con el resto del equipo de la Unidad Digital. El objetivo del puesto es recolectar, interpretar, analizar y procesar los datos, con el objetivo de transformarlos en insights relevantes para tomar decisiones, establecer patrones en el comportamiento de las audiencias, hacer más eficientes y efectivas las estrategias de marketing digital (campañas pagas y contenidos orgánicos), lograr una mejora en la experiencia de uso de las webs, e impulsar los proyectos digitales con el fin de impactar positivamente en los resultados. La persona elegida, tendrá sinergias con los equipos de toda la oficina: Campañas y Eventos de Comunicación, Adquisición de donantes masivos, Fidelización y Colaboraciones Estratégicas de Fundraising, IT y reclutamiento de Recursos Humanos. Su enfoque a la hora de encarar los proyectos será regional, como la transversalidad del impacto de las acciones que se dan en plataformas digitales. Mediante estas acciones, será capaz de generar el conocimiento necesario para llevar a cabo campañas de distinta índole de la manera más efectiva y eficiente, generando la documentación para un correcto reporte; respetando siempre los parámetros normativos de la organización y los protocolos internos de validación de las distintas acciones. RESPONSABILIDADES Y FUNCIONES PRINCIPALES: ANÁLISIS DE DATOS:Explorar y analizar los datos de los que dispone la organización de las diferentes plataformas de campañas pagas, contenidos orgánicos, CRM y métricas webs para identificar correlaciones y descubrir tendencias.Elaborar dashboards para la visualización de datos utilizando diferentes herramientas de reporting (Power BI y Looker studio), para ayudar a tomar mejores decisiones al momento de optimizar campañas y crear nuevas estrategias.Realizar investigaciones de mercado digitales, donde se analice la audiencia de las diferentes plataformas de la organización (Facebook, Instagram, Google, webs, CRM y próximamente TikTok), se investigue a la competencia directa e indirecta, y se descubran nuevas tendencias, logrando hallazgos importantes para nuevas estrategias en diferentes campañas digitales tanto pagas como orgánicas. GENERACIÓN DE REPORTES:Elaborar informes finales de campañas pagas o estrategias orgánicas donde se muestren los resultados obtenidos, los aprendizajes y buenas prácticas para informar a las personas vinculadas a las distintas acciones digitales.Realizar seguimiento a los indicadores (KPIs) del canal digital para el Cuadro de Mandos, los distintos reportes de performance existentes, y para otros análisis que puedan ser requeridos.Implementar diversas técnicas de medición para descifrar la efectividad de los formularios y para proponer desarrollos orientados a mejorar la experiencia de usuario.Dar seguimiento diario de la performance de las campañas digitales de adquisición.Preparar presentaciones informativas y procesables sobre hallazgos y recomendaciones. ESTRATEGIA:Brindar soporte a necesidades de implementación de informes al resto de las áreas de MSF LAT, según requerimientos.Proponer nuevas ideas para recopilar la información de manera eficiente.Generación de hipótesis y experimentos para la mejora continua del performance y reducción de costes de las diferentes campañas pagas.Contribuir a la mejora continua de los distintos formularios de las webs teniendo en cuenta su rendimiento (% de conversión), en términos de experiencia de usuario y analítica web. ACTIVIDADES DE NETWORKING:Participar en la dinámica de trabajo del servicio web y para la puesta en común de las acciones online de las distintas áreas de la organización.Participar en actividades de networking Internacional de los Working Groups de MSF Internacional, involucrándose en la generación y puesta en común de los contenidos, y generando un intercambio de ideas y experiencias.Comunicar y realizar un seguimiento de las métricas de rendimiento clave en todos los departamentos que tengan campañas digitales pagas o contenidos orgánicos.  FORMACIÓN Y EXPERIENCIA:Profesional en Estadística, Marketing, Administración o carreras afines.Experiencia mínima de 2 años en análisis avanzado, depuración, modelaje y visualización de datos.Manejo de Excel avanzado, Access, Power BI y Looker Studio (ex Google Data Studio).Conocimiento avanzado en Google Analytics.Conocimiento en investigación de audiencias y herramientas de pauta publicitaria digital y redes sociales.Muy buen nivel de inglés.  SE VALORARÁ MUY POSITIVAMENTE:Manejo de SQL.Conocimientos de WordPress.Conocimientos de manejo de CRM’s.Conocimientos de Google Tag Manager.Gran capacidad para solucionar problemas de datos.Interés por nuevas tendencias de uso y plataformas digitales.Experiencia y/o motivación por el trabajo de las ONG y en particular por la acción humanitaria. CONDICIONES:Localización: basado en las oficinas de Buenos Aires, Bogotá o Montevideo.Puesto FULL-TIME. Contrato regido por la legislación del país en el que esté basada la posición.Condiciones laborales y nivel salarial de acuerdo con las políticas RRHH MSF y a la tabla salarial de MSF en el país en el que esté basada la posición.Incorporación: Inmediata. Solicitud:Los interesados deberán enviar su CV y carta de motivación incluyendo remuneración pretendida (excluyente).Se recibirán candidaturas hasta el 23 de Enero. Solo se responderán las candidaturas seleccionadas.

title: Global Data Analyst
description: Join us and celebrate the beauty of human experience. Create for happier, healthier lives, with love for nature. Together, with kindness and humility, we deliver food innovations, craft inspired fragrances and develop beauty and wellbeing solutions that make people look and feel good. There’s much to learn and many to learn from, with more than 16,800 employees around the world to explore ideas and ambitions with. Dive into varied, flexible, and stimulating environments. Meet empowered professionals to partner with, befriend, and stretch your skills alongside. Every day, your energy, your creativity, and your determination will shape our future, making a positive difference on billions of people. Every essence of you enriches our world. We are Givaudan. Human by nature.Givaudan is a global leading company in taste and wellbeing, fragrance, and beauty. With its heritage stretching back over 250 years, the company has a long history of innovating scents and tastes. From a favorite drink to your daily meal, from prestige perfumes to cosmetics and laundry care, its creations inspire emotions and delight millions of consumers the world over. The company is committed to driving purpose-led. long-term growth while leading the way to improve happiness and health for people and nature. In the fiscal year 2020, the Company employed over 15,800 people worldwide and achieved sales of CHF 6,3 billion and a free cash flow of 12,8% of sales. Let's imagine together on www.givaudan.comThe Global Data Analyst, who is part of the Global Analytics team, is extracting, analyzing, and mass-loading master data in our core systems. He/she is supporting various projects with analysis, extractions, and data migration activities.You will:Advanced Analytics  Data analysis of large data sets using state-oft he-art methods and tools to identify business rules and continuous improvement opportunities Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of large data sets used for analysis Doing ad-hoc analysis and presenting results in a clear manner Enhancing data collection procedures to include informationETL (Extraction, Transformation, Load) Drive data mapping activities to support Migration projects and/or Acquisition projects Handling of service requests, execution of reports, and mass uploads Set up mass uploads, reports, and measurements for repetitive execution while ensuring the highest level of data integrity at the global levelProject Management Work alone comfortably Contribute to end MD Projects & Change Requests Actively participate in projects, including continuous improvements, design, data migration/ requirements/processes Support MD Champions with all kinds of analysis and process implementations Perform root-cause analysis, data quality analysis, impact analysis, measurements, and feasibility studies Review of data service requests from businesses to clarify and ensure global consistencyPeople and collaboration Provide professional support for Junior colleagues Act as the contact person for key internal and external stakeholders for operational topics Builds constructive and effective relationships with cross-functional teams and stakeholders Communicate effectively with internal and external partners by phone or via emailYou are:You have a college or university degreeYou are fluent in EnglishYou have 1+ years of relevant experience in a function-specific role or equivalent. You have a good working knowledge of SAP or other ERP systemsYou have advanced MS Excel knowledge and good knowledge of Microsoft Office or equivalent toolStrong numeracy and administration skillsOur Benefits:Flexible work arrangements (possibility to work from home 4 times/week)Competitive benefits packageLong-term career development opportunitiesIn case you are interested, please apply with your English CV.Givaudan is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer M/F/D/V.At Givaudan, you contribute to delightful taste and scent experiences that touch people's lives. You work within an inspiring team culture – where you can thrive, collaborate and learn from other talented and passionate people across disciplines, regions, and divisions. Join us and Impact Your World!Diversity drives innovation and creates closer connections with our employees, customers, and partners. Givaudan embraces diversity and is committed to building an inclusive environment where everyone impacts our world.At Givaudan, you contribute to delightful taste and scent experiences that touch people’s lives.You work within an inspiring teamwork culture – where you can thrive, collaborate and learn from other talented and passionate people across disciplines, regions and divisions.Every essence of you enriches our world.Diversity drives innovation and creates closer connections with our employees, customers and partners.Givaudan embraces diversity and is committed to building an inclusive environment where everyone impacts our world.

title: analista de datos
description: Nini Mayorista incorpora a su equipo perfil con experiencia de al menos 1 año ejerciendo la labor como analista de datos o analista de información.Las principales responsabilidades para quien ocupe la posición serán:Extraer, explorar y manipular grandes volúmenes de datos.Interpretar resultados, simplificarlos y sintetizarlos para luego transmitirlos al negocio, elaborando reportes de gestión para la toma de decisionesDiseñar y mantener tableros de control, cuadros de mando y otros reportes, a partir de los datos recabados en los sistemas de la compañía. Esos reportes deben permitir entender la información de forma rápida y fácil, proporcionando una visión estándar, medible y unificada del proyecto.Detectar nuevas oportunidades y/o mejoras de negocio basadas en datos.Detectar y proponer nuevas metodologías, herramientas y modelos que promuevan la innovación en Ciencia de Datos.Asistir al negocio frente a problemáticas que requieran soluciones basadas en datos.Son RequisitosEstudiante de Administración de Empresas, Sistemas de Información, Marketing o afín.Excel AvanzadoConocimientos de herramientas BI (Microstrategy, BusinessObjects BI, Power BI, etc.)Experiencia en la gestión de altos volúmenes de datos.Resolución, autogestión y análisis serán competencias valoradas en el perfil seleccionado

title: Analista de Datos
description: En Megatlon nos encontramos en la búsqueda de un Analista de Planificación ComercialRequisitos Graduado o estudiante avanzado próximo a recibirse de las carreras sistemas, administración de empresas o afines Experiencia mínima de 2 años en área de inteligencia comercial y planificación de negocio de servicios Experiencia en la creación de KPI's para el control y seguimiento de la gestiónRequisitos tecnológicosExcel avanzado (excluyente)Conocimiento en Power Bi o TableauConocimiento en lenguaje DAXDeseable conocimiento en power query y lenguaje MConocimiento de fundamentos de bases de datos.Deseable SAP y QVCompetencias requeridas Proactivo, capacidad resolutiva, excelente manejo de relaciones interpersonales y capacidad de autocorrecciónBeneficios Muy buenas posibilidades de desarrollo Integrarte a una compañía en pleno proceso de expansiónEncontrá el trabajo que buscás en la mayor red de gimnasios del país y formá parte de nuestro equipo de profesionales.Si sos dinámico, tenés vocación de servicio y pasión para lograr tus metas, podés unirte a nuestro Staff

title: Data Analyst Sr - Science
description: Job DescriptionEn Cervecería y Maltería Quilmes nos encontramos en la búsqueda de personas dinámicas que buscan desafíos constantes y sueñen en grande.Su rol principal será la exploración de datos provenientes de la aplicación B2B (BEES) de Cervecería Quilmes y la realización de análisis descriptivos, para brindar a las áreas de negocio información e insights que agreguen valor en la toma de decisiones.Responsibilities and assignmentsDescubrimiento de preguntas de negocio a resolver con análisis, testeos y modelos, identificando las necesidades de los usuarios y contribuyendo a construir un producto de datos que resuelva las mismas.Exploración de los conjuntos de datos disponibles y/o nuevas fuentes de datos, para resolver esas problemáticas.Ejecución de análisis basados en estadística descriptiva o modelos de ciencia de datos, para detectar oportunidades y patrones en los datos.Brindarle al negocio insights a partir de los datos y modelos creados.Coordinación con el negocio para la adopción de la solución brindada y el monitoreo del valor agregado.Aprender de los equipos del negocio, de la experiencia con la aplicación y con la operación de ventas, para encontrar las oportunidades de mejora y ejecutar iniciativas que mejor cubran esa necesidad.Requirements And QualificationsUniversitario completo o próximo para finalizar. Preferentemente con especialización en obtención y modelado de datos.Experiencia en posiciones similares, manejando grandes volúmenes de datos y analizándolos con técnicas estadísticas.Analítico / Orientado a resultados / Resolutivo / Organizado / Liderazgo de equipos y pares.ExcluyentesCompetencias Técnicas:Conocimiento y experiencia con lenguaje SQL, para la extracción y modelado de datos.Experiencia en manejo de datos con Python o R.ExcelHabilidades de comunicación y presentación.No ExcluyentesHerramientas de visualización (preferentemente, Power BI)Conocimientos Agile.¡Te damos la bienvenida! Somos Cervecería y Maltería QuilmesEn Argentina contamos con más de 6.000 colaboradores, que trabajamos en 10 cervecerías y plantas de elaboración de gaseosas, 2 malterías, 1 chacra de lúpulo, 1 planta de insumos, 11 centros de distribución, 9 oficinas de venta directa y una red de más de 173 distribuidores independientes.Formamos parte de Anheuser-Busch InBev, la Compañía cervecera líder en el mundo, que se conformó a través de diversas fusiones, en los últimos años, con distintas empresas como Ambev, Interbrew, Anhauser Bush, Grupo Modelo, SAB Miller, entre otras.Nuestra gente sueña en grande. Somos apasionados por lo que hacemos, y nuestro mayor objetivo es innovar en el sector de bebidas con la mayor calidad y variedad para que nuestros consumidores nos elijan y tengan la mejor experiencia de consumo.¡Nuestra cultura está enfocada en construir un ambiente inclusivo y colaborativo, en el que las personas puedan sacar lo mejor de sí mismas! Queremos seguir sumando personas comprometidas, que quieran cambiar las cosas, les guste innovar y los desafíos, y siempre vayan por más. Por eso, buscamos talentos diversos, dispuestos a construir nuestro gran propósito: Soñamos en grande para crear un futuro con mas motivos para brindar.¡Conocé nuestras búsquedas, y postulate!¡Te estamos buscando a vos!

title: Analista de datos - Mix (On Site & Remoto) (1236)
description: ¿Qué hace la compañía?Importante Grupo Bancario, que se ubica entre las 10 principales entidades del Sistema Financiero Argentino con más de 180 sucursales en todo el país. Son agentes financieros de sus respectivas provincias y líderes en depósitos y préstamos del sector privado, ofrecen productos y servicios financieros a individuos y empresas a través de múltiples canales digitales y de su amplia red de sucursales.¿Qué necesitás para ser parte del equipo?A Nivel PersonalQue cuentes con capacidad de organización y planificación de la información.Que sepas trabajar en equipo.Que seas analítico/a.Que puedas manejar grandes volúmenes de datos.A Nivel TécnicoExperiencia de 2 años o más en funciones a fines.Experiencia como Analista de datos.Experiencia con SQL y Apache Hive.¿Qué vas a hacer?Como Analista de datos, tendrás a tu cargo las siguientes responsabilidades:Relevamiento de datos y generación de documentación.Extracción, procesamiento y agrupación de datos: análisis de los mismos.Modelación de la información: datos estructurados y no estructurados.Creación de modelo final para los usuarios.Gestión de demandas con el PO y realización de informes.¿Con quién trabajarás?Serás parte del importante sector de Área de Gobierno de Datos corporativo y le darás servicio a las distintas gerencias.¿Cuándo y dónde trabajarás?Trabajarás en un esquema mixto, con algunos días de presencialidad y el resto con beneficio de Home Office. Las oficinas se encuentran en Microcentro, CABA. La franja de trabajo de referencia es de 8 horas, de lunes a viernes, de 9 a 18 hs.¿Qué ofrecen?Relación de dependencia directa.Home Office.Prepaga para grupo familiar.Adicional por el Día del Bancario.Bonificación en seguros de vida, hogar, bolso protegido, robo en cajero y en auto.Capacitaciones.Gimnasio.Kit de bienvenida.Presentes por fechas especiales.¿De qué fases consta el proceso de selección?Tendrás una primera entrevista con nuestra Recruiter, Katherine Dopta, para conocer tus experiencias laborales e intereses.Luego, tendrás el primer acercamiento con el cliente, en una entrevista con el área de RRHH propia. title: Data Analyst
description: We are currently seeking a dynamic individual for the role of DATA ANALYST to join our team:Location: Microcentro, Capital Federal, Buenos Aires. Work schedule: Monday to Friday, 9:00 am to 6:00 pm. Contract Type: Open-ended / Indefinite-term. About the position: We are looking for a Data Analyst – Data Management & Delivery who is self-starter to work in a diverse and fast-paced environment that can join our Data Management team.This role requires partnering with the broader JLL team at the country, regional and global level by utilizing in-depth knowledge of data, infrastructure, technologies and data analysis and data management experienceResponsibilities:Independently develops, executes and monitors complex data management / analytic processes to support ad hoc data and information delivery for assigned projects. Develops proficiency in multiple data management disciplines and tools to develop robust data and information management solutions. Proactively identifies opportunities to optimize the performance and efficiency of existing processes/procedures. Monitors data / information management processes to ensure data quality and consistency in support of business initiatives. Ensures proper escalation, prioritization and remediation of data quality issues. Engages with colleagues and internal customers to reverse xisting business processes and identify core business requirements for new information deliverables and data infrastructure. Consults with the business to develop documentation and communication materials to ensure accurate usage and interpretation of JLL data. Identifies and acquires new data sources, performs data discovery to understand data values and relationships, and develops prototype solutions to deliver immediate business value. This position involves updating the bases and global systems of all information and invoice processing. Collects and manages the necessary information to carry out the control panel: KPILeads the assembly of the Annual Operating Plan (AOP) of the costumer, reconciling historical and projected information. Requirements:3 years of work experience in the fields of Information Science, data management and/or computer science or Economics. Bachelor’s degree in Information Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics or a quantitative discipline in Science, Business, or Social Science. Advanced degree preferred. Must have strong SQL skills. Knowledge of ETL and statistical tools such as Informatica, SSIS and other data science tools such as Python, R, Tableau are desirableExperience with data architecture, data integration/ETL, data warehousing, and/or business intelligence deployed in a complex environment. Understanding of data and systems engineering concepts to effectively integrate and analyse data to develop actionable business information deliverables. Able to think logically, organize work flows efficiently, and solve problems independently. Reliable, self-motivated, and self-disciplined individual capable of planning and executing multiple projects simultaneously within a fast paced environment. Capability to self-learn new software applications and programming languages. Effective written and verbal communication skills, including technical writing. Excellent technical, analytical and organizational skills. Benefits:Health Insurance for you. Annual Performance Bonus. Online platform with certified courses for professional development. Discounts in several categories (Gym, academic institutions, among others).

title: Data Engineer
description: At Rpay we are building the platform to erase economic boundaries worldwide. Our goal is to make global essential financial services universally accessible, such as a stable currency account, cross-border payments, international card for spending and more. In the long term, we aim to become the global financial platform for regular people to connect with each other.In our initial phase, we have already proven one of the major real-world use cases of crypto. Through our P2P digital wallet app, we already serve thousands of regular people in Latin America by providing them with an easy and safe way to save & spend stablecoins in a fast and cost-efficient way.Role SummaryWe are currently looking for a passionate problem-solver and self-driven Data Engineer to help us develop the data capabilities required to provide accurate & timely reporting for the business. You will own the design and development of our core data architecture to serve as the single source of truth for our bookkeeping, financial reporting and business analytics processes.If you are interested in (i) working on a fast-paced and ambiguous crypto environment; (ii) like managing large and complex sets of big data; and (iii) love envisioning data architectures and implementing advanced analytics applications, this could be the right opportunity for you.ResponsibilitiesDevelop and maintain a scalable data warehouse (DW) through the implementation of a relational database management systemCleanse, normalize and standardize our datasets through the implementation of extract, transform, and load processes (ETL) to ensure data integrity and accuracyWork with the Engineering team to integrate various data sources such as our app’s back-end, cloud infrastructure, crypto exchanges, and other financial platformsMaintain and support the DW to ensure its stability and full compliance with the Engineering’s team security, QA, and documentation requirementsModel on-chain and off-chain multi-currency transactions to support data validation and reconciliation processes for recurring accounting and financial reporting processesAnalyze large datasets through SQL queries and/or scripting languages (Python, R) to solve for ad-hoc financial and/or operating analysis requirementsBuild metrics, data visualizations and self-serve dashboards through business analytics platforms to support ongoing financial and business reporting processesSupport the generation of data-driven insights on business/product (cohort/funnel analysis), ops/liquidity (cash analytics, stress testing), or compliance (fraud, credit risk)Support future special IT projects such as a cloud-ERP implementation (e.g. NetSuite) through a middleware-based data integration and by establishing data definitionsRequirementsRequirementsBachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Actuarial or related STEM fields4+ years combined experience in Data Warehousing, managing ETL data pipelines with role-based access controls (RBAC), and implementing BI & data analytics solutionsAdvanced proficiency with SQL with hands-on development experience in relational database management systems (e.g. PostgreSQL) and multi-dimensional data modelingProven experience with scripting and programming languages such as Python or RSolid hands-on experience with cloud-based services (e.g. AWS, GCS, Azure)Experience with data visualization, BI/data analytics tools (e.g. MixPanel, Metabase)Knowledge of Agile methodologies and Scrum/Kanban practices is a plusExperience in retail banking, payments, fintech, and/or blockchain/crypto is a plusUnderstanding of accounting/bookkeeping requirements and processes is a plusExperience in data science, statistical analysis and predictive modeling is a plusExcellent communication skills with fluency in Spanish & English (spoken/written)High analytical, critical thinking and proven problem-solving abilitiesExcellent project management, organizational and presentational skills.Intellectual curiosity and interest in blockchain and crypto technologyPassion for financial inclusion and building a more prosperous worldBenefitsSalaries 100% USD-denominated. We work on a full transparency compensation approach. We have a clear and standardized compensation structure with levels and steps to compensate fairly across the organization. Plus, our team members are able to see how their compensation will grow according to our career path. For this role, we are hiring on L3S1 ($6,412.50 - $6,750) Total Compensation monthlyPTO - 15 working days + every team member will get 1 extra day off per each year in the company + birthday day + all national holidays in your country of residenceNomadic Work - A period of 60 days a year will be granted to work from anywhere in the 🌎Parental Leave - Continuing with our efforts in regard to Diversity & Inclusion, the company will provide 90 days of paid leave, regardless of your gender (applicable to births, adoptions or placements of foster children)Monthly feedback - To regularly iterate and support improvement & growth

title: Data & Strategy Analyst SSR
description: 📣 ¡En Navent seguimos creciendo! Hoy nos encontramos en la búsqueda 🔍 de😎 Data & Strategy Analyst SSR 😎para el equipo de Data&Strategy regional!Quien ocupe esta posición será responsable de dar apoyo al líder del área para la elaboración de reportes y comunicación de los resultados de la unidad de negocio Navent dentro del Grupo Quinto Andar.Te contamos los principales objetivos Ser encargado/a de proyectos estratégicos como por ejemplo entendimiento de la competencia y dimensionamiento de mercado. Adquirir un entendimiento 360º de la estrategia del negocio de clasificados online a través de una comunicación periódica y fluida con stakeholders de diferentes áreas dentro de la organización.¡Este rol tendrá una gran exposición ante el C-level de la compañía! Si te desafía lo que te contamos, entonces seguí leyendo… 👇Requisitos😎 ¿Qué esperamos de vos?¡Que tengas un perfil analítico y orientado a resultados!Que vengas a proponer nuevas estrategias e implementar mejoras orientadas a lograr los objetivos del negocio.Que cuentes con buenas habilidades de comunicación, organización y escucha. Que seas una persona autónoma. ¡Que te cope trabajar en equipo!🗣 Para eso necesitamos que Seas graduado/a o estudiante avanzado de carreras afines. Cuentes con, al menos, 2 años de experiencia en roles similares.Tengas manejo de Paquete Office Excel y Power Point (Excluyente).Idioma inglés (Excluyente) Si contás con conocimiento en Power BI y SQL, ¡es un plus! Beneficios📍 El lugar de trabajo es en nuestras oficinas que se encuentran en Nuñez. Tenemos un esquema híbrido de modalidad remota/presencial. Contarás con días de home office a coordinar con tu líder.Tenemos para ofrecerte como principales beneficios 🚀 🚀 Semana Navent (días libres entre las fiestas)Día de cumpleaños libreObra Social OSDE o Swiss Medical incluyendo grupo familiarFrutas / Yogures / Snacks in companyDescuento en MegatlonMúltiples descuentos en instituciones educativasNutrición y masajes in company Excelente clima laboral y oportunidad de desarrollo profesionalSi te interesan nuevos desafíos y queres crecer profesionalmente no dudes en postularte!Sumate a Navent 🧡 Te estamos esperando!¿Conocés Navent? Somos una empresa multinacional de tecnológía que brinda soluciones al mundo de bienes raíces. Líderes en clasificados online con presencia en 7 países de la región. Ayudamos a que las personas logren uno de los anhelos más importantes de la vida encontrar un hogar. Somos parte del Grupo Quinto Andar, la mayor plataforma de vivienda de América Latina que ofrece una experiencia directa, sencilla y transparente para quienes buscan un lugar para vivir y para quienes tienen una vivienda para alquilar o vender.Todas las personas que elegimos trabajar en Navent formamos equipos dinámicos, orientados a resultados, innovadores y en constante crecimiento que dan lugar a un excelente clima laboral y oportunidades de desarrollo de carreraSi te sumas, vas a encontrar un ambiente 100% digital, desafiante, donde haces propios los proyectos y todos los días se puede aprender y agregar valor 💜✨

title: Finance Master Data Junior Analyst
description: R00123042ChampionX is seeking qualified candidates for a future role as an Finance Master Data Junior Analyst for our Global Financial Services team, which provides administrative back office services to ChampionX globally. This position is located in Buenos Aires, Argentina. If you are a proactive professional with a high level of responsibility, are service oriented, and want to be part of a strong, professional team, we invite you to apply!What’s In It For YouPositive work environment where you’ll be able to combine your job with your bachelor studiesOpportunity for a long term, advanced career path inside or outside ArgentinaExposure to global projects, working with different cultures and with travel opportunitiesThe support of an organization that believes it is vital to include and engage diverse people, perspectives and ideas to achieve our bestThe opportunity to have your first work experience in a world class company that works to make the world cleaner, safer and healthier – protecting people and vital resource.What You Will DoCreate & modifiy vendor, customer, & financial master data in Oracle and/or SAPReview and confirm proper supporting documentation for each action performedPerform independent banking validation proceduresAssist in data clean up and maintenance projectsPreparation of supporting documentation for Audit purposesProvide support according to the SLAsComply with Company and deparment policies, processes, procedures, and valuesMinimum QualificationsExperience working with Microsoft Office Suite (Intermediate Excel Knowledge)Experience working with Oracle and/or SAP ERP SystemsCurrently enrolled in or have completed a Bachelor’s in Finance related programEnglish ProficiencyProficient in ExcelPortuguese and other languages is a plusKnowledgeProcess and detail orientedAbility to analyze data & deliver resultsStrong interpersonal skills and works well in a team environmentAbout ChampionXChampionX is a global leader in providing chemistry programs and services, drilling technology, artificial lift solutions, and automation technologies for the upstream and midstream oil and gas industry. Our world-class safety culture fuels our purpose to improve lives through our commitment to deliver sustainable operations.Our Commitment to Diversity and InclusionAt ChampionX, we believe the best teams are diverse and inclusive, and we are on a journey to create a workplace where every employee can grow and achieve their best. We are committed to fair and equal treatment of employees and applicants. We recruit, hire, promote, transfer and provide opportunities for advancement on the basis of individual qualifications and job performance. In all matters affecting employment, compensation, benefits, working conditions, and opportunities for advancement, we will not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, religion, color, creed, national origin, citizenship status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expressions, genetic information, marital status, age, disability, or status as a covered veteran.In addition, we are committed to furthering the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) through Affirmative Action (AA). Our goal is to fully utilize minority, female, disabled and covered veteran individuals at all levels of the workforce.We will consider for employment all qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable state and local laws, including the City of Los Angeles’ Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance and the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

title: Sr. Data Analyst - Mix (On Site & Remoto) (1255)
description: ¿Qué hace la compañía?Es una empresa multinacional, con sede en más de 80 países y que emplea a más de 4500 personas en todo el mundo, quienes trabajan dentro de una cultura colaborativa y horizontal.Sus antecedentes se remontan a casi 100 años prestando servicios en certificaciones de calidad, inspecciones y gestión del riesgo. Su presencia global y su historia la han llevado a un proceso continúo de evolución tecnológica.¿Qué buscan?A Nivel PersonalCapacidad y agilidad intelectual.Habilidad para adaptarse y relacionarse.Identificación y compromiso.Actitud de servicio y orientación al cliente.Autonomía y búsqueda de la mejora continua.Disponibilidad para viajar al interior y exterior del país.¿Qué necesitás para ser parte del equipo?5 años de experiencia en análisis, automatización y mejora de procesos de elaboración de reportes y tableros.Desarrollo de soluciones con Power BI. | Excluyente.Inglés conversacional intermedio avanzado para interactuar con equipos distribuidos.Manejo avanzado de MS Excel.Experiencia en relevamiento y diseño de sistemas.Graduado/a de Carreras en Sistemas o Administración.Es Un Plus Si Contas Con Experiencia EnMS SharePoint.Planificación de mantenimiento evolutivo y correctivo.Soporte a Usuario final (incidentes y requerimientos).¿Qué vas a hacer?Formarás parte del equipo de Desarrollo de Proyectos de Business Intelligence. Tendrás como objetivo principal relevar y analizar los procesos y necesidades de las diferentes áreas de negocio de clientes internos/externos para diseñar soluciones de datos que hagan más eficientes y mejoren notoriamente el día a día de sus analistas y gerentes.Tus Objetivos SeránComprender y facilitar la integración de los diferentes procesos de la compañía.Desarrollar, configurar y comunicar información importante que respalde la toma de decisiones en diferentes sectores de la empresa.Manejo y resolución de incidencias usando como principal herramienta Power BI.¿Cuándo y dónde trabajarás?Trabajarás en un esquema híbrido con un día de presencialidad según localización. Las oficinas están en Beccar, San Isidro. El horario es de Lunes a Viernes de 9 a 18 hs.¿Qué ofrecen?Prepaga para grupo familiar.Bono anual en USD.14+7 días de vacaciones.Capacitaciones internas y externas, en idiomas y en tecnologías. Cobertura de gastos por conexión.Esquema Home Office.¿De qué fases consta el proceso de selección?Tendrás una primera entrevista con nuestro Recruiter, Agustín Reynoso, para conocer tus experiencias laborales e intereses.Luego una entrevista con el Líder del Equipo de Datos y una segunda entrevista con el Gerente de Tecnología.

title: Research Analyst – Digital Content Services
description: IMPORTANT NOTE: Please, send your CV in English, otherwise your application will not be considered The Opportunity An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Research Analyst professional based in Buenos Aires to play a key role in the growth of the Information & Communication Technologies(ICT) research team. This position requires the candidate to help build our business practice by developing insightful strategic research, proactively supporting client engagements and some business development activities.As a Research Analyst with Frost & Sullivan, you will contribute to the focus and content of our ICT team. The primary goal of the Research Analyst is to produce high quality syndicated market intelligence deliverables (and/or custom). This requires utilizing market research methods such as primary and secondary data collection. Primary research, which implies dialogs with high level executives about strategic market information and perspective, is a core component of Frost & Sullivan’s methodology.As part of the analyst team, you will collect and analyze data on market conditions & business opportunities, author market studies, develop relationships and conduct interviews with major market players. You will also act as the lead/support analyst on custom consulting projects within the Information & Communication Technologies industry developing and presenting business strategies to our clients that range from global multinational companies to start ups. You will become one the foremost experts on the ICT area. The successful candidate will also do proactive business development with new as well as existing clients.Today, more than ever before, companies must innovate, not only to survive, but thrive in the future. Frost & Sullivan has spent 60 years guiding our clients toward transformational growth strategies by focusing on innovation opportunities driven by disruptive technologies, mega trends, emerging markets and new business models. This is your opportunity to be part of a revolutionary global team that truly inspires positive global changes.Learn more about Frost & Sullivan: http://tinyurl.com/Frost-Sullivan-overviewResponsibilities Primary and secondary data research collection, forecasting, strategic analysis.  Develop research studies globally, which include market sizing, market insights, end-user research, startup ecosystem tracking, trends per vertical segments.  Quantitative and forecast model building (with high analytical input process) and Research report writing  Market analysis from both the demand and competitive sides, analyze future trends and market drivers, restraints and challenges.  Monitor digital content services, including markets such as gaming, audio/video streaming, digital advertising, and content delivery networks, among others.  Evaluate the effect of the metaverse in digital content services and contribute to the industry forums discussions  Assist in client consulting assignments and analyst inquiry assignments. Qualifications A relevant university degree (BA, BS) in business, marketing, market research, economics, journalism, or technology. Master’s degree preferred.  An analytical thought process, with outstanding written and verbal communication skills and business level fluency in English.  Previous experience in Tech companies, Telecom operators, market research firms or consulting firms.  Strong intellectual curiosity, an aptitude for understanding new and old business models, and the ability to see new trends or emerging structures.  Solid communications skills (written and oral).  Ability to work independently while meeting project deadlines and following corporate procedures  Entrepreneur spirit – from Execution to the Board room.  Strong organizational and analytical skills are critical.  Must be able to work within a team environment, geographically distributed, as well as autonomously. Benefits Annual base salary plus variable compensation plan.  Monday-Friday 9am-6pm (flexible work schedule options available).  Healthy Snacks.  Healthcare Insurance OSDE 210.  Discounts & Benefits platform.  Meal Vouchers. Why Frost & Sullivan is important to your career enhancement: Learn to leverages visionary innovation to address the global challenges of collapse, disruption, and transformation  Enhance your skills to discover growth opportunities and be part of a team, that for more than 60 years, has been developing high impact growth strategies for emerging business and for the global 1000  You will be part of a winning, global team that fosters team work and an Olympic spirit while enhancing your communication and people skills  Encouragement to develop your intellectual curiosity and will be provided the ability to collaborate across all levels of the company across the globe  Have a definitive career trajectory with numerous growth opportunities and career paths available to you  Be part of a "best in class" global team that strives for excellence in work and social engagements About Frost & SullivanFrost & Sullivan, the Growth Partnership Company, works in collaboration with clients to leverage visionary innovation that addresses the global challenges and related transformational growth opportunities that will make or break today's market participants. For more than 50 years, we have developed growth strategies for the global 1000, emerging businesses, the public sector and the investment community. Our “Growth Partnership” supports clients by addressing these opportunities and constructs the foundation upon which visionary innovation becomes possible. This includes our 360 degree research, comprehensive industry coverage, strategy, vision, innovation and implementation.

title: Data Engineer Consultant
description: At AlixPartners we solve the most complex and critical challenges by moving quickly from analysis to action when it really matters; creating value that has a lasting impact on companies, their people, and the communities they serve. We prize diversity and inclusion, the intellectually curious, the inventive, and the forward-thinking. We invite you to influence the way we work, and define the way we embrace tomorrow.What You’ll DoAre you passionate about a future that exceeds your expectations? Here, at AlixPartners your passion becomes your career. We work in smaller and more senior teams that bring deep industry and functional knowledge to our clients. You will sit shoulder-to-shoulder with C-Level executives to address the issues that sit at the top of their agendas - and often become front-page news.If you join our practice, you will work with financially secure, under-performing, and distressed companies across a variety of urgent, high impact situations. Our elite professionals are recognized experts in their respective fields, bringing to bear their skills and experience to craft measurable, improved outcomes for our clients.In this role, you will have the chance to create ELT/ETL workflows, scripts, visualizations, and statistical models while taking responsibility for the design, build, test, execution, and support of data-related activities including but not limited to integration, profiling, cleansing, and visualizing. The ideal candidate will have a detailed understanding of the underlying data and data structures of multiple systems to allow in-depth analysis of existing and potential data insights.Data ManipulationCollect data from a wide variety of enterprise databases, including Redshift, MSSQL, Synapse, Excel, plain or formatted text files, etc.Implement automated data ingestion and transformation processes.Enrich client data through external and public sources.Data OrganizationBuild effective, reliable, and robust processes that govern the data ingestion flow.Design database models, efficient table structures, and advanced schemas that carry out data quality and consistency standards.Apply modern modeling approaches, business intelligence patterns, and data management techniques.Data AnalysisRock-solid SQL skills to work with extensive volumes –billions of rows- of data at various aggregation levels.Review and analyze legacy code/scripts to understand data processing logic and business rules.Apply statistical learning toolsets to build predictive models that enrich, expand, and allow a deeper understanding of data analyses and solutions.Data VisualizationUse of interactive data visualization tools, such as Tableau and Power BI, to present results in a compelling manner, for the benefit of internal or client teams.Ability to tell a convincing story to C-level executives using visual charts and dashboards.Present complicated technical findings to a non-technical audience.Business insightCollaborate with clients and stakeholders, with the ability to build relationships, influence, and provide advice to key decision-makers.Prepare client-ready documents and compelling presentation materials.What You’ll NeedBachelor’s degree with concentration in Computer Sciences, Engineering, or another quantitative related field.More than three years of experience in roles with similar characteristics.Comfort with big data architectures, both on cloud platforms like AWS/Azure/others and on-premise.Knowledge of any of the following languages: Python, JavaScript, C#, PowerShell or similar plus familiarity with at least one ETL tool (such as Alteryx, Data Factory, Data Bricks, SSIS).Capability to be a creative, innovative problem solver —but using simple ideas.Motivated to discover and learn new analytical techniques and software tools to improve the quality of our work.Strong verbal and written communication skills in English and Spanish. Proficiency in other languages is a plus.Authorized to work in Argentina and travel freely internationally without restrictions or visa sponsorship.Ability and willingness to work long hours and travel to meet client demands, if necessary.Desire to actively engage in geographically dispersed teams.Ability to work full time in an office and remote environment.Ability to work full time in an office and remote environment; physically able to sit/stand at a computer and work in front of a computer screen for significant portions of the workday.This description is not designed to encompass a comprehensive listing of required activities, duties or responsibilities.AlixPartners is a results-driven global consulting firm that specializes in helping businesses successfully address their most complex and critical challenges. You can learn more about our Culture and Career Development opportunities,All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to among other things, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, (age), status as a protected veteran, or disability. AlixPartners is a proud Silver award-winning Veteran Friendly Employer.https://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf

title: IT Business Analyst
description: We are hiring a business analyst to join our project team. You will work alongside other business analysts and report directly to the project manager. Your main tasks will include performing detailed requirements analysis, documenting processes, and performing some user acceptance testing. To succeed in this role, you should have a natural analytical way of thinking and be able to explain difficult concepts to non-technical users.Business Analyst Responsibilities:Evaluating business processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, and developing and implementing solutions. Leading ongoing reviews of business processes and developing optimization strategies. Conducting meetings and presentations to share ideas and findings. Performing requirements analysis. Documenting and communicating the results of your efforts. Effectively communicating your insights and plans to cross-functional team members and management. Gathering critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and producing useful reports. Allocating resources and maintaining cost efficiency. Ensuring solutions meet business needs and requirements. Performing user acceptance testing. Managing projects, developing project plans, and monitoring performance. Updating, implementing, and maintaining procedures. Prioritizing initiatives based on business needs and requirements. Serving as a liaison between stakeholders and users. Managing competing resources and priorities. Monitoring deliverables and ensuring timely completion of projects. Business Analyst Requirements:A bachelor’s degree in business or related field or an MBA. A minimum of 5 years of experience in business analysis or a related field. Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills. The ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them to determine acceptable solutions. Excellent documentation skills. Fundamental analytical and conceptual thinking skills. Experience creating detailed reports and giving presentations. Competency in Microsoft applications including Word, Excel, and Outlook. A track record of following through on commitments. Excellent planning, organizational, and time management skills. A history of leading and supporting successful projects. Why Join Teladoc Health?A New Category in Healthcare:  Teladoc Health is transforming the healthcare experience and empowering people everywhere to live healthier lives.  Our Work Truly Matters: Recognized as the world leader in whole-person virtual care, Teladoc Health uses proprietary health signals and personalized interactions to drive better health outcomes across the full continuum of care, at every stage in a person’s health journey.  Make an Impact: In more than 175 countries and ranked Best in KLAS for Virtual Care Platforms in 2020, Teladoc Health leverages more than a decade of expertise and data-driven insights to meet the growing virtual care needs of consumers and healthcare professionals.  Focus on PEOPLE:  Teladoc Health has been recognized as a top employer by numerous media and professional organizations. Talented, passionate individuals make the difference, in this fast-moving, collaborative, and inspiring environment. Diversity and Inclusion:  At Teladoc Health we believe that personal and professional diversity is the key to innovation. We hire based solely on your strengths and qualifications, and the way in which those strengths can directly contribute to your success in your new position.  Growth and Innovation:  We’ve already made healthcare yet remain on the threshold of very big things. Come grow with us and support our mission to make a tangible difference in the lives of our Members. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we never have and never will discriminate against any job candidate or employee due to age, race, religion, color, ethnicity, national origin, gender, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, membership in an employee organization, medical condition, family history, genetic information, veteran status, marital status, parental status or pregnancy.

title: Ref 4898 Data Engineer Con Ingle´S Avanzado O Bilingue Ingle´S

Summary:DATA ENGINEER We are looking for an experienced data engineer to join our team. You will use various methods to transform raw data into useful data systems. Key duties include processing data sources within rules on MySQL queries and arranging that data. This includes providing support for other members of the team as necessary to enhance the operation usage of the system. To succeed in this data engineering position, you should have strong analytical skills and the ability to combine data from different sources. Data engineer skills also include familiarity with several programming languages and knowledge of learning machine methods. If you are detail-oriented, with excellent organizational skills and experience in this field, we’d like to hear from you. Responsibilities Analyze and organize raw data Build data systems and ETL pipelines Evaluate business needs and objectives Interpret trends and patterns Migrate, optimize and clean data structures Prepare data for prescriptive and predictive modeling Combine raw information from different sources Explore ways to enhance data quality and reliability Identify opportunities for data acquisition Develop analytical tools and programs Collaborate with data analysts on several projects Requirements and skills Previous experience as a data engineer or in a similar role Previous experience migrating and cleaning databases Technical expertise with data models, data mining, and segmentation techniques Knowledge of programming languages ( Bash and Python) Experience with Docker and Airflow Hands-on experience with SQL database design Excellent numerical and analytical skills Knowledge about Excel reporting (pivot tables, importing data, etc) Experience working with Data Warehouses / Data lakes Benefits: Competitive salary based on years of experience. A positive work environment Joining Period: Immediate Note: Good written and oral English communication skills are essential, as we have our team all over the globe and English is the common language Enviar CV en ingle´s con remuneracio´n neta en do´lares pretendida a los email de IMPLEMENTAR Consultores SRL ******; con copia a ****** Adicionalmente a su presentacio´n a trave´s del presente portal.- Gracias. title: Data Engineer
description: Job DescriptionEn Baufest queremos mejorar la vida con tecnología, por lo que nos encontramos en la búsqueda de un Data Engineer para sumar a nuestro equipo con ganas de aprender las mejores prácticas y desempeñarse en un importante proyecto.Responsabilidades Desempeñará un papel fundamental en la puesta en práctica de análisis de datos para las iniciativas de negocios. Deberá poder recurrir a su conocimiento empresarial trabajando con desarrolladores de bases de datos, arquitectos de DB, analistas de calidad de datos, y otros equipos mientras gestiona sin problemas las relaciones con los clientes dentro del contexto del rol individual. Será esencial colaborar con otros equipos para utilizar nuevas fuentes de datos, con el fin de desarrollar conocimientos y su posterior aplicación. Trabajará con grandes y complejos volúmenes de datos, resolverá problemas de análisis aplicando métodos analíticos según sea necesario. Llevará adelante análisis y recopilación de datos de varias plataformas de almacenamiento de datos, relevamiento de requisitos, tareas de procesamiento de datos, diversas técnicas de análisis y presentaciones internas de clientes.Requisitos Principales SQL (Avanzado). Experiencia en ingesta de datos a partir de API. Conocimientos Teradata, IPC, Phyton.Requisitos Deseables Experiencia trabajando y obteniendo información de grandes conjuntos de datos. Noción de Arquitectura de Datos. Experiencia en el uso de herramientas de visualización de datos (Por ejemplo: Microstrategy, Tableau, PowerBI). Conocimientos de metodologías ágiles.Te Ofrecemos BAU COMPENSATIONS: Pago parcial de tu sueldo en Dólares. Ajustes trimestrales. Evaluación anual de desempeño y revisión de categorización. BAU LUNCH: Recibirás un cupón de Pedidos Ya cada viernes del mes. BAU INTERNET: Reintegro mensual parcial de tu factura. BAU ANTI-TRAFFIC: En caso de que tu contratación sea en modalidad Híbrida, tendrás opción de elegir tu rango de horario laboral mientras lo avale el proyecto. BAU UTLITIES: ¡Luego de trabajar 3 años con la misma notebook en Baufest, será tuya! BAU FAMILY: Maternidad y Paternidad. Softlanding para las madres baufesianas y Paternidad (10 días hábiles de licencia) . Flexibilidad horaria planificada; BAU HEALTH: Medicina prepaga de primer nivel para grupo familiar; Reintegro trimestrales por actividad deportiva, clases de yoga y Bienestar. BAU DAYs: Día de cumpleaños Libre BAU ACADEMY: Clases de Inglés in-company; Certificaciones y capacitaciones a cargo de Baufest; Pro Profes (días extra de estudios, premios para estudiantes Universitarios/Terciarios/Posgrados); BAU HOME: Luego de 2 años en Baufest, si tienes que cambiar tu residencia y mudarte recibirás una orden de compra para acompañarte en este gran paso. Excelente Clima Laboral ¡Estamos dentro de los 5 mejores lugares para trabajar de acuerdo a la encuentra Great Place to Work!Si estás en la búsqueda de un cambio en tu carrera que sume a tu perfil profesional, vení a trabajar como parte de nuestro equipo. Ofrecemos posibilidades de desarrollo acorde al desempeño en un excelente ambiente de trabajo.¡Te esperamos!

title: Business Information Analyst I
description: Job Family: Data Warehousing and Business InformationType: Full timeDate Posted:Dec 27, 2022Req #: JR39182Location:VA, NorfolkNational +50 Miles away from nearest PulsePoint, National +50 Miles away from nearest PulsePointNC, WinstonDescriptionBusiness Information Analyst IFully RemoteMonday-Friday 8am-5pm/9am-6pmThe Business Information Analyst I is responsible for collecting, analyzing, and reporting on data related to one or several but very similar business metrics.Primary Duties May Include, But Are Not Limited ToWorks on complex business needs, develops epics and user stories, manages backlog in tools and research issues thorough subject matter expertise and understanding of business processes.Triages and approves SNOW requests or directly configures the system to meet corporate clinical needs. Provide support and consultation to regional clinical operations staff on configuration and administrative system features.Maintain resource and training documents on system enhancements and features for supervisory and clinical operations staff reference.Works closely with IT BSA, Business Owners, Product Managers and/or Product Owners to ensure business needs are captured, prioritized, and understood to manage stakeholders' expectations.Assists in the analysis of the functional business requirements and implementation details to ensure design meets nonfunctional requirements.Provides system and clinical consultation and support to implementation and regional leads and participates in new client implementation activities.Contributes to the development of operational readiness documentation and training materials to support rollout adoption and use of the system /functionality as needed.Coordination and oversight of end user testing of clinical system enhancements.Demonstrated ability with a collaborative approach in working in a team environment and a comfort level in daily interactions with stakeholders at all levels.Adheres to the current Software Delivery Life Cycle (SDLC). Anticipates and identifies opportunities for improving including SDLC business processes and innovation.Agile principles and mindsets to be used to accomplish deliverables and communication.Provide direction and guidance to team members and serves as an expert for the team.Entails 6 hours up to 2 days dedicated to testing on weekends or evenings including late evenings several times a year (approximately 8 instances a year).Minimum RequirementsRequires High School diploma; or any combination of education and experience which provides an equivalent background.Preferred QualificationsBS/BA degree preferred.Aptitude for understanding and leveraging technology.Behavioral/Mental Health Experience preferred.A minimum of two years’ experience strongly preferred.Analytical and problem-solving skills strongly preferred.Proficient in statistical use of Microsoft Excel and Access or other general reporting tools strongly preferred.For candidates working in person or remotely in the below locations, the salary* range for this specific position is $23.94 to $35.94Locations: Colorado; Nevada, Jersey City, NJ; New York City, NY; Ithaca, NY and Westchester County, NYIn addition to your salary, Elevance Health offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). The salary offered for this specific position is based on a number of legitimate, non-discriminatory factors set by the company. The company is fully committed to ensuring equal pay opportunities for equal work regardless of gender, race, or any other category protected by federal, state, and local pay equity laws .The salary range is the range Elevance Health in good faith believes is the range of possible compensation for this role at the time of this posting. This range may be modified in the future and actual compensation may vary from posting based on geographic location, work experience, education and/or skill level. Even within the range, the actual compensation will vary depending on the above factors as well as market/business considerations. No amount is considered to be wages or compensation until such amount is earned, vested, and determinable under the terms and conditions of the applicable policies and plans. The amount and availability of any bonus, commission, benefits, or any other form of compensation and benefits that are allocable to a particular employee remains in the Company's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified at the Company’s sole discretion, consistent with the law.Please be advised that Elevance Health only accepts resumes from agencies that have a signed agreement with Elevance Health. Accordingly, Elevance Health is not obligated to pay referral fees to any agency that is not a party to an agreement with Elevance Health. Thus, any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of Elevance Health.Be part of an Extraordinary TeamElevance Health is a health company dedicated to improving lives and communities – and making healthcare simpler. Previously known as Anthem, Inc., we have evolved into a company focused on whole health and updated our name to better reflect the direction the company is heading.We are looking for leaders at all levels of the organization who are passionate about making an impact on our members and the communities we serve. You will thrive in a complex and collaborative environment where you take action and ownership to solve problems and lead change. Do you want to be part of a larger purpose and an evolving, high-performance culture that empowers you to make an impact?We offer a range of market-competitive total rewards that include merit increases, paid holidays, Paid Time Off, and incentive bonus programs (unless covered by a collective bargaining agreement), medical, dental, vision, short and long term disability benefits, 401(k) +match, stock purchase plan, life insurance, wellness programs and financial education resources, to name a few.The health of our associates and communities is a top priority for Elevance Health. We require all new candidates to become vaccinated against COVID-19. If you are not vaccinated, your offer will be rescinded unless you provide – and Elevance Health approves – a valid religious or medical explanation as to why you are not able to get vaccinated that Elevance Health is able to reasonably accommodate. Elevance Health will also follow all relevant federal, state and local laws.Elevance Health has been named as a Fortune Great Place To Work in 2021, is ranked as one of the 2021 World’s Most Admired Companies among health insurers by Fortune magazine, and a Top 20 Fortune 500 Companies on Diversity and Inclusion.
