title: Data Solutions Analyst
description: About UsFlexiti is one of Canada’s fastest growing fintech lenders. We aim to make our customers’ lives more affordable and help our retail partners grow their sales by offering flexible financing options. Through our award-winning omni-channel platform, customers can be approved instantly to shop with their FlexitiCard®, which they can use online or in-store to make multiple purchases, within their credit limit, without needing to reapply.At Flexiti, we work hard, we love what we do, and we have some fun along the way! If you are looking for an energizing and innovative work environment with great people and big ideas, we’d love to have you join us! To learn more about Flexiti, please visit www.flexiti.com Data Solutions AnalystFlexiti is looking for a resourceful person who will be responsible for end-to-end database design, development, testing, review, and implementation of code into existing databases for all levels of the Software Development Lifecycle.What you will be doing:Analyze business, IT and data requirements, document data solutions and ETL processes, and support implementation of data solutions (OLTP & OLAP) accordingly.Collaborate with Product Owners, PMs, Scrum masters and participate in projects to support data engineering requirements, design and testingPartner with analytics and business teams to improve data models that feed business intelligence toolsPerform analyses on existing data models, pipeline, processes, etc., and document findings and provide recommendations and action plans to update or improve them for corporate projects and improvement initiativesDevelop Advanced T-SQL such as temporal tables, PIVOTs, recursive table expressions, dynamic SQL as well as high complexity, fast performing SELECT queries, T-SQL procedures, functions, triggers, views, jobs, scripts to support data operations and DW users.Optimize SQL statements executed by end users/ETL code as required; Test and troubleshoot ETL job functionality, validate database objects and structures through use of SQL and other meansDrive optimization, testing and tooling to improve data quality; Test and troubleshoot ETL job functionality, validate database objects and structures through use of SQL and other meansWork closely with QA Test Engineers to develop and execute test cases and ensure appropriate test coverageWhat you should have:3 years of experience in Databases with a least one year of business or systems analysisKnowledge of MSSQL, MongoDB, SOAP/XML, REST/JSONUnderstanding of ELT and ETL and hands on experience with SSIS, SSRS (development and some admin experience)Experience with data modeling (OLTP and OLAP) using Erwin, Visio or similar toolsExperience in all aspects of SDLCWorking knowledge of AWS Cloud (RDS)Spark, R and python experience are an assetFamiliarity with ad-hoc file transfer solution/s, such as FTP, HTTPExperience with modeling Power BI data modeling, designing dashboards is desirableFinancial services experience is an assetWhy you would love to work here:You’ll be a part of an award-winning, fast-growing companyOur innovative culture promotes on-going learning opportunities with training and mentorshipCompetitive compensation package commensurate to experience plus benefitsA work from anywhere mentality!Flexiti embraces diversity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, creed, sex, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, or family status. If you require disability-related accommodation during the application or interview process, simply let us know and we’ll work with you to ensure you have a positive experience.

title: Sr. Marketing Data Analyst
description: #SomosNaranjaX, mucho más que una fintech. Trabajamos por la educación e inclusión financiera de toda la región. Generamos una experiencia tecnológica para que nuestros más de 5 millones de clientes puedan acceder a un mundo de posibilidades a través de nuestros productos y acompañarlos en el uso cotidiano de su dinero.Estamos siempre en movimiento, nuestro stack tecnológico de vanguardia nos permite crear un ecosistema de productos y servicios con soluciones simples e ingeniosas para nuestros clientes: cuenta Naranja X, soluciones de cobro, tarjetas de crédito y débito, préstamos, seguros, viajes y más. ¿Querés ser protagonista de impulsar la transformación financiera de millones de personas? ¡Sumate!¿Qué desafíos vas a encontrar en esta posición?Como Marketing Data Analytics del equipo de Adquisición B2B, serás el responsable de analizar, visualizar e interpretar los resultados de las campañas y acciones de marketing, y apoyar la toma de decisiones basadas en datos para alcanzar los objetivos del negocioPrincipales responsabilidades:Desarrollar y mantener tableros de visualización que reflejen los resultados de las campañas de marketing.Interpretar y analizar los datos para obtener conclusiones relevantes y significativas que aporten insights para optimizar las campañas.Realizar proyecciones de obejtivos en base al análisis e interpretación de los datos.Establecer vínculos con diferentes áreas técnicas y de negocio, para ser parte de proyectos de analítica que impacten en los objetivos de Adquisición B2B.Utilizar los modelos predictivos existentes.Traccionar los KR (key results) detectando y proponiendo iniciativas de experimentación.Participar activamente en las ceremonias de la metodología Agile del equipo.¿Qué buscamos?Experiencia de al menos 3 años en posiciones similares.Uso avanzado de analítica digital (GA, Appsflyer, Amplitude, Adobe Analytics, etc).Uso o conocimiento básico de Snowflake, DBeaver o herramientas similares (SQL).Experiencia o conocimiento básico de técnicas de research, estadísticas (medidas, prueba de hipótesis, etc.).Experiencia o conocimientos básicos de herramientas de explotación de datos (SQL), dashboarding (Data Studio, Power BI).Conocimiento básico de herramientas de modelización descriptiva y predictiva de datos (cubos, forecast, árboles, etc).Se valorará:Conocimiento avanzado de medios de comunicación on/off en términos exclusivamente de métricas y atribución.Conocimientos avanzados de procesos de modelización descriptiva y predictiva de datos (evolución de proyecciones).Conocimientos avanzados de estadística (intervalos de confianza, etc.).Conocimientos en Data Storytelling.Sumarte a la Experiencia X es:📍 Remote First: Trabajá desde casa, oficina o mixto, ¡vos elegís!🌍 #WorkFromAnywhere: Desde cualquier parte del país o el mundo🌴 Tres semanas de vacaciones desde el inicio💸 Ajustes de sueldo trimestrales y bono por performance❤️ Cobertura de Prepaga Prémium para vos y tu familia💻 #TuConexión: Reintegros por gastos de internet y servicios🤩 Escalá tu desarrollo a través de programas de capacitación constante y plataformas de E-learning (Udemy)👶 Licencia extendida y flexibilidad al regreso para gestantes y no gestantes. Licencias especiales para el cuidado de hij@▶️ Y muchos beneficios más para que Naranja X sea el lugar para desarrollar todo tu potencialNaranja ahora es Naranja X:Porque a la cercanía y la calidez por la que siempre nos diferenciamos, ahora le sumamos la tecnología, la innovación y el ingenio de la X.

exchange protocols1+ years of SQL experience to write and understand SQL scriptsKnowledge of MSSQL & DatabricksUnderstanding of ELT and ETL and hands-on experience with SSISComfortable in an Agile Development environment that requires the ability to adapt to change and motivate others to achieve excellence in a dynamic environment and will bring exceptional attention to detail and commitment to qualityExperience in all aspects of SDLCExperience with version control software (ideally bitbucket)Working knowledge of AWS Cloud (RDS)Spark, R and python experience are an assetFinancial services experience is an assetAdvanced English levelFlexiti embraces diversity. title: BI Analyst
description: Charles Taylor InsureTech is looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst.Key ResponsibilitiesDevelop and support dashboards and reports for business.Analyzing and investigating Data Quality issues, system data flows and overall data architecture. Resolves problems by identifying and selecting solutions using acquired technical experienceFormulates and defines systems scope and objectives for moderately complex projects through research and fact-finding combined with an understanding of applicable business systems and industry standards. Required skillsStrong expertise using BI Tools and ETL Tools: MicroStrategy, Integration Services/TalendStrong expertise in SQL: MS SQL / OracleAgile methodologies expertise.Bilingual (Spanish/English) with excellent written, verbal communication skills Why Charles Taylor InsureTech?The Charles Taylor InsureTech team blends hands-on insurance expertise with fresh thinking from the worlds of technology consulting, financial services, ecommerce and beyond.As a newly established business which is part of Charles Taylor Plc, we combine the agility of a start up with the security and scale of a corporate. The result is a pragmatic-yet-pioneering approach that we’ve used to help clients reimagine central market systems, launch self-service digital insurance products, automate regulatory reporting requirements and more.We are very proud of the fact that nine out of ten of our people recommend Charles Taylor as a place to work. We pride ourselves on having a positive work environment where our people are empowered to make the best decisions and where learning is valued highly and shared across our business.We are very committed to ensuring our people are given continuous learning and development. As well as structured induction programmes and job training, we provide study support for relevant professional qualifications and have a Core Learning & Development Curriculum.Charles Taylor is a fun and inclusive place to work where people are truly valued and encouraged to enjoy a host of social and sporting activities available. Quiz nights, tennis tournaments, football matches and a range of other events take place throughout the year.

title: Senior Data Analyst, Growth
description: We believe in a world where homes are owned by regular people. Our mission is to provide authentic belonging experiences, empowering residents to become homeowners and homeowners to be financially free.Belong is changing what it means to rent a home by putting people first. It’s where hospitality meets consumer real estate—and it’s about to redefine an entire industry. We’re backed by Andreessen Horowitz (a16z), GGV Capital, Battery Ventures, and Fifth Wall just to name some of our all-star investors.We are looking for a Senior Product Analyst who will play a key role in growing our core products for homeowners and residents across several markets. The Senior Product Analyst is a role embedded within the product and engineering teams and is responsible for driving growth and strategic improvements through the end-to-end product development cycle. We are looking for someone with quantitative skills combined with strong business acumen and product sense as well as cross-functional collaboration skills.Responsibilities Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining of structured and unstructured data to extract key insights that drive strategic product and business decisions for BelongAbility to effectively present the data in a way that helps the company see and understand key insights into how our consumers interact with our ecosystem of productsIdentify growth opportunities that remove barriers to product adoption, engagement, retention, and monetization.Understand funnels, two-sided marketplace flywheels, multi-product ecosystems, and end-to-end consumer behaviors to shed light on the historical and future adoption of our products.Own, define, analyze and monitor metrics that help inform the health and success of Belong products in all markets we serve.Own, design, interpret and communicate A/B experiment results to product and stakeholder teams.Partner with cross-functional teams in product, business, and engineering teams on projects that identify new opportunities and help accelerate the growth and adoption of all products Influence teams across the company through the presentation of data-driven recommendations Demonstrate ability to switch between tactical execution and high-level strategyRequired QualificationsBS or MS degree in a technical discipline like Math, Statistics, Economics, Operations Research, or other relevant technical fields.4+ years of experience in a data analytics or data science role in an analytical, business strategy, marketing, or engineering organization.4+ years of experience with data querying and manipulation using SQL, Python, or R.Experience with design and running experiments  Strong communication and presentation skills.Self-starter, comfortable with ambiguity, experience initiating and driving projects with minimal oversight and guidance.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description: Key Duties & Responsibilities: Identify, analyze and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets Build reporting that displays actionable insights for the pricing analysts, RMleaders, and other stakeholders (Hedge Funds/Executive leadership) and beable to communicate results of analysis across various audiences Provide recommendations to the business by interpreting disparate data andtranslating ad hoc requests to consistently deliver relevant and impactfulresults. Serve as a liaison between the reporting & analytics team and the eventmanagement team to understand data needs. Ensure quality control over data, analyses and metrics. Identify flaws and errors in the data and any upstream data issues.Requirements: Critical thinker - the ability to determine the best way to structure data,measure and display performance metrics Strong written and verbal communication skills; comfortable presentingdata-heavy information in clear and concise manner to all levels of theorganization Comfortable with and adaptive to change Inquisitive & Analytical - search for meaning and patterns in data Organized & Strategic - align analysis/reporting with business needs Takes initiative - proactively communicates with team and identifies areas ofopportunity Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment 2-4 years BI experience with Tableau or similar tools 2-4 years BI experience with Alteryx or similar 2-4 years of experience using SQL and a deep understanding of relationaldatabases Excel experience Python experience preferred, not requiredEducation:Bachelors degree in a quantitative field; business background preferred

title: Data Engineer (Google Cloud Platform)
description: About YouYou are someone who wants to influence your own development. You’re looking for a company where you have the opportunity to pursue your interests and be able to grow professionally.You bring to Applaudo the following competencies:Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or a related field6+ Years of experience in data engineering3+ years of data delivery, ETL (extract, transform and load), and data warehouse design, analysis, and programming experience3+ years in Google Cloud Platform data pipeline enabling systems like DataProc, DataFlow, Pub/Sub, BigQueryExperience with Apache Beam or Apache SparkExperience with an excellent grasp of relational and dimensional data modelingExperience in one or more of the following DBMS: PostgreSQL, MySQL, Google Cloud Datastore, CosmosStrong mathematical, statistical, and analytics skills1+ years of Agile experienceExcellent communication, collaboration, and teamwork skillsEnglish is required, as you will work directly with US-based clientsYou will be accountable for the following responsibilities:Extract data from different sources and transfer it into a data warehouse environment.Designing, maintaining, and implementing transactional and analytical data storage structures.Design, build and maintain data pipelines, consuming from multiple sources and servicing multiple tenants.Model continuous learning by staying up on data systems, strategies, and best practices in Google Cloud Platform and SaaS platformsElaborate informative, expressive, and meaningful reports that support business decision-making processes through the information provided.Reporting and subsequently translating the emanating results into good technical and consistent data designs.Technical skills:Languages: Apache Beam, or Apache SparkCloud Provider: Google Cloud Platform.Willing to work from 9 am to 7 pm GTM-6 time zoneAdditional InformationHere at Applaudo Studios values as trust, communication, respect, excellence and team work are our keys to success. We know we are working with the best and thus treat each other with respect and admiration without asking.Submit your application today, and don't miss this opportunity to join the Best Digital team in the Region!We truly appreciate all the hard and outstanding work our team makes every day at Applaudo Studios, and that's why the perks that we offer, are deeply thought and designed as a way to thank them for their commitment and excellence.Some of our perks and benefits:Work from homeFlexible scheduleCelebrationsSpecial discountsEntertainment areaFlexible workspacesGreat work environmentPrivate medical insurance*Benefits may vary according to your location and/or availability. Request further information when applying.

title: Data Engineer Python
description: En Baufest queremos mejorar la vida con tecnología, por lo que nos encontramos en la búsqueda de un Data Engineer Python para sumarse a un desafiante proyecto.ResponsabilidadesEl Ingeniero de Datos deberá poseer habilidades de TI, ingesta de datos, análisis de datos y comprensión empresarial.Desempeñará un papel fundamental en la puesta en práctica de análisis de datos para las iniciativas de negocios.Deberá tener experiencia en conceptos de bases de datos; integración de datos.Deberá poder recurrir a su conocimiento empresarial trabajando con desarrolladores de bases de datos, arquitectos de DB, analistas de calidad de datos, y otros equipos mientras gestiona sin problemas las relaciones con los clientes dentro del contexto del rol individual.Será esencial colaborar con otros equipos para utilizar nuevas fuentes de datos, con el fin de desarrollar conocimientos y su posterior aplicación.Trabajará con grandes y complejos volúmenes de datos, resolverá problemas de análisis aplicando métodos analíticos según sea necesarioLlevará adelante análisis de principio a fin: trabajo que incluye la recopilación de datos de varias plataformas de almacenamiento de datos, relevamiento de requisitos, tareas de procesamiento de datos, diversas técnicas de análisis y presentaciones internas de clientes.Se espera que pueda trabajar en un entorno de trabajo dinámico, colaborativo y con proactividad.Requisitos PrincipalesSQL (Avanzado)Sólidos conocimientos en procesamiento de datos, utilizando Python (PYSPARK).Conocimientos de Spark.Experiencia en ingesta de datos a partir de API.Modelado de Datos (Data Waterhouse / Data Lake). (No excluyente)Experiencia trabajando y obteniendo información de grandes conjuntos de datos.Noción de Arquitectura de Datos.Experiencia en el uso de herramientas de visualización de datos (Por ejemplo: Microstrategy, Tableau, PowerBI).Conocimientos de metodologías ágilesTe OfrecemosBAU COMPENSATIONS: Pago parcial de tu sueldo en Doláres. Ajustes trimestrales. Evaluación anual de desempeño y revisión de categorización.BAU LUNCH: Recibirás un cupón de Pedidos Ya cada viernes del mes.BAU INTERNET: Reintegro mensual parcial de tu factura.BAU ANTI-TRAFFIC: En caso de que tu contratación sea en modalidad Híbrida, tendrás opción de elegir tu rango de horario laboral mientras lo avale el proyecto.BAU UTLITIES: ¡Luego de trabajar 4 años con la misma notebook en Baufest, será tuya!BAU FAMILY: Maternidad y Paternidad. Softlanding para las madres baufesianas y Paternidad (10 días hábiles de licencia) . Flexibilidad horaria planificada;BAU HEALTH: Medicina prepaga de primer nivel para grupo familiar; Reintegro trimestrales por actividad deportiva, clases de yoga y Bienestar.BAU DAYs: Día de cumpleaños LibreBAU ACADEMY: Clases de Inglés in-company; Certificaciones y capacitaciones a cargo de Baufest; Pro Profes (días extra de estudios, premios para estudiantes Universitarios/Terciarios/Posgrados);BAU HOME: Luego de 2 años en Baufest, si tienes que cambiar tu residencia y mudarte recibirás una orden de compra para acompañarte en este gran paso.Excelente Clima Laboral ¡Estamos dentro de los 5 mejores lugares para trabajar de acuerdo a la encuentra Great Place to Work!

title: Data Products Engineer
description: In the time it takes you to read this job description, RapidSOS will have handled ~1,380 emergencies.At RapidSOS, we are committed to using technology to build a safer, stronger future and working together to save lives. We’re in an exciting phase of growth, welcoming new members from across the globe to our mission-driven, ambitious, and inclusive team. Our work is founded on our values of trust and safety, pioneering, urgency, and purpose over pride, all of which support a company culture where people can innovate, collaborate, grow, and, above all, make an impact. If that sounds like an exciting opportunity, we want to hear from you!IIn partnership with public safety, RapidSOS has created the world’s first emergency response data platform that securely links life-saving data from 450M+ connected devices directly to 911 and first responders in an emergency. Through the platform, we’re providing intelligent data that supports over 5,200 Emergency Communications Centers, protecting 95%+ of people in the US, across 150 million emergencies annually.What this role is about: At RapidSOS, we rely on insightful data to power our systems and solutions. We are looking for a motivated Data Products Engineer to join our team who will identify ways to make the Data Science organization more effective at ensuring data availability, quality, and consistency. You will work collaboratively with other data scientists, product managers, and our engineering teams to build a platform that provides life-saving data to dispatchers, currently covering over 95% of the US population.What you’ll do: Own the entire lifecycle of data products (ie. statistical and analytical models) from data ingestion to to the end consumption of the user which includes development of processes and pipelines, QA, deployment, etc.Automate and productize analytical processes and data pipelinesImplement statistical, analytical, and machine learning models to support the backend of our products to provide insights on 911 emergenciesManage processing of data ingestion and pipelining; ensure all critical data sources are being ingested into the data warehouseCollaborate with the data science team, machine learning engineers, and product stakeholders to ensure the end-to-end success of RapidSOS solutionsResearch publicly available sources and public APIs to incorporate and enrich the data that we use in our intelligent data platformWhat we’re looking for in our ideal candidate: 3+ years of experience in software engineering, data engineering and/or machine learning engineeringSolid background on software design, architecture, testing, continuous refactoring, TDD, deployment, APIsBS or higher in Computer Science or similarly quantitative/technical field or equivalent experience Experience with relational and NoSQL databasesExperience with any of the following object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python, Java, C++, Scala, etc. Team player - desire to work side by side with a diverse-background team of data scientists, both on statistical and ML modelsProject thinking and delivery - proven ability to be provided with a goal, be able to break it down into deliverables and tasks, and be able to successfully complete and deliver the projectExcellent oral and written communication skillsBonus (is a plus but not required, the team is willing to train on these topics!):Experience with any of the following technologies: Hadoop, Spark, ElasticSearchExperience with data pipeline and workflow management tools: Azkaban, Luigi, Airflow, etc.Experience with data processing architectures, machine learning modeling, ML Ops, statistics, data storytelling, and/or UI/UXExperience working with big data sets and the AWS ecosystemWhat we offer: The chance to work with a passionate team on solving one of the largest challenges globally Competitive salary and benefits and equity participation A dynamic, flexible and fun start-up work environment with a highly talented teamIf you're curious to learn more about RapidSOS, you can check out https://rapidsos.com/blog/ RapidSOS is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or Veteran status.

title: Remote SQL Developer/Data Analyst Jobs
description: A US-based company enabling consumer product brands to make better data-driven decisions is looking for a Data Analyst/SQL Developer. The developer will play a key role in helping the existing team develop the algorithms used to transform data from external SaaS platforms to a standard data model for the company’s product. The company works with some of the fastest scaling e-commerce brands to help them grow quicker by centralizing, analyzing, and pushing their data. The company has secured more than $20mn during its Series A round of funding. The selected candidate will work as a self-starter, adept at problem-solving and root-cause analysis to tackle complex issues at scale.Job Responsibilities:Develop SQL codes to perform ETL/ELT functions Work on research and analysis of requests from customers Curate data with SQL/Python using new data sources on Daasity Platform for evaluating distributions and data integrity Design and build data models best suited for analytics, reporting, and statistical analyses Take responsibility for developing LookML and Visualizations in Looker Collaborate with Product, Sales, and Marketing to understand requirements for product developmentJob Requirements:Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)At least 2-5 years of relevant experience as a business intelligence and/or SQL developerThorough knowledge of SQL/Python (Redshift or Snowflake preferred) Strong familiarity with BI tools like Looker Ability to prioritize projects and multitask whenever requiredWell versed with Shopify, NetSuite, or experience in D2C business would be beneficial

title: Data Engineer
description: The OpportunityTeladoc Health is transforming how people access and experience healthcare. Recognized as the world leader in virtual care, we are partnering with over a thousand clients to serve millions! of people around the globe every day. Teladoc Health offers a whole person virtual care platform that empowers all people everywhere to live their healthiest lives by transforming the healthcare experience, from acute and primary care to chronic care, mental health, and specialty care.Our team of data engineers aggregate and transform substantial amounts of health data and information to support actionable, personalized, and timely health signals for our members. This approach delivers better clinical and financial outcomes while creating a different and better healthcare experience for people everywhere. The applicant should have a strong interest in the interface between real-time and reporting systems, pulling data from multiple sources into central data storage, and collaborating with internal teams to help provide for their data needs.About YouYou flourish in a fast paced and highly collaborative team environment. You are a quicklearner and have the expert ability to prioritize tasks efficiently, while delivering high quality work. You understand that solutions provided by a Data Engineer, support in empowering an organization’s business in decision making. You will be part of a great working atmosphere, performing complex work in a collaborative team of amazing people, with forward-thinking managers. You will have the opportunity to make an impact.ResponsibilitiesData is significant at Teladoc and our data engineers design and develop data pipelines to integrate data across disparate systems and create tools and data sets to support data scienceWork with Python, Spark SQL, Scala, TensorFlow, Keras, SKL (or Scala/DL4J) to build production-grade machine learning (ML) pipelines and toolsPerform continuous integration to ensure that every step of a data pipeline is testable and automatedCollaborate closely with Teladoc Health’s ML experts, Data Scientists, Product Managers, and clinical researchers to define, analyze, and provide data that contributes to our mission of total health for our membersDocument code, provide progress reports, and perform code review and peer feedbackTrack milestones, activities and inter-dependencies across projects and tasks, with frequent status updates to stakeholdersContinuously evaluate and identify improvements in the system processes and architectureAssist in maintaining data quality and fidelity in production systemsParticipate in Agile planning around data feature requests and advocate for the best data engineering projects in priority planning.Candidate ProfileMust be fluent in English and SpanishBS degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field4+ years’ experience in software development/engineering (Various levels open)3+ years’ experience in a data engineering role (Various levels open)Strong experience with big data technologies, and skills in data processing using SparkExpertise in creating and maintaining production data pipelines using AirflowStrong SQL development experience (Postgres/MySQL/SQL Server/Oracle)Expertise in Python(preferred), Scala, or Java1+ years of experience working in Azure cloudExperience in performance tuning and query optimizationExperience in Cloud data engineering in Azure stack. Azure certification is a plus.Tool based data pipeline development experience is desirable (Talend/Informatica/ IBM Datastage).Streaming data flow experience is desirable (Kafka).Experience in deploying production pipelines in CI/CD environmentExcellent communication skills, supporting recommendations, design ideas, and analysis to team and stake holdersExperience in leading and guiding other data engineersWhy Join Teladoc Health?A New Category in Healthcare:  Teladoc Health is transforming the healthcare experience and empowering people everywhere to live healthier lives.  Our Work Truly Matters: Recognized as the world leader in whole-person virtual care, Teladoc Health uses proprietary health signals and personalized interactions to drive better health outcomes across the full continuum of care, at every stage in a person’s health journey.  Make an Impact: In more than 175 countries and ranked Best in KLAS for Virtual Care Platforms in 2020, Teladoc Health leverages more than a decade of expertise and data-driven insights to meet the growing virtual care needs of consumers and healthcare professionals.  Focus on PEOPLE:  Teladoc Health has been recognized as a top employer by numerous media and professional organizations. Talented, passionate individuals make the difference, in this fast-moving, collaborative, and inspiring environment. Diversity and Inclusion:  At Teladoc Health we believe that personal and professional diversity is the key to innovation. We hire based solely on your strengths and qualifications, and the way in which those strengths can directly contribute to your success in your new position.  Growth and Innovation:  We’ve already made healthcare yet remain on the threshold of very big things. Come grow with us and support our mission to make a tangible difference in the lives of our Members. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we never have and never will discriminate against any job candidate or employee due to age, race, religion, color, ethnicity, national origin, gender, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, membership in an employee organization, medical condition, family history, genetic information, veteran status, marital status, parental status or pregnancy.

title: Data Engineer II, Data Platform (Latin America - Remote)
description: The RoleQventus is looking for a Data Engineer II to help build the next generation of our data ecosystem as part of our Data Platform team. The Data Platform team acts as stewards for Qventus’ data. We manage the data ecosystem from technical infrastructure to data architecture and tactical data transformations to unlock data as strategic asset in powering high quality decision making at scale. Our services support both internal & external decision making from product development and client insights to ultimately supporting the development and operationalization of our Healthcare AI to improve the lives of patients and doctors across the country.As a Data Engineer II, you will build and maintain significant components of the Qventus data architecture for our Periop solution. You will be comfortable working closely with both core data users on analytics and data science and backend partners to design, build, and deploy comprehensive data pipelines in support of internal and external data solutions - from data requirement & quality definitions, to pipeline design, to feature engineering within the healthcare space (and HIPAA restrictions). You will be motivated and excited to have an impact on the team and in the company and to improve the quality of healthcare operations.Key ResponsibilitiesBuild, tune, and improve the end-to-end workflow of data users at Qventus to data driven decisions & product features (incl. designing data structures, building and scheduling data transformation pipelines, improving access to critical data assets etc.)Improve the overall definition and quality of our data assets incl. the automation and management of schema lifecycles, improved tooling for data flow visibility, and data quality tooling/monitoringSupport the optimization and scale of existing pipelines, dashboards, and data science feature engineering to support Qventus scaleCollaborate with data infrastructure and engineering teams to build, extend, and envision cross-platform ETL and reports generation frameworks to raise engineering standardsKey QualificationsDemonstrated experience in leading data modeling & transformation pipeline design for production services and data science / analytics partner needs (strong SQL & DBT experience preferred)Working, hands on, knowledge of modern Data Warehouses & ETL tools (Snowflake, Airflow) and experience optimizing & designing the data processing for modern data visualization tools (Looker preferred)Experience analyzing data to identify deliverables, gaps, and inconsistencies to ultimately refine dataset requirements and standards Professional experience working with modern programming languages such as Python (preferred), Java, Go, C++ and a dedication to high code qualityNice to HaveStrong cross-functional communication - ability to break down complex technical components for technical and non-technical partners alikePractical hands on experience with data lake / schema discovery systems and relevant technologies (Confluent/Kafka, Spark, Athena/Glue, DynamoDB etc.) Familiarity with the AWS ecosystem (Lambda, RDS, Redshift etc.)Experience handling unstructured data, especially working with NLP tooling to extract information from text Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Analytics, or related field, or equivalent training / experienceQventus is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.Candidate information will be treated in accordance with our candidate privacy notice which can be found here: https://qventus.com/ccpa-privacy-notice/Candidates must be located in Mexico, Colombia, Argentina, Peru, Chile, Guatemala, Ecuador, Bolivia, Dominican Republic, Honduras, Paraguay, El Salvador, Costa Rica, or Uruguay.Employment is contingent upon satisfactory completion of our pre-employment background investigation and drug test

title: ARG -Data Scientist - Advance Analytics
description: En Telefónica- Movistar, tenemos como Misión hacer nuestro mundo más humano, conectando la vida de las personas porque ellas son las que dan sentido a la tecnología y no al revés. Creemos que las conexiones más importantes son las conexiones humanas, por eso unimos a las personas en lugar de aislarlas y las invitamos a ser ellas mismas, a expresarse, a compartir. Aspiramos a ser inclusivos digitalizando a toda la sociedad, sin dejar a nadie atrás.  Telefónica Hispanoamérica es la unidad del Grupo Telefónica que aglutina los activos y operaciones en Argentina, Chile, Colombia, Ecuador, Perú, México, Uruguay, Venezuela y Centroamérica. Ha puesto en marcha un nuevo modelo operativo multi país para maximizar el valor de sus activos en Hispanoamérica a través de la simplificación y la excelencia. La compañía es uno de los mayores proveedores de servicios de telecomunicaciones en la región, opera bajo la marca comercial Movistar, ofrece servicios de conectividad de banda ancha fija -con soluciones de FFTH- y móvil con redes de 4G, así como una amplia gama de servicios digitales para más de 108 millones de clientes residenciales y empresariales.  Dirección: BIG DATA E INTELIGENCIA DE NEGOCIOSÁrea: Big Data AnalyticsDomicilio Laboral: País Misión del Rol Dar respuesta a problemáticas complejas mediante el análisis estadístico de información estructurada y no estructurada y con una fuerte visión de Negocio Funciones Asociadas al Rol  Dar soporte a las distintas áreas de la compañía para detectar oportunidades de negocio e insightRealizar modelos analíticos con datos estructuradas y desestructuradas que permitan encontrar oportunidades de negocio y / o mejoras que contribuyan a la satisfacción de nuestros clientesSer capaz de detectar y analizar nuevas fuentes de información que permitan mejorar la acciones.…  Requisitos Indispensables (Excluyentes) Estudiante avanzado o graduado en carreras de Economía, Matemática, Estadística, Actuario, Ingeniería o sistemas Experiencia avanzada en SQL.Experiencia en análisis exploratorios de datos.  Requisitos Deseables  Habilidades en StorytellingModelización de problemas, inferencia estadística, extrapolación y análisis exploratorio de datos.Destrezas de programación: Spark / Scala, Python, R serán un plus. Competencias  Buen constructor de relaciones a todos los niveles. habilidades de comunicación Energía y resistencia: Resiliencia en ambientes complejos y capacidad de rendir en situaciones desafiantes y complejas.Un pensador lógico, capaz de interpretar información compleja e identificar insights para generar valor en el negocio Propuesta de Valor 14 sueldos anuales, bono de ingreso y Bono por desempeño. 5 días adicionales de goce en concepto de vacaciones. Gympass: hasta un 50% de ahorro y una amplia lista de actividades físicas para disfrutar. Prepaga Corporativa: con descuentos en farmacia de hasta el 70% pudiendo sumar a tu grupo familiar en la cobertura de salud. Licencias extendidas para papás (21 días) y mamás (mes adicional con goce de sueldo) quienes también podrán optar por hacer jornada reducida hasta que el bebé cumpla un año. Esto también aplica para casos de adopción. Además, ofrecemos días de licencia para aquellas familias que se encuentran bajo tratamiento de reproducción asistida. Monto fijo por concepto de Guardería (para los hijos hasta ingresar a la escuela primaria). Durante los meses de diciembre a marzo y todo julio, disfrutamos de los viernes cortos hasta las 15hs siempre que tu tarea lo permita. Podrás disfrutar de 2 días para Vos al año para festejar tu cumple, el de algún familiar o simplemente realizar tus hobbies. Préstamos personales con tasa más baja que el mercado a devolver por recibo de sueldo y en cómodas cuotas. También tenemos una línea de préstamos de emergencia en caso de que atraviesen una situación de urgencia, esos préstamos son a tasa cero. Posibilidad de acceder a becas de posgrado donde la empresa cubre hasta el 40 o 50% de la formación que elijan asociada al puesto de trabajo en áreas digitales. Si estás estudiando una carrera terciaria o universitaria tendrás hasta 20 días al año para preparar tus exámenes. Escuela de idiomas virtual Inglés, Portugués y Alemán. La aplicación se llama Dexway y pertenece a Oxford. Escuela de Formación para que puedas seguir desarrollándote no solo en tu disciplina de interés sino también en habilidades blandas. Posibilidad de trabajo bajo metodología ágil. Obsequios en momentos importantes: navidad, nacimiento de un hijo, kits escolares, casamiento, etc. Hasta un 35% de descuento en productos Bimbo con entrega a domicilio. Club de Beneficios con Unilever con hasta un 40% de descuento en la compra de productos de primera marca. 60% de descuentos en nuestros productos (para monetizar esto puede ver la página de Movistar y ve lo que representa el 60%, no incluye la compra de equipos). Importantes descuentos en Compra Cierta, un sitio donde se pueden comprar electrodomésticos marca Whirpool entre otras. Importantes descuentos en seguros Pléyade para proteger el hogar o asegurar un auto/bici, etc. Envío de silla ergonométrica, monitor, teclado o mouse para que trabaje más cómodo desde tu casa. Actividades virtuales para cuidar nuestro bienestar. Podrás participar de sorteo para eventos o recitales en el Movistar Arena.  Postúlate!

title: Data Analyst
description: Nos encontramos en la búsqueda de una persona para que se sume como Data Analyst a nuestro equipo de Data de Reba, para que pueda responder preguntas y problemáticas de negocio, realizando modelado de datos y aplicando métodos estadísticos.Entre sus principales funciones se destacan📌 Modelar problemáticas utilizando métodos estadísticos y de machine learning para interpretar grandes volúmenes de datos y extraer oportunidades de mejora de negocio.📌 Colaborar manteniendo la plataforma de BI para democratizar el acceso a la información.📌 Dar soporte hacia la gerencia y los equipos de producto generando extrayendo información que les permitan tomar decisiones basadas en datos.RequisitosTítulo de grado en carreras de Facultades de Ciencias Exactas, así como Actuario/Economía, Estadística, Sistemas, Ingeniería o afines.Contar con experiencia analizando datos e implementando soluciones aplicando modelos de machine learning. Tener rigurosidad en el mantenimiento y curaduría de datosTener experiencia analizando y visualizando datos en Python y su stack cientïfico (Pandas/Numpy/Scikit-Learn/Jupyter/Matplotlib).Contar con experiencia trabajando con herramientas de control de versión (Git).Poseer conocimientos en bases de datos SQL.Tener experiencia utlizando herramientas de BI.Poseer habilidades de StoryTelling que permitan comunicar los resultados en forma clara y adaptándose a las posibles audiencias.Búsqueda laboral equitativa - Desde Reba sólo te pediremos la información estrictamente necesaria para el desempeño del trabajo que se ofrece. - Ley N°6471BeneficiosContamos con Importantes beneficios corporativos como una semana adicional de licencia, descuentos en gimnasios, clases de inglés in company, descuentos en distintos productos, convenios con prepagas, entre otros.No te olvides de incluir la remuneración bruta pretendida.Garantizamos absoluta confidencialidad y reserva.¡Sumate a Reba!¿Te imaginás siendo parte de la compañía que va a ayudar a miles de personas a vivir la vida que quieren?Reba es la app de servicios financieros que nació con el propósito de incluir a más personas al sistema financiero para que puedan construir el futuro que quieren. A través de una app simple e innovadora, miles de personas pueden tener acceso a los mejores servicios financieros con mayor simplicidad y transparencia.Reba es la App de Reba Compañía Financiera, una entidad Financiera Regulada por el BCRA. Al ser parte de Grupo Transatlántica, la compañía consigue el equilibrio ideal entre el respaldo y trayectoria de más de 50 años de vida en distintas industrias, junto a la innovación y flexibilidad que una compañía joven ofrece al mercado y sus colaboradores.Convencidos de que llegamos más lejos en equipo, buscamos incorporar a aquellos talentos que se sientan motivados por formar parte de un proyecto que va a generar impacto en la vida de miles de latinoamericanos. ¿Qué buscamos en esos talentos? El ADN Rebanker que sean cliente céntricos, que piensen a gran escala, y que trabajen con el más alto estándar de calidad, con respeto y buena onda.Sumate a esta aventura en la que tus ideas no sólo van a llevar tu carrera al próximo nivel, sino que también van a contribuir a cambiar la forma en la que miles de latinoamericanos se relacionan con sus finanzas. ¿Estás listo? ¡Nosotros, re!

title: Analista de DATOS
description: Buscamos Analista de DatosSomos el núcleo de ecosistema financiero y buscamos ser el principal referente en la Prevención de Fraude.Formaras parte del equipo encargado de detectar, mitigar y prevenir comportamientos inusuales en transacciones, para identificar oportunidades de mejora y contribuir a la seguridad transaccional de los productos administrados por COELSA, aportando mayor seguridad en el ecosistema financiero.Principales desafíosRecopilar, limpiar, analizar, visualizar e interpretar las necesidades comerciales, respaldar la toma de decisiones basada en datos y ejecutar experimentos para generar resultados definidos.Diseñar, desarrollar y elaborar informes (tableros, dashboards, etc) para presentación a responsables de unidades de negocio, gerencias, directorio, etc.Crear reportes e indicadores para identificar y corregir problemas de medición, con la ayuda de herramientas como Power BI , Tableau, R, y otros.Utilizar modelos estadísticos, algoritmos predictivos y de inteligencia artificial para identificar patrones y tendencias en la información que permitan una mejor toma de decisiones.Detectar nuevas oportunidades y/o mejoras de negocio basadas en datos.Requisitos¿Qué buscamos?Estudiantes o Lic en Sistemas/Tecnología de la información o carreras afines.Experiencia mínima de 2 años en puestos similares.Idioma ingles intermedio (deseable).Conocimientos / Experiencia en Fintech / Entidades financieras. (deseable).Contar con conocimientos y experiencia en Manipulación de grandes volúmenes de datos.Diseño y visualización de Datos.Lenguaje de programación y Bases de datos (SQL).Armado y ejecución de querys.Conocimientos generales tecnologías Cloud / Infraestructura / Networking / Base de Datos.Capacidad de autonomía / relacionamiento / trabajo en equipo.Conocimientos deseables Conocimientos Habeas Data / Protección de Datos Personales.Conocimientos deseables en Data Lake / Machine Learning.Haber trabajado en áreas relacionadas a la prevención de fraudes.Programación en Python.Beneficios3 días de Home Office.Reintegro de gastos por Home office.Bono anual por cumplimiento de objetivos.Programas de capacitación permanente para acompañar tu desarrollo profesional.Capacitación en idiomas.Día de tu cumpleaños libre, descuentos en distintas marcas, días extras de vacaciones, Médico Clínico a disposición.Medicina prepaga OSDE Plan 210.Somos la empresa de tecnología responsable de crear las herramientas que necesitás para fluir segura y libremente a través del ecosistema de pagos de hoy y de mañana.Con tecnología enfocada en el sector financiero, somos el motor del ecosistema. Garantizamos, promovemos y sustentamos la transformación digital. Democratizamos el acceso dando inclusión al 100% de las entidades financieras, desde los bancos hasta las fintech.La transformación tecnológica es vertiginosa e imparable, por eso diseñamos las herramientas digitales adecuadas para que todos podamos participar e interactuar en el ecosistema de pagos. Se trate de individuos o de empresas. Y siempre con un servicio de calidad.Sumate y dejá que COELSA te impulse,Si sos una persona inquieta y comprometida.Si te atraen los desafíos.Si querés impactar positivamente en la sociedad.Si buscás una empresa que te impulse, te cuide, te acompañe y te escuche.Si soñás con una propuesta a la medida de tu talento,te queremos en nuestro equipo. Porque compartimos el mismo ADN.

title: Data Analytics - Analyst
description: Client Onboarding Data Analytics - Analyst The Client Onboarding MIS & Strategy team is seeking a new member to join its team based in Buenos Aires. The area's main responsibility is to produce periodic and Ad hoc reports, develop metrics, run controls and identify opportunities for automation in order to support global Client Onboarding activities.Responsibilities Include Prepare periodic and Ad hoc reports to support global Client Onboarding activities and participate in special projects as requested.  Participate in the design and development of dashboards that lead to data-driven decisions.  Identify opportunities to automate current processes and reports.  Work with internal partners and report to managers in a global team environment.  In-depth knowledge of procedures and systems to ensure client records are compliant with all applicable rules, with focus on process improvements.  Ad-Hoc requests from Senior Management.  Precisely share the information with the right audience and understand the incoming needs and anticipate data requirements. Qualifications Include University degree. (Engineering, Computer Science, Actuarial Science, Economy, Business Administration or equivalent).  Fluent in English is mandatory, both written and verbally. Other languages are a plus.  Strong data visualization skills.  Knowledge of MS Excel and Office suit.  Be flexible, adaptable and eager to learn.  Ability to work maintaining attention to detail and applying best practices.  Work independently with self-prioritization and attention to deadlines.  Ability to engineer and enhance operational processes.  Strong control mindset. Desired Skills And Experience Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills  Highly organized, proactive and motivated with strong prioritization skills, innovation and problem-solving skills, and a control mindset, with the ability to deliver value-added support to business partners and clients in a timely and accurate manner.  Knowledge of any programming language is a plus (SQL, R, Python,) as well as experience with automation tools such as Alteryx and visual analytics platforms such as Tableau, or Power BI.  Sense of urgency/ability to work well under pressure and tight deadlines.  Demonstrates flexibility and willingness to accept new assignments and challenges in a rapidly changing environment, as well as handling multiple tasks and changing priorities on a daily basis. If you join the company, you will be part of a diverse and inclusive team that supports each other and will empower you to do your best work.BenefitsBelow you´ll find some examples of ongoing initiatives to promote it and a link to learn more about our benefits & cultureYour wellbeing is very important to us. Home office/ flexible work arrangements and work tools to ensure a great experience.  Generous vacation, exam and parental leave.  Support for parents, including Family Network that provides support to parents and caregivers, Lactation room on premise, and Paid Day care for your children up to 6-years-old .  Medical coverage for you and your family, including domestic partners.  Employee Assistance Program which provides personal and confidential advisory on psychological, financial and legal matters.  Wellness programs - e.g. Yoga, stretching and mindfulness classes delivered on premises.  Language classes, mentorship programs and customized trainings.  Platform for employee discounts in Buenos Aires. More info can be found here: https://careers.jpmorgan.com/global/en/about-usJ.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world's most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. title: Analista de Datos
