Estamos orientados a obtener resultados superiores, dentro de una cultura de cuidado por las personas, liderazgo y colaboración.En nuestra Compañía creemos que cada carrera es tan única como la persona y que los colaboradores pueden alcanzar su máximo potencial en una cultura ganadora, motivada por un propósito poderoso. Ofrecemos un ambiente de trabajo colaborativo y solidario, Empoderamiento, Impacto del trabajo, Trabajar con un propósito poderoso, Aprendizaje y desarrollo individual, Salud y seguridad, Responsabilidad social e Innovación.Si te identificas con este desafío, postúlate ahora mismo.Ubicación:Medellín - ColombiaTogether, we are improving lives, every day.Working at Essity is not just a career; it is a chance to directly make the world a healthier, more hygienic and safer place. With impactful innovations coupled with sustainable solutions, we strive to reach more people every year with the necessary and essential solutions for well-being.Application End Date:10 ene 2023

title: Analista de datos (sales planner)
description: En Forus buscamos a nuestro próximo/a Analista de datos.Forus Colombia, es una multinacional chilena comercializadora de marcas de Retail como: Merrell, Hush Puppies, Caterpillar y Under Armour.. Tenemos presencia en Chile, Perú, Uruguay y Colombia. Nuestra actividad económica es la comercialización y distribución de productos nacionales e internacionales, con el objetivo de tener el mejor portafolio de marcas y brindarles la mejor experiencia de compra a nuestros consumidores.Nuestro/a ANALISTA DE DATOS Desarrollarás Las Siguientes Funciones Analiza el rendimiento de la mercancía, pronostica resultados futuros y se asocia con equipos de marcas para impulsar las ventas y el crecimiento de los márgenes para nuestros clientes. Colabora y coordina las actividades de planificación con las partes interesadas clave, tanto interna como externamente, para cuentas responsables hacia el logro de los objetivos financieros. Convertir los datos de ventas directas en información procesable, generar la visibilidad del rendimiento en los puntos de venta del mercado e impulsa planes estratégicos para alinear los indicadores de rendimiento. Generar informes y análisis para detectar oportunidades y riesgos para desarrollar recomendaciones comerciales. Mantener planes de reabastecimiento, hacer recomendaciones con respecto a los despachos para garantizar semanas saludables de suministro. Asociarse con el equipo de ventas, comercialización y fijación de precios en la planificación de escenarios para rebajas, con la finalidad de minimizar los riesgos. Generar cuadros de mando que resuman los indicadores clave de rendimiento. Venta y análisis de inventario frente a reserva previa por cliente para garantizar un stock interno saludable. Comparta información sobre la disponibilidad de productos con el equipo de ventas para planificar puntos de venta futuros. Influir en la comercialización en el surtido de la línea al brindar retroalimentación sobre el desempeño del producto antes, durante y después de cada temporada. Generar información para la asignación de productos entre los almacenes teniendo en cuenta lo comprado y vendido por canal/cliente. Participar y colaborar en todo el proceso ATP para maximizar Open to Buy.Habilidades Requeridas Perfil proactivo y orientado a soluciones, siempre buscando formas de mejorar. Fuertes habilidades analíticas y una comprensión clara de la toma de decisiones basada en datos. Comprensión teórica amplia y profunda de la función del trabajo.Requisitos 2 años de experiencia relacionada al cargo. Profesional estadista, administrador de empresas, ingeniero, analista de investigación de mercados. Manejo de excel avanzado.¡Te invitamos a formar parte de familia FORUS COLOMBIA S.A.S!

title: Data Visualization Analyst
description: It started with one ridiculously good idea - Create a different breed of BPO! We at TaskUs understand that achieving growth for our partners requires a culture of constant motion; exploring new technologies, being ready to handle any challenge in a moment's notice, mastering consistency in an ever-changing world - that's what it takes to get there. If that's something you want to be apart of, apply today!TaskUs is a provider of outsourced digital services and next-generation customer experience to fast-growing technology companies, helping its clients represent, protect and grow their brands. Leveraging a cloud-based infrastructure, TaskUs serves clients in the fastest-growing sectors, including social media, e-commerce, gaming, streaming media, food delivery, ride sharing, HiTech, FinTech, and HealthTech. As of March 31, 2022, TaskUs had approximately 45,800 employees across twenty-three locations in 12 countries, including the United States, the Philippines, and India.It started with one ridiculously good idea - Create a different breed of BPO! We at TaskUs understand that achieving growth for our partners requires a culture of constant motion; exploring new technologies, being ready to handle any challenge at a moment's notice, and mastering consistency in an ever-changing world - that's what it takes to get there. If that's something you want to be a part of, apply today!What can you expect in a Data Visualization Analyst role with TaskUs:As a Data Visualization Analyst you will play a critical role as a strategic advisor to business functions and leaders across the company. You will work on developing dashboards and reports for the business. You will work closely with internal and external stakeholders (Business Insights, Data Engineering, Operations, Support groups, etc.) to make sure that correct and updated information on all dashboards and reports is available to the business at all times.This role requires both strong technical data skills and business acumen. Ultimate success in this role goes beyond data-related activities and delivers the "so what" that drives decisions and real business impact. You will need to fully understand the business function (processes, objectives, organization, performance drivers, barriers), and have the ability to connect the dots between data analysis, business strategy, and operational effectiveness.You will need to be a critical thinker, problem-solver, and self-starter. Our Data Visualization Analysts are driven and proactive, think independently and do not just take orders. There must be an ability to see the bigger picture to make cross-functional connections in both business processes and data. There is an expectation that you not only answer the question that was asked but the question that wasn't. It will be important for you to build positive relationships across the organization and have a "find a way" attitude.Responsibilities:Design performance efficient, impactful reports and visualizations for business and technical audiences.Making large and/or complex data more accessible, understandable and usable.Transforming, improving and integrating data, depending on the business requirements.Responsible for data federation.Create and maintain a reports' instruction manual.Delivering the data in a useful and appealing way to users.Qualifications / Requirements:Required Skills:2+ years hands-on experience in Power BI or other foundational Power BI applications such as Power Pivot. Same length of experience in Tableau, Qlikview, Business Objects can be considered.2+ years of exposure to ETL, databases / data warehouse that relates to developing reports using Power BI.Ability to work with large amounts of information and see the 'bigger picture'.Team player who builds strong relationships and establishes trust with business leaders, Engineers, and colleagues.Work collaboratively and independently; take ownership of quality, accuracy, and timeliness of deliverables.Excellent analytical and problem solving skills.Strong attention to detail and critical thinking skills.Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to explain complex issues in a simple and intuitive way. Must be at a C1 English level in verbal and written communication to be considered for this role. Must upload a resume in English for consideration.Preferred Skills:Experience with process improvement is a plus.Excellent math skills (optional but preferred)Programming background (is a plus!)Education / Certifications:College Diploma or University Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Information Technology, or equivalent experience.Work Location/ Work Schedule/ Travel:Cali, Colombia / Cali-Remote48 hours weeklyIn TaskUs we believe that innovation and higher performance are brought by people from all walks of life. We welcome applicants of different backgrounds, demographics, and circumstances. Inclusive and equitable practices are our responsibility as a business.TaskUs is committed to providing equal access to opportunities. If you need reasonable accommodation in any part of the hiring process, please let us know.TaskUs will neither solicit money from you during your application process nor require any form of payment in order to proceed with your application. Kindly ensure that you are always in communication with only authorized recruiters of TaskUs.If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!TaskUs is an Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Data Engineer - Fully Remote
description: Requisition ID:  req31579Job Title: Data Engineer - Fully RemoteSector: Information TechnologyEmployment Category: Fixed TermEmployment Type: Full-TimeOpen to Expatriates: NoLocation: New York, NY HQ USAJob Description The IRC The International Rescue Committee (IRC) responds to the world’s worst humanitarian crises and helps people to survive and rebuild their lives. Founded in 1933 at the request of Albert Einstein, the IRC offers lifesaving care and life-changing assistance to refugees forced to flee from war or disaster. At work today in over 40 countries and 28 U.S. cities, we restore safety, dignity and hope to millions who are uprooted and struggling to endure. The IRC leads the way from harm to home.The Information Technology (IT) department at the IRC comprises of the following teams delivering enterprise technology capabilities for the IRC: Global Technology Shared Services Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) Management Project Management Security Business Relationship Management Program Technology & Data HR Information Systems (HRIS) Enterprise CRM & Marketing TechnologyIRC's Marketing Technology team within the Information Technology Department is responsible for managing the enterprise supporter management platforms that support the global delivery of the International Rescue Committee’s private sector resources, as well as the key partnerships, advocacy and influence objectives of the External Relations, Communications and Advocacy departments. These platforms also play an important strategic role in the creation of IRC’s brand, its awareness and support for fundraising and advocacy goals. The platforms include the Enterprise CRM platform, various donation platforms, the IRC global website and email communications platforms.Job Overview / Summary (What And Why)The IRC is seeking a self-motivated and technical savvy Data Engineer Lead to lead our CRM Audience Management Team, a critical function on IRC’s Global Marketing Technology Team. This position is fully remote for candidates in the US, UK and Colombia.The CRM Audience Management team is a key stakeholder in driving IRC’s approach to audience data management and is tasked with planning, designing, and executing data quality routines; and proactively monitoring, measuring, analyzing, and reporting on data quality issues to the organization. The team develops protocols, creates and implements monitoring procedures to ensure data quality and standardization, and delivers process improvements to how audience data is pulled, managed and delivered. In addition, the team provides ongoing support, training, and documentation to multiple global teams, helping them to capture and extract audience data for analytical decision making across IRC's systems.The Data Engineer Lead will be responsible for maintaining IRC’s audience management architecture, currently using SQL Server. The Data Engineer Lead’s primary focus will be on supporting the US, UK and Global Markets’ direct mail audience needs and may expand to other channels as needed. The Lead will perform hands-on technical data manipulation, clean-up and management in MSSQL and Salesforce, with a focus on administering and delivering functional solutions to meet IRC’s fundraising goals. The Lead will be involved in the design, implementation, deployment, and documentation of projects that leverage the Salesforce, ETL, and SQL toolset. Working with a wide range of key stakeholders this role requires an engineering mind set, good people skills and the ability to manage staff.Major Responsibilities Creates queries, mailing lists, and reports from our CRM database platform/s to support and monitor offline / online / telemarketing / cross-channel donor outreach and fundraising results. Coordinates with offsite acknowledgement, mail production, and analytics/reporting vendors. Creates and merges inhouse acknowledgement files, letters and forms; reports on donation responses; and strategizes new ways to optimize this program. Monitors donor solicitation preferences, maintaining mailing/outreach schedules, and reviews mail plans for adherence to these preferences. Creates efficient tracking processes for donor outreach efforts; develops reports on donor activities, including customer service calls, sustainer recapture efforts, event invites, prospect manager maintenance, and action reports. Delivers audience data for donor recognition and specialized donor outreach, including annual report and other publication listing letters, donor milestone letters, and donor gift processing issues. Assists with Salesforce support and specific enhancement projects  Evaluates system performance and design, as well as its effect on data quality.  Directly supports the engineering and development of SQL back end.  Supports CRM business process automation projects and data optimization projects.  Collaborates with database developers to improve data collection and data reporting.  Perform complex data analysis/management tasks and provide support for related data warehouse infrastructure (SQL databases, scheduling and ETL tools, and key integrations).  Communicate proactively and frequently and modify technical information as needed so that it can be understood by stakeholders to enable their decision-making. Key Working RelationshipsPosition Reports to: Associate Director, CRM, and Data ManagementPosition directly supervises: 1-2 staffIndirect Resources: Collaborates with other staff on cross-functional development and project teams.Other Internal And/or External ContactsInternal: Close collaboration with global colleagues working in the areas of CRM, digital technology, and analytics across External Relations, IT and Communications teams.External: May collaborate with external digital vendors and consultants. Impact of work: Supports IRC’s ability to generate digital donations in excess of $60 million annually, measure and improve on data management, and deliver of segmentation and reporting for fundraising, and policy initiatives to expand the IRC’s impact, brand awareness and to generate revenue.EducationJob Qualifications:Minimum: Associate’s DegreePreferred: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or Engineering or equivalent experience.Minimum Work Experience:  Minimum: 8 years of experience with relational database technology and creating queries and lists for fundraising/marketing campaign Experience building / maintaining a CRM Database for use in list pulling & reporting Experience with backend architecture design/development to facilitate complex list pulls Experience providing lists to 3 rd parties for further processing (printing, NCOA,…) Has facilitated database updates with inputs from 3 rd party printer, telemarketer, other Supported or managed database migration projects Significant demonstrable professional work experience with SQL toolset and relational databases (non-profit experience a plus) and IT delivery, IT services, and professional services environments. Experience creating basis for data CRM quality checks.  Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills.  Proficiency in programming languages, including Excel VBA/macros and MSSQL queries.  Accuracy and attention to detail a must; sensitivity when working with highly confidential information and ability to always maintain complete discretion.  Proven ability to plan and independently manage a variety of projects and high work volume: must work well under pressure, prioritize, show flexibility, and solve problems creatively.  Experience with creating views, stored procedures, and functions.  SQL database experience using T-SQL, SSIS, SSRS, query performance tunings, database development, implementation, data manipulation and complex custom reports, and underlying data models.  Experience in ETL Design sessions.  Experience with MSOffice VBA.  Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, ability to communicate technical issues to non-technical audience.  Strong customer service orientation Preferred Experience in fundraising operations in a non-profit fundraising environment Experience with DBAmp, Heroku or other Salesforce related cloud technologies.  Past experience with large-scale communications management (1,000,000 records or more with test segments and targeted populations), mail production, analyzing fundraising revenue and expenses, and database systems set up  NPSP Salesforce experience.  Experience in supporting fundraising applications for non-profit organizations.  Experience in working effectively with an Agile delivery model. title: Data Analyst
description: We’re here to make real estate transactions simpler. We do that by providing a digital lead-to-close experience for agents, brokers, and their consumers. We’ve seen a lot of change over the past 30 years—but we’ve been here to support real estate from day one.With the diverse landscape of the real estate industry, we want diverse talent! We want to celebrate each other’s individuality and embrace our differences to enrich our commonalities and relationships throughout our organization, and we want you to be a part of that.JOB SUMMARY:We are looking for a hard-working data analyst to join our product team. Stitch together complex data sets to unlock insights for the business. Automate recurring tasks/reports to free up capacity. Your focus will be to own the reporting database and develop reports that can be shared and manipulated by various stakeholders within the organization. You will have the opportunity to analyze and generate insights on one of the largest residential real estate platforms in the world.As part of the Lone Wolf Product Management team, you will frequently interact with other Product Owners, Product Managers, and Developers to understand needs and generate reports.RESPONSIBILITIES: Gathering reporting requirements from a diverse audience (marketing, support, product, finance) and translate needs into insights Extract, transform and load data for analysis, interpretation and delivery to stakeholders Develop canned reports and tooling that can be utilized and shared throughout the organization Gather and publish reports using different attributes Serve as the expert of our reporting database An ability to present data in an informative manner and draw conclusions or recognize meaningful trends Develop insightful analytics and business intelligence within all of our business streams by collaborating with stakeholder groups Initiate, coordinate and ‘own’ your own projects from start to finish Work simultaneously on multiple projects at various levels of completion Master a variety of reporting tools and languages Build management dashboards and other activities as required Perform other duties and responsibilities as assignedQUALIFICATIONS: Minimum 5 years experience with SQL Minimum 3 years of proven analyst experience in a similar role Experience with Business Intelligence tools (ie. Tableau, PowerBI) Familiarity with common ETL tooling Programming languages a plus (ie. Python) EDUCATION: Undergraduate degree or technical certificateSKILLS: Excellent written and verbal communication skills Expertise in using analytical software tools, data analysis methods and reporting techniques Expertise in data storage and movement, including relational and big data Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Strong time management and organizational skills Exceptional analytical, detail-oriented problem-solving skills; excellent follow-up skills required Ability to tackle issues with a sense of urgency while maintaining professionalism and accuracy Strong interpersonal skills for working with multiple departments, subject matter experts, and colleagues that are geographically dispersed Self-starter and able to work in a fast-paced, high-demand environment Strong focus on understanding customer needs Ability to successfully manage/execute multiple projects simultaneously Sense of pride and ownership in your performanceBONUS POINTS: Experience from a statistical, mathematical, computer science, real estate background or equivalentWe’ve become the largest real estate software company in North America. Our products provide our client’s with a competitive advantage in today’s market and nearly 10,000 offices are utilizing our feature rich, fully integrated windows and web based software solutions.At Lone Wolf Technologies, we are an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We hire and attract candidates from all backgrounds regardless of age, race, creed, colour, religion, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, status as a protected veteran or any other legally protected grounds and ensure that we will not discriminate on these basis. Please note that accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. If you do require accommodations, please contact the Human Resources Department at Lone Wolf Technologies by calling 1-866-CRY-WOLF (1-866-279-9653) or emailing recruitment@lwolf.com.

title: Customer Master Data Analyst
description: Make A Difference For Those Who Make The World™Come Make the World With UsMake Your Mark. Shape Your Future.It takes great people to achieve greatness. People with a sense of purpose and integrity. People with a relentless pursuit of excellence. People who care about making things better For Those Who Make The World™. Sound like you? Join our top-notch team of nearly 60,000 professionals globally who are making their mark on some of the world’s most beloved brands, including DEWALT®, CRAFTSMAN®, STANLEY® and BLACK+DECKER®.What You’ll DoAs a Customer Master Data Analyst, you’ll be part of the MDM team located in Colombia. You’ll get to:Accountable for understanding the Master Data Structure for Non-ERP Global Applications (Concur, Ariba, PeopleSoft, ADP) and how these Global Applications impact the SBD SAP ERP environments.Accountable for maintaining the quality and accuracy of the vendors and customers data.Administration of the SAP GRC 12.0 Access Controls tool, communications, and training.Drive and Develop Process Improvements on key Data/Risk areas.Provide support to the business partners on ERP and non-ERP financial structure decisions and requirements related to projects, acquisitions, conversions, reporting needs.Support metric reporting and root cause analysis.Who You Are You always strive to do a good job…but wouldn’t it be great if you could do your job and do a world of good? You care about quality – at every level. You love to learn and grow and be acknowledged for your valuable contributions. You’re not intimidated by innovation. In fact, you embrace it. You also have:Bachelor’s in business/engineering/accounting with 3+ years of experience OR equivalent combination of experience and education required.Ability to learn Stanley’s Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems and Non-ERP systems.Solid understanding of basic accounting principles, business operation, and processes.Strong analytical skills including data mining, analysis, trending and writing accompanying commentary.Proficient in Microsoft Excel.What You’ll ReceiveYou’ll receive a competitive salary and a great benefits plan:Teleworking Bonus of 230,000 COP.Health Allowance (100% employee, 60% Family Nucleus).Life and Funeral insurance.Annual Performance Bonus.How You’ll FeelWe want our company to be a place you’ll want to be – and stay. Being part of our team means you’ll get to:Grow: Be part of our global company with 20+ brands to grow and develop your skills along multiple career paths.Learn: Have access to a wealth of learning resources, including our Lean Academy, Coursera® and online university.Belong: Experience an awesome place to work, where we have mutual respect and a great appreciation for diversity, equity and inclusion.Give Back: Help us continue to make positive changes locally and globally through volunteerism, giving back and sustainable business practices.What’s more, you’ll get that pride that comes from empowering makers, doers, protectors and everyday heroes all over the world. We’re more than the #1 tools and storage company and #2 security solutions provider, with a leading presence in engineered fastening. We’re visionaries. Industry 4.0 innovators. As successful as we’ve been in the past, we have so much further to go. That’s where you come in. Join us!All qualified applicants to Stanley Black & Decker are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran’s status or any other protected characteristic.

title: Senior Data Analyst, Growth
description: We believe in a world where homes are owned by regular people. Our mission is to provide authentic belonging experiences, empowering residents to become homeowners and homeowners to be financially free.Belong is changing what it means to rent a home by putting people first. It’s where hospitality meets consumer real estate—and it’s about to redefine an entire industry. We’re backed by Andreessen Horowitz (a16z), GGV Capital, Battery Ventures, and Fifth Wall just to name some of our all-star investors.We are looking for a Senior Product Analyst who will play a key role in growing our core products for homeowners and residents across several markets. The Senior Product Analyst is a role embedded within the product and engineering teams and is responsible for driving growth and strategic improvements through the end-to-end product development cycle. We are looking for someone with quantitative skills combined with strong business acumen and product sense as well as cross-functional collaboration skills.Responsibilities Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining of structured and unstructured data to extract key insights that drive strategic product and business decisions for BelongAbility to effectively present the data in a way that helps the company see and understand key insights into how our consumers interact with our ecosystem of productsIdentify growth opportunities that remove barriers to product adoption, engagement, retention, and monetization.Understand funnels, two-sided marketplace flywheels, multi-product ecosystems, and end-to-end consumer behaviors to shed light on the historical and future title: Data Platform Engineer
description: 🚀 UST is looking for the very Top Talent…and we would be delighted if you were to join our family!For more than 22 years, UST has worked side by side with the world's best companies to make a real impact through transformation. Powered by technology, inspired by people, and led by our purpose, we partner with our clients from design to operation. We identify their core challenges and craft disruptive solutions that bring their vision to life through our agile approach. Together, with over 30,000 employees in 30 countries, we build for boundless impact—touching billions of lives in the process🔎 What are we looking for?We are seeking hands on Bilingual Data Platform Engineer consultant to architect and implement solutions for Data Pipeline Orchestrating (ELT, ETL, Enrichment, Storage), and Distribution Platform Management (API, EGRESS, Data Sharing, Cataloging). The ideal candidate is a well-rounded hands-on engineer, passionate about delivery and streamlining data integration tasks, optimization, and solutions to support data applications. 📋 Main tasks and accountabilities will be:• Part of a team to deliver API platforms, Use API Management platform to design and implement requirements of the API layer. Such as policies that will cover security, caching, limits, logging, request, and response modifications • Harness modern application best practices with code quality, API test Coverages, Agile Development, DevOps, and Observability and support.• Maintain programming standards and ensure the usage of the pattern / template for API Proxy. • Design and implementation of data pipeline solutions that improve data engineer productivity for onboarding data, while maintaining accuracy and joinability. • Conduct code reviews and automatic test coverage • Standardize the CI/CD setup for API management tools and automated deployment. • Utilize problem-solving skills to help your peers in the research and selection of tools, products, and frameworks (which is vital to support business initiatives) • Responsible for large data API requests and security of API consumption • Ensuring stability of API and APIM performance and maintain SLAS• Implement OAuth Okta integration for communication between API producers and consumers.💡 What UST expects from you?• 5+ years of proven industry experience• Hands-on development expertise in Java, Python, GraphQL, SQL, Junit, Spring Boot, OpenAPI, Spark, Flink, Kafka • Experience working in cloud data platforms such as Azure, Snowflake, Yellowbrick, Singlestore, GBQ • Understanding of Databases, API Frameworks, Governance Frameworks, and expertise in hosting and managing platforms like: Hadoop, Spark, Flink, Kafka, SpringBoot, BI Tools like Tableau, Alteryx, Governance Tools like Callibra, Soda, Amazon DeeQu • Strong understanding of Twelve-Factor App Methodology • Solid understanding of API and integration design principles and pattern experience with web technologies. • Experience with test-driven development and API testing automation. • Experience with Azure DevOps CI/CD Tools to build and deploy Java/API packages and API deployment automation. 💰 What can we offer?❤️ Numerous benefits (Health Care Plan, teleworking compensation, Life Insurances).🎓 Free access to several training platforms🚀 Professional stability and career plans🚶 UST also, compensates referrals from which you could benefit when you refer professionals.. If you would like to know more, do not hesitate to apply and we’ll get in touch to fill you in details.UST is waiting for you!

title: Ingeniero de datos
description: Somos un startup de tecnología relacionada con comercio electrónico, diseñada para iniciar en Colombia y tener una expansión global acelerada. Mongo DB. Desarrollo y ejecución de pruebas (unitarias, funcionales, integración, carga). Librerías para AI: PyTorch, TensorFlow, Sci-kit Learn. Librería de Python para análisis y manipulación de datos &AI (Numpy, SciPy, Pandas, Tensorflow, Matplotlib). Habilidad para encontrar causas raíz y de solucionar problemas en entornos de producción. Plus: Conocimiento en comercio electrónico, SEO/SCM, herramientas de captura de información acerca de visitas/navegación y análisis de palabras de búsqueda.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description: Con presencia en 6 países de Latinoamérica (Colombia, Ecuador, Perú, Uruguay, Chile y México), y más de 30 años de experiencia, somos la multinacional colombiana líder en prestar servicios de software contable y administrativo, facturación y nómina electrónica. Nuestro sueño es democratizar la tecnología en las pymes y los contadores de todo LATAM, sueño que, desde los últimos 3 años, hemos venido lográndolo gracias al trabajo y compromiso de todos nuestros colaboradores y al apoyo incondicional de AKKR, uno de los fondos de capital privado de Silicon Valley más importantes para SaaS Tech a nivel mundial.Somos una empresa con mentalidad startup, con tasas de crecimiento anual de hasta un 73%, que ha sido reconocida por Great Place to Work como una de las mejores empresas para trabajar en LATAM y uno de los mejores lugares para trabajar para mujeres, que hasta el día de hoy, le ha transformado la vida a 2700 colaboradores y más de 300K empresas y contadores en toda la región.Nuestra visión para 2024 es llegar a 4.000.000 pymes en toda LATAM y desde el área de Marketing, estamos buscando personas que disfruten el cambio, que les apasionen los retos y que tengan mentalidad innovadora.Nuestro propósito es transformar la vida de nuestro equipo, contadores y empresarios, y ¡contigo podemos lograrlo!Anímate y sé parte de Siigo. Si cumples con todos los requisitos, te apasiona servir, y eres humilde y amoroso, no dudes en aplicar para ser nuestr@ próxim@ Business Intelligence Analyst.Tus retos: Eres el responsable de la extracción y análisis de la información, vinculada a las diferentes herramientas y procesos estratégicos u operativos del negocio.Apoyas en la ejecución de la estrategia global de datos y análisis.Extraes y analizas información relevante para el negocio identificando diferentes formas y fuentes en que la información puede ser aprovechada.Gestionas la calidad de los datos e informes solicitados.Elaboras tableros que permitan a los stakeholders realizar seguimiento autónomo de los datos.Entiendes, Limpias, organizas y estructuras los datos para su análisis y encontrar hallazgos para la toma decisiones.Colaboras y estas en todo momento con la mejor disposición a brindar apoyo a cualquier miembro del equipo.¿Qué necesitamos de ti?Eres profesional en Ingenierías, Estadística, Matemáticas, Economía, Administración o carreras afines.Tienes 2 años de experiencia en áreas de inteligencia de negocios y/o análisis de datos, analizando amplios volúmenes de datos, así como en el manejo de herramientas para analítica de datos (análisis y visualización).Manejas Excel avanzado.Manejas herramientas de de bases de datos en nivel intermedio (SQL, Bases de datos relacionales y no relacionales), deseable manejo de software analítico (R-Python, SAS, SPSS).Te proponemos:Ser parte de una compañía que transforma tu vida promoviendo una cultura de excelencia, basada en un propósito, valores fuertes y habilidades, que es nuestra esencia y nos diferencia de las demás empresas.Disfrutar de un Plan de Beneficios, Bienestar y Balance, que integra nuestra vida dentro y fuera de Siigo, creando experiencias de felicidad en cada uno de nosotr@s.Interés y apoyo en tu aprendizaje continuo, crecimiento profesional y personal.Divertirte haciendo lo que te gusta y lograr resultados increíbles.Ser tú mism@ y vivir tu trabajo en un ambiente inclusivo y diverso.En Siigo buscamos la equidad y brindamos un espacio de confianza donde las personas se sientan libres de ser quiénes son ¡Celebramos eso que nos hace únicos! ¿Qué esperas para tomar este nuevo reto?, ¡Súmate a nuestra familia!.

title: Data Engineer
description: Avant makes premier financial solutions accessible to everyday consumers by blending cutting-edge technology, creative analytics, and superior customer service. Since 2012, we've connected over 1.5 million customers to over $7.5 billion in loans and 1 million credit cards, and we’ve cultivated a work culture that we’re incredibly proud of.As we’ve evolved, we’ve maintained our ability to be nimble, to help each other work smarter, and to keep learning and trying new things. A high growth financial technology company, Avant has been featured in The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times, TechCrunch, Fortune, and Bloomberg, and we've raised over $600 million of equity capital.Visit www.Avant.com for more information, and check out our employee blog to see what it's like to be an Avantee.***This position will require fluency in the English language at a B2 level or above***What you do at Avant:Work with SMEs to translate business requirements into technical specsDevelop and manage scalable and resilient data pipelines through their entire lifecycle - from design through monitoring and maintenanceDraft and enhance stories/tasksAddress incidents associated with pipelines that cannot be resolved with runbooksWhy you are a fit for Avant:3+ years of data engineering experienceHands-on experience with:Redshift, or similarApache Spark with pythonApache AirflowgitExperience with batch processing required, stream processing preferredComfortable with the Spark job interface and basic profilingExperience with test automation for data pipelines preferredFamiliarity with cloud infrastructure, especially AWS, strongly preferredVery comfortable with SQLWe believe that great ideas come from anyone and anywhere, that everyone is an owner who drives change, and that we have more fun when we work together. We're problem solvers who love collaborating with intelligent and highly-motivated people to reshape the face of digital banking. Avant offers terrific perks and benefits, fun social events with employees who actually like hanging out together, and a flexible growth environment where trying your hand at new projects and being the active owner of your career path is encouraged and supported.

title: Trabajos remotos de Analista de datos Business Intelligence
description: Una empresa estadounidense que está desarrollando una plataforma de envíos para ayudar a las empresas de comercio electrónico a gestionar sus operaciones busca un analista de datos Business Intelligence. El candidato seleccionado para este trabajo remoto será responsable de crear una experiencia de envío atractiva para los clientes. El objetivo de la empresa es igualar las condiciones ofreciendo a las empresas acceso a herramientas y condiciones de envío que de otro modo no tendrían. La empresa ha conseguido más de 152 millones de dólares durante su ronda de financiación de serie E. Este puesto requiere más de 6 horas de superposición con la zona horaria PST.Responsabilidades:Crear sistemas analíticos para procesar y transformar datosConectarse a múltiples transportistas de todo presentar los datos con las técnicas y los artefactos de visualización de datos más eficacesGarantizar que las partes interesadas sean capaces de asimilar los conocimientos de los conjuntos de datos analizadosDiseñar, desarrollar, ampliar y hacer evolucionar nuestras soluciones de inteligencia empresarial de autoservicio (por ejemplo, informes, cuadros de mando y visualizaciones)Utilizar la toma de decisiones basada en datos en toda la organización.)Identificar continuamente oportunidades y demandas para mejorar la gestión, la calidad y la entrega de los datosComunicar y explicar las title: Business Data Engineer
description: 🚀 UST is looking for the very Top Talent…and we would be delighted if you were to join our family!For more than 22 years, UST has worked side by side with the world's best companies to make a real impact through transformation. Powered by technology, inspired by people, and led by our purpose, we partner with our clients from design to operation. We identify their core challenges and craft disruptive solutions that bring their vision to life through our agile approach. Together, with over 30,000 employees in 30 countries, we build for boundless impact—touching billions of lives in the process🔎 What are we looking for?We are seeking hands on Bilingual Business Data Engineer consultants to build out the next generation data warehouse/mess for the organization. To solve the data availability and access issues of all data across the organization. Enabling a graph of connectivity between 100s of data sets.This engineer will leverage our data platforms to achieve this, while providing critical input to extend data platform capabilities. Familiarity with ETL and Cloud Platform data pipeline solutions is critical, as is REST API authoring for data access📋 Main tasks and accountabilities will be:•Member of the Business Date Engineering team, work to deliver Data Ingest/Enrich Pipelines, and Access APIs using common cloud technologies. • Work with consumers to understand the data requirements and deliver data contracts with well defined SLIs to track SLA agreements. • Harness modern application best practices with code quality, API test Coverages, Agile Development, DevOps, and Observability and support. • Maintain programming standards and ensure the usage of the pattern / template for API Proxy. • Conduct code reviews and automatic test coverage • Standardize the CI/CD setup for API management tools and automated deployment. • Utilize problem-solving skills to help your peers in the research and selection of tools, products, and frameworks (which is vital to support business initiatives💡 What UST expects from you?• 5+ years of proven industry experience; bachelor’s degree in IT or related fields • Hands-on development expertise in Java, Python, GraphQL, SQL, Junit, Spring Boot, OpenAPI, Spark, Flink, Kafka • Experience working in cloud data platforms such as Azure, Snowflake, Yellowbrick, Singlestore, GBQ • Strong understanding of Twelve-Factor App Methodology • Solid understanding of API and integration design principles and pattern experience with web technologies. • Design object-oriented, modularized, clean, and maintainable code and creating policies in Java, JavaScript, Node JS, Python etc. • Experience with test-driven development and API testing automation. 💰 What can we offer?❤️ Numerous benefits (Health Care Plan, teleworking compensation, Life Insurances).🎓 Free access to several training platforms🚀 Professional stability and career plans🚶 UST also, compensates referrals from which you could benefit when you refer professionals..If you would like to know more, do not hesitate to apply and we’ll get in touch to fill you in details.UST is waiting for you!

title: Data Engineer Consultant
description: We're looking to add Data Engineers to our growing team with 2+ years of professional experience and proficiency in Python, SQL and AWS or Azure related frameworks and services. By driving requirements gathering/analysis, development, testing, documentation, and deployment tasks, this technical and business-facing role works independently as well as collaboratively to ensure project success for our clients in the United States and abroad. Data Engineer consultants have extensive experience developing solutions using modern data tools and platforms, a strong working knowledge of numerous enabling technologies, and are eager to learn new skills. They are also able to fill different positions on multi-functional and multi-shore project teams, including team lead.Required Knowledge & Skills2+ years of experience in a Data Management/Engineer role using SQL, Python, PySpark and modern cloud based ETL tools and cloud platforms like Snowflake, AWS Glue, Azure Data Factory (ADF), Snaplogic, Google Cloud Platform (GCP), etc.Highly proficient in writing complex SQLPractical experience with data integration/pipeline developmentPractical experience with data quality preferredExcels in a fast paced, agile environment where critical thinking and strong problem-solving skills are required for successCandidates should be proficient in English at a B1/2 level or above with strong written and oral communication skills.OverviewEXL (NASDAQ: EXLS) is a leading operations management and analytics company that designs and enables agile, customer-centric operating models to help clients improve their revenue growth and profitability. Our delivery model provides market-leading business outcomes using EXL’s proprietary Business EXLerator Framework™, cutting-edge analytics, digital transformation and domain expertise. At EXL, we look deeper to help companies improve global operations, enhance data-driven insights, increase customer satisfaction, and manage risk and compliance. EXL serves the insurance, healthcare, banking and financial services, utilities, travel, transportation and logistics industries. Headquartered in New York, New York, EXL has more than 32,000 professionals in locations throughout the United States, Europe, Asia (primarily India and Philippines), South America, Australia and South Africa. For more information, visit www.exlservice.com.EEO/Minorities/Females/Vets/DisabilitiesEXL is an equal opportunity employer, and will provide reasonable accommodation to those individuals who are unable to be vaccinated consistent with federal, state, and local law.

description: Somos el principal operador multimarca de pizza a nivel mundial, liderando nuestras marcas Telepizza, Pizza Hut, Jeno’s Pizza y Apache Pizza en más de 37 países y 2.500 tiendas repartidas por todo el mundo.¡Trabaja con nosotros!Requerimos para nuestro equipo de trabajo Analista de Datos Junior, quien estará a cargo de la transformación de los datos de la empresa, almacenados en diferentes fuentes como Bases de Datos, archivos EXCEL, archivos planos, en plataformas en la nube y otras fuentes, en información que permita a los procesos y directivos llevar a cabo una toma de decisiones más completa y mejor informada, dentro de su labor principal se encuentra el desarrollo de tableros, reportes, formatos. Cuadros de mando y Análisis de tendencias de ventas de mercado, siguiendo la guía técnica y funcional del Analista señor de BI, debe contar con estudios técnicos, tecnólogo o profesional en carreras administrativas o ingenierías.Funciones En La Operatividad Como- Reporting Diario, Semanal y Mensual para Operaciones y Marketing- Elaborar Cuadros de Mando- Análisis de tendencias de ventas y de mercado- Data Quality- Gobierno del DatoBeneficios Contratación: Directo por la empresa a término fijo + Beneficios de la compañía Salario: 2.200.000 + Beneficios de permanencia. Trabajo: 80% remoto 20% presencial (solo si se requiere)EXPERIENCIA MÍNIMO: NingunaAdjunta tu hoja de vida y te llamaremos de inmediato.

title: Data Analyst
description: Who are we?Amaris Consulting es una firma independiente de asesoría tecnológica que ofrece servicios de orientación y soluciones para las empresas.Reúne a más de 6.000 personas distribuidas en 5 continentes y más de 60 países. Con más de 1.000 clientes en todo el mundo, hemos implementado soluciones en proyectos importantes durante más de una década.Nuestros especialistas cubren sectores que abarcan desde servicios financieros y transporte hasta atención sanitaria y tecnología.Amaris es su ‘stepping stone’ para atravesar ríos de cambio, afrontar retos y realizar todos sus proyectos con éxito.Job DescriptionBuscamos consultores dinámicos para hacer crecer nuestro equipo de Sistemas de Información y Digital en Colombia. Tu experiencia, conocimiento y compromiso nos ayudarán a afrontar los retos de nuestros clientes.Estarás apoyando diferentes proyectos a través de tu experiencia como Data Analyst.Sus principales responsabilidades:Trabajar con los líderes de la compañía para resolver problemas de negocio con la comprensión del análisis de los datos para prever nuevas tendencias y proporcionar alternativas para optimizar los resultadosMantener un análisis de datos preciso para garantizar la toma de mejores decisionesMejorar los procesos de análisis de datosRequisitos:Título en informática (máster o Ingeniero)Al menos 3 años de experiencia como Data AnalystExperiencia con ETL, GCPExcelentes habilidades de comunicación en inglés y español Amaris Consulting se enorgullece de ser un lugar de trabajo con igualdad de oportunidades. Estamos comprometidos con la promoción de la diversidad dentro de la plantilla y la creación de un entorno de trabajo inclusivo. Para ello, damos la bienvenida a las solicitudes de todos los candidatos cualificados, independientemente de su género, orientación sexual, raza, etnia, creencias, edad, estado civil, discapacidad u otras características.

title: Product Data Analyst
description: Who We Are And What We DoDeel is a global team that helps businesses hire anyone, anywhere, easily. Deel consists of more than two thousand self-driven individuals spanning over 80 countries. Our unified yet diverse culture keeps us continually learning and innovating the Deel platform and our products for customers.Companies should be able to hire the best talent anywhere in the world, so we are building the best platform to make that a reality. Our market-leading technology, expertise, and global team are crucial to the success of Deel’s platform. We deliver the best products and platform features in our space, enabling millions of jobs worldwide and connecting the global workforce with the best companies and opportunities.Why should you be part of Deel's success story?A 30-mile hiring radius should no longer dictate how companies hire because great talent lives everywhere. Deel sees a world without hiring borders and endless talent that pairs perfect candidates with great companies.We offer global teams all the tools they need to hire, onboard, manage, pay, and scale at full speed. We aim to foster a diverse global economy by building a generational platform that seamlessly connects companies with talent worldwide.There’s never been a more exciting time to join Deel — the market leader in international payroll and compliance.DutiesCollaborate with Product Managers, Product Operations and Dev Teams on different problems to create actionable insightsMonitor product and feature release performance, define baselines, success metrics and provide recommendations for optimisation and product directionDrive product strategy by proactively preparing business cases and providing data and insightsAnalyse market data, identify customer behaviour and trendsHelp design and evaluate A/B tests to improve customer journeysDevelop user friendly dashboards and high quality data visualisations that drive actions and support decision makingExplore large and complex datasets to create actionable insightsProduce high quality, clean, maintainable analytical codeBuild data models in dbt with the support of Analytics Engineers to create the cleanest data structures and KPIs for your product areasRequirementsBachelor Degree in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Economics or equivalent degree3+ years experience in product analytics or related analytics areaHands on experience in Looker and dbtProficiency in SQL and product analytics tools (mixpanel / heap / amplitude)Excellent multitasking and problem-solving abilitiesEffective communication skillsAvailable under European timezonesWe’d especially love to speak with you if:You love data exploration and visualisationsHave experience with snowflake and LookMLYou are driven by business impact generated from your insightsYou are naturally curious and enjoy challenging the status quoYou are proactive and like to take responsibility in projects, managing requirements and collaborating with a number of different teams across the companyYou know when to go deep on a task and when to executeTotal RewardsOur workforce deserves fair and competitive pay that meets them where they are. With scalable benefits, rewards, and perks, our total rewards programs reflect our commitment to inclusivity and access for all.At Deel, you’ll enjoy:Computer equipment applicable to your roleStock grant opportunitiesAdditional perks and benefits based upon your employment status and countryThe ability to choose where you work whether it be your home, the beach, or a WeWorkAt Deel, we're an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

title: Growth Data Analyst
description: ¡Frubana es una Scale-Up B2B de tecnología de rápido crecimiento que está revolucionando el mundo de los alimentos y el sector restaurantero en LatAm! 🚀Nuestro objetivo es que la comida en LatAm sea más accesible a través de una cadena de suministro eficiente y digitalizada, y de un producto (App) y experiencia de cliente innovadora. Actualmente operamos en México (CDMX, Puebla, Guadalajara, Monterrey), Brasil (São Paulo, Belo Horizonte) y Colombia (Bogotá, Barranquilla, Medellín), conectando al campo y a diferentes proveedores con la ciudad. Servimos a +60.000 clientes en LatAm; crecemos a una tasa de +15% mensual. 🥑🍍🍅Hacemos parte de Y Combinator, la misma aceleradora de AirBnB, Dropbox y Rappi. Adicionalmente contamos con una de las bases de inversionistas más sólidas del mundo: Monashees, GGV, Softbank, Tiger Global, Lightspeed, entre otros.¡Únete a nuestro equipo! ⚡As a Growth Data Analyst, you'll be the point of contact for the LatAm Cross Selling, Discounting and Retention team within the Growth area. Your mission is to realize Frubana's vision of becoming the one-stop shop for restaurants in LatAm. If you have an analytical mind, an entrepreneurial mindset and like to see the impact of your work, this role is for you.The type of questions you will be looking to answer in your day-to-day work: How do we encourage the sales team to offer more product categories to our customers? How do we get a restaurant to buy the chicken, vegetables, rice and all the other inputs they need from Frubana?What will you do?Challenge yourself every day, thinking and building innovative solutions to encourage our customers to buy more and more product categories at FrubanaDevelop the ability to generate data-driven insights, detect opportunities and turn them into concrete business actions that drive Frubana's growth - you will be a key part of the company's growth engine! Constantly experiment - you will design and implement pilots to test new ideas to help our customers discover Frubana's product catalogAdapt to change in a dynamic work environment where you will live the adrenaline of driving Frubana's metrics and resultsRequirements...Good command of Google Suite and Google Sheets (is a MUST). Intermediate knowledge of SQL and database queriesAdvanced knowledge of Python and/or data science and Machine Learning concepts (essential requirement). Autonomy to execute tasks and projectsAbility to execute fast, and with attention to detailAgile and hands-on problem solving mindsetExcellent numerical and analytical skills as well as communication skills. Come & Join this incredible Team!Te invitamos a navegar en:Nuestra plataforma: https://www.frubana.com/Nuestro Career Site: https://jobs.frubana.com/Conoce algunas noticias sobre Frubana:https://forbes.co/2021/06/01/actualidad/frubana-levanta-us65-millones-tras-triplicar-sus-ventas-abasteciendo-restaurantes/https://www.forbes.com/sites/rebeccaszkutak/2021/06/01/restaurant-tech-startup-frubana-was-able-to-triple-its-sales-during-the-pandemic/https://www.portafolio.co/negocios/emprendimiento/frubana-el-emprendimiento-quiere-expandir-su-negocio-a-america-latina-552736https://www.fastcompany.com/90600367/latin-america-most-innovative-companies-2021https://news.crunchbase.com/news/pivots-and-persistence-how-startups-in-latin-america-are-finding-ways-to-survive-the-current-crisis/https://forbes.co/2020/04/17/emprendedores/frubana-recauda-us25-millones-para-su-plataforma-agro/

description: ¡Frubana es una Scale-Up B2B de tecnología de rápido crecimiento que está revolucionando el mundo de los alimentos y el sector restaurantero en LatAm! 🚀Nuestro objetivo es que la comida en LatAm sea más accesible a través de una cadena de suministro eficiente y digitalizada, y de un producto (App) y experiencia de cliente innovadora. Actualmente operamos en México (CDMX, Puebla, Guadalajara, Monterrey), Brasil (São Paulo, Belo Horizonte) y Colombia (Bogotá, Barranquilla, Medellín), conectando al campo y a diferentes proveedores con la ciudad. title: Routing Data Analyst
description: Estamos en búsqueda de una persona analítica que se una al equipo de Routing Planning, que será responsable de garantizar una excelente planeación de las rutas de Frubana. Será responsable de KPIs, dar visibilidad de cada proceso de la planeación de las rutas desde que el cliente pide la orden hasta que el conductor la entrega. Utilizarás técnicas analíticas, desarrollarás algoritmos de predicción y/o investigación de operaciones para dar valor a la operación.Lo que harás...Con SQL, dar visibilidad a través de dashboards de los KPIs de cada parte del proceso de la planeación de las rutas. Automatizar procesos mediante algoritmos globales y ser responsable de implementarlos en cada ciudad donde Frubana opera. Crear alertas para garantizar la correcta ejecución de los algoritmos. Darle seguimiento a los procesos implementados y hablar con responsables de otras áreas para asegurar su implementación. Encontrar oportunidades de mejora, teniendo en cuenta las restricciones del negocio y las prioridades de la organizaciónLo que necesitas...Egresado en ciencias exactas como estadística, ingeniería, ciencias de computación, etc. Afinidad con el área de ciencia de datos Pensamiento crítico a través de números. Alta habilidad analítica. Conocimiento de SQL. Diferencial: python (librerías pandas, numpy, scikit-learn), manejo de APIs y experiencia en investigación de operaciones

title: Data Visualization Analyst
description: It started with one ridiculously good idea - Create a different breed of BPO! We at TaskUs understand that achieving growth for our partners requires a culture of constant motion; exploring new technologies, being ready to handle any challenge in a moment's notice, mastering consistency in an ever-changing world - that's what it takes to get there. If that's something you want to be apart of, apply today!TaskUs is a provider of outsourced digital services and next-generation customer experience to fast-growing technology companies, helping its clients represent, protect and grow their brands. Leveraging a cloud-based infrastructure, TaskUs serves clients in the fastest-growing sectors, including social media, e-commerce, gaming, streaming media, food delivery, ride sharing, HiTech, FinTech, and HealthTech. As of March 31, 2022, TaskUs had approximately 45,800 employees across twenty-three locations in 12 countries, including the United States, the Philippines, and India.It started with one ridiculously good idea - Create a different breed of BPO! We at TaskUs understand that achieving growth for our partners requires a culture of constant motion; exploring new technologies, being ready to handle any challenge at a moment's notice, and mastering consistency in an ever-changing world - that's what it takes to get there. If that's something you want to be a part of, apply today!What can you expect in a Data Visualization Analyst role with TaskUs:As a Data Visualization Analyst you will play a critical role as a strategic advisor to business functions and leaders across the company. You will work on developing dashboards and reports for the business. You will work closely with internal and external stakeholders (Business Insights, Data Engineering, Operations, Support groups, etc.) to make sure that correct and updated information on all dashboards and reports is available to the business at all times.This role requires both strong technical data skills and business acumen. Ultimate success in this role goes beyond data-related activities and delivers the "so what" that drives decisions and real business impact. You will need to fully understand the business function (processes, objectives, organization, performance drivers, barriers), and have the ability to connect the dots between data analysis, business strategy, and operational effectiveness.You will need to be a critical thinker, problem-solver, and self-starter. Our Data Visualization Analysts are driven and proactive, think independently and do not just take orders. There must be an ability to see the bigger picture to make cross-functional connections in both business processes and data. There is an expectation that you not only answer the question that was asked but the question that wasn't. It will be important for you to build positive relationships across the organization and have a "find a way" attitude.Responsibilities:Design performance efficient, impactful reports and visualizations for business and technical audiences.Making large and/or complex data more accessible, understandable and usable.Transforming, improving and integrating data, depending on the business requirements.Responsible for data federation.Create and maintain a reports' instruction manual.Delivering the data in a useful and appealing way to users.Qualifications / Requirements:Required Skills:2+ years hands-on experience in Power BI or other foundational Power BI applications such as Power Pivot. Same length of experience in Tableau, Qlikview, Business Objects can be considered.2+ years of exposure to ETL, databases / data warehouse that relates to developing reports using Power BI.Ability to work with large amounts of information and see the 'bigger picture'.Team player who builds strong relationships and establishes trust with business leaders, Engineers, and colleagues.Work collaboratively and independently; take ownership of quality, accuracy, and timeliness of deliverables.Excellent analytical and problem solving skills.Strong attention to detail and critical thinking skills.Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to explain complex issues in a simple and intuitive way. Must be at a C1 English level in verbal and written communication to be considered for this role. Must upload a resume in English for consideration.Preferred Skills:Experience with process improvement is a plus.Excellent math skills (optional but preferred)Programming background (is a plus!)Education / Certifications:College Diploma or University Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Information Technology, or equivalent experience.Work Location/ Work Schedule/ Travel:Cali, Colombia / Cali-Remote48 hours weeklyIn TaskUs we believe that innovation and higher performance are brought by people from all walks of life. We welcome applicants of different backgrounds, demographics, and circumstances. Inclusive and equitable practices are our responsibility as a business.TaskUs is committed to providing equal access to opportunities. If you need reasonable accommodation in any part of the hiring process, please let us know.TaskUs will neither solicit money from you during your application process nor require any form of payment in order to proceed with your application. Kindly ensure that you are always in communication with only authorized recruiters of TaskUs.If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!TaskUs is an Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Científico/Científica de Datos | Entorno de Productos (middle)
description: A través de la analítica creamos capacidades utilizando los datos y tecnologías de la información que permiten la toma de decisiones y el desarrollo de nuevos productos o servicios que entiendan las necesidades de nuestros clientes y usuarios, promoviendo así el desarrollo sostenible para lograr el bienestar. 🌍  ¿Por qué ser parte de la comunidad analítica en Bancolombia?🚀 Trabajarás en un ambiente de trabajo que promueve la colaboración a través de la toma de decisiones basadas en análisis de datos.📝 Profundizarás tus conocimientos en matemáticas, estadística, ciencia de la computación y el negocio financiero.💻 Aportaras a la arquitectura de la información por medio de soluciones transversales que impactan múltiples servicios.¿Cuál será tu reto?Movilizarás el desarrollo de los modelos analíticos para los canales del Banco y sus regiones desde el aspecto técnico (matemático, estadístico, econométrico), a través de los diferentes equipos analíticos del negocio, con base en la aplicación de las mejores prácticas y técnicas avanzadas de modelamiento, con el objetivo de usar la información como ventaja competitiva para conocer al cliente y enriquecer nuestra propuesta de valor.¿Qué harías?Analizarás datos de distintos tipos y formatos para extraer información que pueda ser utilizada para que el negocio pueda tomar acciones.Determinarás los conjuntos de datos y variables necesarias para realizar análisis sobre la información.Usarás modelos y algoritmos estadísticos, matemáticos, para identificar patrones, anomalías o realizar predicciones sobre un problema.Desarrollarás visualizaciones y reportes que expliquen las características intrínsecas de los datos y la información/conocimiento expuesto por ellos.Crearás features, métodos de regresión¿Qué te hará exitoso/a en el rol?Formación en Estadística o Ingeniería con posgrado en estadística/ Analítica/Data Scientist o afines.Requeridos:Experiencia en Analítica: Modelos / Programación, análisis descriptivos, bases de datos ETL.Alto conocimiento enBases de datos, SQL, Impala, Python, Spark, SAS, R, técnicas de calendarización, ecosistema analítico.Habilidad para optimizar losprocesos de machine learning.Conocimiento en técnicas para lageneración de redes neuronales y estar en capacidad de implementarlo e interpretarlo.¿Qué te ofrecemos?Somos una organización centrada en las personas.Trabajarás con equipos que movilizan un propósito trascendente, donde recibirás herramientas y recursos para tu desarrollo personal y profesional, a través de una cultura que hace la diferencia, brindándote bienestar laboral, personal y relacional. Además de esto, podrás disfrutar de:18.4 salarios anuales.Hasta 6 salarios de remuneración variable.Hasta 20 días de vacaciones remuneradas.Modalidades de trabajo flexible en ambientes híbridos.Contratación indefinidaFlexibilidad horaria en festividades.Planes de ahorro, financiación y exenciones bancarias.Seguros de vida y salud.Convenios comerciales, educativos, culturales, deportivos ¡y muchos más!Haz clic en aplicar, súmate a nuestro propósito y aportaremos juntos al bienestar. ¡Anímate a participar! 🚀

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description: At Snappr, we're changing the world by making amazing photography accessible to everyone. We take on complex problems so that photographers, consumers and businesses can connect in more than 200 cities around the world to create and access beautiful photos.We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to build a future where people can capture their special memories easily and affordably. If you have the drive, passion, and collaborative spirit to work with us, let’s revolutionize photography together.About the role:With our global footprint and hyper growth, one of Snappr’s top priorities is to better use data in how we scale and make decisions in our business. As a Business Intelligence Analyst on our Operations team, you will be responsible for helping us decide what to build and how it should be used. You will also be responsible for deriving actionable insights from more complicated analysis that inform the processes of every team from Sales to Support The ideal candidate should be fluent in all aspects of data analysts, from integration to visualization, and using data to tell compelling stories. You should also be comfortable with ambiguity and enjoy working cross-functionally with a diverse team. Experience in a similar analytics role at a startup preferred but not requiredWhat you'll do:Data visualization and reporting: create and maintain real-time dashboards and reports across multiple business teams, including Support, Editing, Acquisitions, and various enterprise clients using best-in-class solutionsProduct and Operations analytics: coordinate with engineering, product, and operations teams to measure the impact of experiments, new products, and new processesData integration and maintenance: import, clean, and audit data from multiple sources and combine it with product and booking information to create a comprehensive and accurate view of the entire business Forecasting: use data from various sources to create predictive models that project expected volume of bookings, support tickets, editing jobs, photographers onboarded, and sales conversions Strategic deep-dives: Proactively analyze data to answer key questions from stakeholders (or out of self-initiated curiosity) with an eye for what drives business performance, investigating and communicating areas for improvement in efficiencyCollaborate with leadership team: work closely with team and department leads to identify gaps in current system and tooling capabilities, brainstorm innovative solutions, and quickly implement new ideas to keep every team as efficient as possibleWhat you'll need:2-4 years of experience in analytics at a technology companyBilingual proficiency in written and spoken EnglishAdvanced SQL, spreadsheet, and data visualization expertiseExperience in scripting languages for analysis (R, Python) highly preferredAbility to communicate effectively and build relationships with stakeholders with technical and non-technical backgroundsAbility to distill insights from complex analysis into interesting and concise stories to build buy-in from a diverse set of stakeholdersGrit and hustle with a self-starter attitude - the more you can drive your own work the more effective you will be in this roleAbility to balance attention to detail with swift execution - we need to do things quickly, and do them wellJob benefits:competitive salary 50k-70k yearequity ownership in the companyAbout the team:Snappr is the largest on-demand marketplace for professional photography in the world. We are a team of driven, entrepreneurial individuals who are redefining photography everywhere. You will get to work directly with the founding team, in particular with the Head of Operations. This is an awesome opportunity to be at the ground level of a rapidly growing product and to have a meaningful impact on its growth. The end-result of everything you'll do at Snappr is more people capturing more of their most precious life moments. Our rocket-ship has a seat open just for you.
