title: BI Data Analytics Specialist
description: ¿Qué tal construir un mundo mejor mientras haces parte de una de las compañías de consumo masivo más grandes del mundo, donde puedes transformar tus ideas en realidades, siendo tu mismo? Te invitamos a ser parte de nuestro equipo y #VeaUnilever.Pero primero, un mensaje importante.La diversidad es uno de nuestros pilares más relevantes y nuestro principal objetivo es desarrollar un entorno interno abierto a la multiplicidad de pensamientos, a través de la inclusión sin estereotipos. Esto nos permite valorar a los mejores profesionales, juntando diversos perfiles y estilos, y afrontando mejor los retos actuales y futuros de la compaña.En Unilever, más del 50% de los puestos de liderazgo están ocupados por mujeres. Y queremos más diversidad en nuestra compañía. De esta manera, consideramos a todos los candidatos / candidatos para nuestras vacantes, independientemente de su discapacidad, raza, color, religión, género e identidad de género, nacionalidad, orientación sexual, ascendencia, edad o cualquier otra diversidad.¿Es esta una vacante para mí?En esta vacante, serás responsable de desarrollar, construir, probar y mantener arquitecturas, como bases de datos y sistemas de procesamiento a gran escala.¿Cómo vas a construir un mundo mejor?Serás Responsable DeAnalizar de rendimiento diario de ventas, rebajas, notas de crédito.Mantener y gestionar datos maestros e informes de SAP.Ejecutar todos los análisis para brindar una guía clara al negocio utilizando todas las fuentes de datos.Crear conocimientos a través de modelos de datos a partir de los datos centrados en el operador.Ajustar los modelos predictivos globales para localizar los resultados.Analizar datos SISO y oportunidades por volumen, agarrar y agarrar.Manténgase curioso y entusiasta sobre el uso de algoritmos para resolver problemas y entusiasme a otros para que vean el beneficio de su trabajo.Crear informes claros que cuenten historias convincentes sobre cómo los clientes o clientes trabajan con el negocio.Buscar oportunidades para utilizar conocimientos/conjuntos de datos/código/modelos en otras funciones de la organización.Realizar investigaciones a partir de las cuales desarrollará prototipos y pruebas de conceptos.¿Qué no te puede faltar para venir a este equipo?Los Requisitos SonProfesional bilingüe en Finanzas, Ingeniería Industrial o Estadística.Experiencia mínima de 3 años en administración y análisis de datos.¿Qué puedes esperar a cambio?Nuestros Beneficios SonContrato Indefinido.Trabajar en una compañía con un propósito poderoso que es hacer de la sostenibilidad algo cotidianoDescuentos en productos Unilever.Beneficios extralegales y salario competitivo.Trabajarás en una de las multinacionales más grandes del mundo con presencia en más de 190 países y con más de 300 marcas.¿Por qué ser #Unilever?Ser parte de Unilever es unirte a transformar la vida de millones de personas, a través de nuestras marcas, donde tu manera única de ver el mundo será el punto de partida para cambiarlo. Estamos convencidos que disfrutar es la manera de hacer las cosas, y eso sólo es posible siendo tú mismo.Ser parte de Unilever es trabajar con la libertad para transformar ideas en realidades y con tu propio estilo construir un futuro mejor.Somos una compañía global de consumo masivo que ha estado construyendo un mundo mejor en Colombia. Nuestro propósito es hacer de la sostenibilidad un lugar común para todas las personas a través de nuestras marcas, que están en el hogar del 100% de los Colombianos (Fruco, Maizena, Knorr, Sedal, Savital, Dove, Ponds, Fab, 3D..).#VenaUnileverUnilever is an organisation committed to equity, inclusion and diversity to drive our business results and create a better future, every day, for our diverse employees, global consumers, partners, and communities. We believe a diverse workforce allows us to match our growth ambitions and drive inclusion across the business. At Unilever we are interested in every individual bringing their ‘Whole Self’ to work and this includes you! Thus if you require any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of your application so that we can support you through your recruitment journey.

title: Analista de Master Data Latam
description: Quiénes somos?En Aptar, utilizamos conocimientos, diseño, ingeniería y ciencia para crear tecnologías de envasado innovadoras que generan valor de marca para nuestros clientes y, a su vez, marcan una diferencia significativa en la vida, el aspecto, la salud y los hogares de personas de todo el mundo.Todos los días, Aptar crea "momentos a-ha" para sus clientes y sus consumidores y pacientes al traer continuamente innovaciones al mercado que convierten los envases no dosificadores en sistemas innovadores de dosificación de productos, incluidos aquellos que brindanlas personas tienen formas más efectivas de ponerse su fragancia favorita, los niños tienen la oportunidad de verter ketchup sin ensuciar y los pacientes conectan tecnologías que les ayudan a adherirse más fácilmente al tratamiento.Tenemos plantas de fabricación en América del Norte, Europa, Asia y América del Sur y más de 14 000 empleados dedicados en unos 20 países.Porqué deberías trabajar aquí porque nosotros:Atraemos y desarrollar personas de alto desempeño.Promovemos un entorno de trabajo diverso e inclusivo.Permitimos el error al permitir que las personas cometan errores a través de un entorno abierto y de confianza.Invertimos en el desarrollo de los empleados a través de oportunidades de carrera locales, regionales y globales.Contribuimos a las comunidades donde residimos.Qué tenemos de nuevo Aptar?Tenemos una emocionante posición llamada Master Data Analyst para la región de Latin America. Esta posición está abierta en Cali, Colombia | Cajamar, Brazil, | Querétaro, México and Berazategui, Argentina, y la misión principal será: Colaborar en la ingeniería de valor para productos y componentes existentes, tanto estándar como personalizados; además, ejecute la codificación de productos en el sistema ERP asegurando consistencia, cumplimiento y velocidadAsí será tu puesto en AptarColaborar en el desarrollo de mejoras para productos estándar y personalizados existentes.Colaborar en el desarrollo de extensiones de línea para productos estándar y personalizados.Reportar cambios de ingeniería.Mantenga modelos 3D para productos y componentes existentes en el entorno MCAD.Mantener planos PRD de productos y componentes.Mantenga los dibujos CST del producto.Informe de la historia de los dibujos.Crear y mantener especificaciones individuales de productos.Crear y mantener Fichas Técnicas de productos estándar.Cree presentaciones internas de productos para productos existentes.Cree presentaciones de productos para clientes para productos existentes.Publique datos de productos de PDMLink a APTAR 1 SAP a través de Innoface.Ejecutar y mantener la codificación de productos en APTAR 1 SAP.Trabajar con el equipo de CMDG en iniciativas de limpieza y mejora de datos.Calificaciones requeridasRequisitos: Educación:Título técnico en Diseño de Producto, Diseño Industrial, Ingeniería Mecánica u otro campo empresarial relacionado.Es deseable asistir a la universidad o título universitario en Ingeniería Mecánica o campos comerciales relacionados.Experiencia:1 a 3 años en posiciones similares.Son deseables posiciones en la industria del embalaje o entornos B2B.Los puestos en empresas multinacionales y multiculturales son deseables.Habilidades y capacidades:Capacidad para combinar un sólido pensamiento analítico y una metodología con una creatividad innovadora.Buena relación con los clientes.Capacidad para trabajar oportunamente en varios proyectos al mismo tiempo, involucrando diferentes clientes internos y externos, complejidades del producto, etapas del proyecto, países y sitios involucrados, etc.Habilidad para trabajar en equipos multiculturales, liderando a las personas detrás y alrededor, o siendo liderado por otros hacia resultados específicos.Habilidad para comprender, permitir y disfrutar las diferencias culturales intrarregionales y extrarregionales que puedan tener impacto en las decisiones empresariales del día a día.Buenas habilidades de comunicación, incluida la narración de historias.Comportamiento responsable con los activos y conocimientos de la empresa.LO QUE OFRECEMOS:Sueldo base competitivoUn entorno de trabajo emocionante, diverso y basado en el valor.Universidad corporativa galardonada que ofrece desarrollo personal y oportunidades de capacitación.SE TU MISMO, SE PARTE DE APTARAptar es un empleador que ofrece igualdad de oportunidades. Creemos que una fuerza laboral diversa es clave para nuestro éxito. Damos la bienvenida a las solicitudes de todos los miembros de la sociedad, independientemente de su edad, sexo, discapacidad, orientación sexual, raza, religión o creencias._______________________________Who we areAt Aptar, we use insights, design, engineering and science to create innovative packaging technologies that build brand value for our customers, and, in turn, make a meaningful difference in the lives, looks, health and homes of people around the world.Every day, Aptar creates “a-ha moments” for its customers and their consumers and patients by continually bringing innovations to market that convert non-dispensing packaging into breakthrough product-dispensing systems, including those that givepeople more effective ways to put on their favorite fragrance, kids the opportunity to pour ketchup without making a mess and patients connected technologies that help them more easily adhere to treatment.We have manufacturing facilities in North America, Europe, Asia and South America and over 14,000 dedicated employees in some 20 countries.You should work here because we:Attract and develop high performing people.Promote a diverse and inclusive work environment.Allow for failure by allowing people to make mistakes through an open and trusting environment.Invest in the development of employees through local, regional and global career opportunities.Contribute to the communities where we reside.What’s new with AptarWe have an exciting position open in Argentina Master Data Analyst for Latam Region. This position is opened in Cali, Colombia | Cajamar, Brazil, | Querétaro, Mexico and Berazategui, Argentina, the main mission would beCollaborate in value engineering for existing products and components, both standard and custom; additionally, run product codification in ERP system ensuring consistency, compliance and speedThis is how your journey beginsCollaborate in the development of improvements for existing standard and custom products.Collaborate in the development of line extensions for standard and custom products.Report engineering changes.Maintain 3D models for existing products and components in MCAD environment.Maintain product and component PRD drawings.Maintain product CST drawings.Report drawings history.Create and maintain product Individual Specifications.Create and maintain Technical Data Sheets for standard products.Create internal product presentations for existing products.Create customer product presentations for existing products.Publish product data from PDMLink to APTAR 1 SAP via Innoface.Run and maintain product codification into APTAR 1 SAP.Work with CMDG team in data cleansing and improvement initiativesRequired Qualifications  Education:Technical degree in Product Design, Industrial Design, Mechanical Engineering or other related business field.Attending university or university degree on Mechanical Engineering or related business fields is desirable.Experience:1 to 3 years in similar positions.Positions in the packaging industry or B2B environments are desirable.Positions in multi-national and multi-cultural companies are desirable.Skills/Abilities:Ability to combine strong analytical thinking and methodology with out-of-the-box creativity.Good relationship with customers.Ability to timely work in several projects at the same time, involving different internal and external customers, product complexities, project stages, countries and sites involved, etc.Ability to work in multi-cultural teams, leading the people behind and around, or being led by others towards specific results.Ability to understand, allow and enjoy intra-region and extra-region cultural differences that could have impact in the day-to-day business decisions.Good communication skills, including storytelling.Responsible behavior towards the company assets and expertise.WHAT WE OFFER:Competitive base salaryAn Exciting, Diverse and value based working environmentAward-winning Corporate University offering personal development and training opportunities.Be You. Be AptarAptar is an equal opportunities employer. We believe that a diverse workforce is key to our success. We welcome applications from all members of society irrespective of age, sex, disability, sexual orientation, race, religion or belief.

Persona dinámica (o), con deseos de aprendizaje de nuevas tecnologías, proactiva (o) y con orientación al logro.Requerimientos:En NEORIS continuamos creciendo y queremos que participes sumando más personas a nuestros equipos. Invítalos a ser parte de nuevos y desafiantes proyectos que abarcan múltiples geografías favoreciendo su desarrollo profesional.INGENIERO DE DATOS / AZURE DATABRICKSEstamos buscando Ingenieros de Datos para un proyecto con el Team Chile. para un proceso de migración, estableciendo conexiones con diferentes bases de datos, orquestado a través de un ETL en Databricks. Proveemos un servicio de alta calidad con nuestras 27 oficinas, Delivery Centers y Laboratorios de Innovación, donde trabajan algunas de las mejores mentes de la industria para generar el futuro de los negocios.Ofrecemos: Crecimiento Profesional  Ambiente laboral dinámimico  Atractivo plan de beneficios  Prestaciones de ley  Oportunidades de desarrollo Te invitamos a conocernos en http://www.neoris.com , Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter o Instagram: @NEORIS. title: Desarrollador de Big Data
description: ¡Únete a CGI!Forma parte de una de las cinco empresas más grandes de consultoría en TI!En CGI estamos buscando Desarrolladores Big Data bilingües para trabajar con nosotros de manera utilizando Hadoop, Hive, MapReduce y otras pilas de tecnología Hadoop.Experto en programación Core Java.Tiene experiencia en RDBMS/NOSQL distribuido o de gran escala.Tiene 1 año de experiencia en un independiente componentes/módulos de aplicaciones específicos.Tiene experiencia en la creación de aplicaciones utilizando Hadoop, Hive, MapReduce y otras pilas de tecnología de Hadoop.Tiene distribuido.Realiza depuración y ajuste de rendimiento para los componentes desarrollados.Tiene 1-2 años de experiencia en un Proyecto Big Data.Competente con Linux/Unix y herramientas/plataformas de código abierto.Tiene excelentes habilidades analíticas y sólidas habilidades de comunicación verbal y escrita.Tiene experiencia trabajando en metodologías ágiles de desarrollo.Ha implementado prueba soluciones de Hadoop para interpretar los grandes volúmenes de datos.Indispensable experiencia de 6 a 8 años:Ofrecemos:Contrato indefinidoSalario acorde a la experiencia y formaciónBeneficios description: The Senior Data Engineer position is a highly technical role responsible for complex data models and guiding the organization's data aggregation, transformation and analysis efforts.Technical Expertise4+ years of experience designing and building data systems, data models and data pipelines.Demonstrable ability to complete complex data analysis to meet business requirementsExperience operating under strict data security & privacy protocolsProfessional CharacteristicsGreat analytical and problem-solving skills.Strong entrepreneurial drive, creative hands-on personality and proactive result-driven approachIntermediate to Advanced English and Native Spanish communication skillsEmpowerment Labs' mission is to use data, AI and mobile applications to empower the global citizen and breakdown inefficient markets. title: Big Data Engineer
description: DescriptionEsta es tu oportunidad para unirte a un equipo diverso de personas apasionadas por el Big Data.En buenas manos ¡las tuyas! las enormes cantidades de información que las empresas recopilan hoy pueden convertirse en un activo muy valioso manejadas estratégicamente. Ayudamos a nuestros clientes a ser más eficientes haciendo el mejor uso posible de los datos, aprovechados por los expertos para impulsar un nuevo motor de crecimiento de servicios de información.Si te gusta aprender y disfrutas de una gran pasión por trabajar con nuevas tecnologías además de ayudar a los clientes a administrar los datos de manera efectiva para generar conocimiento y valor, este es tu sitio. Estamos buscando desarrolladores en Accenture, el lugar perfecto para continuar construyendo tu carrera. Nuestro equipo está creciendo por lo que siempre estamos atentos a nuevo talento como el tuyo. Las oportunidades dentro de las emocionantes iniciativas en el entorno digital que llevamos a cabo con nuestros clientes son ilimitadas, por tanto no te faltarán inspiración o desafíos.Algunas de tus responsabilidades: Desarrollo de software usando tecnologías Big Data Formar parte de equipos multidisciplinaresParticipación en proyectos para grandes clientes¿Te unes al Big Data | Accenture Technology team? ¡Aplica online!#BigDataNinjaQualificationsRequisitos: Titulación técnica: Informática u otras con experiencia equivalente (Telecomunicaciones, Matemáticas, Física, otras ingenierías, etc.) +2 años de experiencia real en producción con tecnologías Big Data (Spark, Hive, Kafka, Flink, etc.) Alguna/varias bases de datos NoSQL (MongoDB, HBase, ElasticSearch, Cassandra, etc.) Herramientas Agile (Jira, Jenkins, Bamboo, Git, Sonar, etc.)Valorable: Experiencia en AWS o Azure Certificaciones en AWS, Azure o Big Data (Cloudera, Databricks, MongoDB, Kafka, etc.) Experiencia en proyectos para grandes clientesAccenture ofrece igualdad de oportunidades y acepta solicitudes de todos los sectores de la sociedad y no discrimina por motivos de raza, religión o creencias, origen étnico o nacional, discapacidad, edad, ciudadanía, estado civil, orientación sexual o Identidad de género, o cualquier otra base según lo protegido por la ley vigente.

title: Live Feed Data Analyst - Service Provider
description: A Bit About UsGenius Sports is the official data, technology and commercial partner that powers the global ecosystem connecting sports, betting and media.Our mission is to champion a more sustainable sports data ecosystem that benefits all parties - from the rights holder all the way through to the fan.We are the trusted partner to over 500 sports organizations globally, capturing the highest quality data for many of the world’s largest leagues and federations such as the NFL, NBA, MLB, English Premier League, Serie A, FIBA and the NCAA.From enabling leagues to take control of their official data, to creating immersive fan experiences for sports, betting and media organizations, we are driven to the deliver the difference for our partners.OUR DIVISIONSSPORTSTECHData capture, management and analysis tools that help leagues run their sport, unlock new revenue streams, and protect the integrity of their competitions.VIDEOFully automated streaming technology, production and distribution services that help showcase sports to the world.SPORTSBOOKEverything an operator needs to manager their sportsbook and grow profits – all powered by the finest live sports data available.MEDIA & ENGAGEMENTWe help brands and publishers engage and monetize sports fans with personalized campaigns and content they will love.The RoleAs a Live Feed Analyst, you will monitor and collect the play-by-play information of a variety of sports events including Football, American Football, Ice Hockey, Basketball, Volleyball, Table Tennis, among many others. Our work will be especially on weekends, using our top-tier technology to provide fast, accurate, and reliable information to our customers. Experience is not necessary.Main ResponsibilitiesTo monitor and collect data from live sports events all around the world.To communicate and provide support to our Sports Reporters.To react and resolve in case of any discrepancy in our information compared to various external sources.To communicate and report any issue encountered to the respective Supervisor. Required SkillsPassion for sportsGood English communication skillsGood willingness and availability to work during the weekends.Excellent attention to detailAbility to work under pressureGood multitasking and proven solving skillsAbility to acquire knowledge quickly and accurately.Flexibility and resourcefulness.We OfferAs well as a competitive salary and annual leave allowance, our benefits include health insurance, skills training and much more, depending on location. We also offer a host of softer benefits, including many social events throughout the year such as summer and winter holiday parties, monthly team building events, sports tournaments, charity days and wellbeing activities.

title: SAP Security Analyst
description: Job DescriptionAt Johnson & Johnson, we’re on a mission to change the trajectory of health for humanity. That starts by creating the world’s healthiest workforce. Through cutting-edge programs and policies, we empower the physical, mental, emotional, and financial health of our employees and the ones they love. As such, depending on location and subject to local legislation, candidates offered employment may be required to show proof of COVID-19 vaccination or, in certain countries, secure an approved accommodation prior to the commencement of employment to support the well-being of our employees, their families and the communities in which we live and work. If you are invited to interview for the position, your recruiter will advise on the vaccine requirement status in your geographic location.At Johnson & Johnson, the largest healthcare company in the world, we come together for one purpose: to transform the history of health in humanity.Diversity & Inclusion are essential to continue building our history of pioneering and innovation, which has been impacting the health of more than 1 billion patients and consumers every day for more than 130 years. Regardless of your race, belief, sexual orientation, religion, or any other trait, YOU are welcome in all open positions at the largest healthcare company in the world.When You Join Johnson & Johnson, Your Move Could Mean Our Next Breakthrough.This is a Cross-Sector role. Learn more about our Sectors: Medical Devices At Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices Companies, we are using our breadth, scale, and experience to reimagine the way healthcare is delivered and to help people live longer, healthier lives.In a radically changing environment, we are making connections across science and technology to combine our own expertise in surgery, orthopedics, and interventional solutions with the big ideas of others to design and deliver doctor and patient-centric products and solutions.We are in this for life.We are changing the trajectory of human health, YOU CAN TOO.Please visit https://www.jnjmedicaldevices.com/es-419 for more information. Pharmaceuticals At Janssen, we’re creating a future where disease is a thing of the past. We’re the Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, working tirelessly to make that future a reality for patients everywhere by fighting sickness with science, improving access with ingenuity, and healing hopelessness with heart. We focus on areas of medicine where we can make the biggest difference: Cardiovascular & Metabolism, Immunology, Infectious Diseases & Vaccines, Neuroscience, Oncology, and Pulmonary Hypertension.We are Janssen.Our mission drives us.Our patients inspire us.We collaborate with the world for the health of everyone in it.Please visit https://www.janssen.com/ for more information. Consumer Health Johnson & Johnson announced plans to separate our Consumer Health business to create a new publicly traded company. The process of the planned separation is anticipated to be completed within 24 months, and it will be subject to legal requirements including consultation with works councils and other employee representative bodies, if required, and other customary conditions and approvals. Should you accept this position, it is anticipated that, following conclusion of the transaction, you would be an employee of a new entity within New Consumer Health and your employment would be governed by New Consumer Health’s employment processes, programs, policies, and benefit plans. In that case, details of any planned changes would be provided to you by New Consumer Health at an appropriate time and subject to any necessary consultation processes.Our vision is to be the best-in-class Health & Wellness organization by leveraging the commercial strategy to deliver competitive advantage and value creation for the consumer, customer, and J&J. And as part of one of the largest and most diverse healthcare companies in the world, our brands leverage the company’s world-class research tools and scientific prowess to provide consumers across the globe with innovative consumer medicines, skin, baby, and essential health solutions.You deserve to work in a place where you feel well and welcome.Please visit https://www.jnj.com/healthcare-products/consumer for more information. We are searching for the best talent for ANALISTA FINANCEIRO to be in São Paulo or São José dos Campos – Brazil or Mexico City – Mexico or Bogota - Colombia. PurposeThe Jr Analyst, Finance Technology Solutions (FTS) Latin America will act as a bridge between the business and IT organizations, focusing on business process improvements using the latest technologies in the areas of Financial system design and implementation.LA FTS team is part of the broader Corporate Finance organization focusing on technology and process. The FTS team drives strategic finance transformation while running and improving existing operations.The team focuses on strategic priorities to modernize the finance function and is currently involved in the design and implementation of the latest ERP, data modelling and warehouse, Business Intelligence, planning & consolidation, and other financial systems across the region and globally.You Will Be Responsible ForReporting to the Finance Lead, Finance Technology Solutions LA, the Jr Analyst will serve as a Regional platform Finance Product Owner supporting system enhancements and project implementations through requirements documentation, continuous improvement demand, prioritization, governance process, gap analysis, system tasks, user training and post go-live support.The Jr Analyst will understand complex mappings (G/L Account, Cost center etc.) between the source ECC system, SAP Central Finance system and analytics layer, resolving any issues/errors and data quality problems between the systems integration. These activities will include configuration and check master data mapping inconsistencies etc. and identifying integration points to ensure all other applications, processes, and functional areas impacted are aware of the Central Finance project and potential impacts to their initiative or timelines.This individual will partner with various Finance and IT management to ensure adherence to global system standardization and best practices as well as overall business strategy.The Jr Analyst will support system enhancements and project implementations with documentation, gap analysis, system tasks and mappings, end user training, and coordination between various teams and will provide financial close support.He/she will also collaborate with various functions including Finance, IT, Master Data, Corporate team and Supply Chain to ensure adherence to global system standardization and best practices as well as overall business strategy. He/she will also promote the usage of all implemented tools and proactively identify system solutions to standardize and streamline business processes (ad-hoc reports, automation, etc.), communicating financial business process and system solutions to peers across regions and platforms.Minimum of a bachelor’s degree is required, preferably in Business Administration, Computer Science, Management Information System, Economy, Finance or Accounting.Knowledge and experience with enhancements in Finance and/or Systems support and developing Functional design specifications etc.Knowledge in POWER APPS & TABLEU.Strong analytical, critical thinking, problem solving, and systems skills.Must be able to think creatively, maintain and improve sound business processes while working in a dynamic, team environment.Must be very methodical and accurate, displaying a strong desire for high quality, with attention to detail.Fluency in English.PreferredAccounting/finance background and have a technical mindset, with experience in financial systemsWorking knowledge of reporting and planning tools and applications such as SAP and AlteryxPrior experience in data analysis, complex data mapping, and data reconciliationKnowledge in Spanish is a plus.Primary LocationLatin America-Brazil-São Paulo-São José dos CamposOther LocationsLatin America-Brazil-São Paulo-Buenos Aires - ArgentinaOrganizationJ&J do Brasil Indústria e Comércio de Produtos para Saúde Ltda. title: Business Insights Analyst
description: It started with one ridiculously good idea - Create a different breed of BPO! We at TaskUs understand that achieving growth for our partners requires a culture of constant motion; exploring new technologies, being ready to handle any challenge in a moment's notice, mastering consistency in an ever-changing world - that's what it takes to get there. If that's something you want to be apart of, apply today!Role DescriptionAs a BI Analyst you will play a critical role as a strategic advisor to business functions and leaders across the company. We are looking for someone to provide business leaders with key insights and recommendations and surface both successes and opportunities for improvement. This will require you to use data, create and define metrics, measure performance, develop reports, build models, forecast outcomes, run experiments, and perform deep diagnostic analysis.This role requires both strong technical data skills and business acumen. Ultimate success in this role goes beyond data-related activities and delivers the "so what" that drives decisions and real business impact. You will need to fully understand the business function (processes, objectives, organization, performance drivers, barriers), and have the ability to connect the dots between data analysis, business strategy, and operational effectiveness.You will need to be a critical thinker, problem-solver, and self-starter. Our Business Insights Analysts are driven and proactive, think independently and do not just take orders. There must be an ability to see the bigger picture to make cross-functional connections in both business processes and data. There is an expectation that you not only answer the question that was asked but the question that wasn't. It will be important for you to build positive relationships across the organization and have a "find a way" attitude.ResponsibilitiesAnalyze data, build models, test hypotheses, find root causes, develop prototypes, forecast performance, create Power Bi reports, and write SQL scripts.Extract insights from these data activities to inform business decisions.Use descriptive (what happened) and diagnostic (why did it happen) analytics to develop specific, actionable recommendations for business leaders.Define metrics that are independent, holistic, accurate, encourage the right behaviors, and are aligned with company strategy and objectives.Manage relationships and small projects with cross-functional stakeholders.Map business processes to their corresponding data flows.Proactively identify and surface opportunities to improve efficiency for Operation and Internally as well.Requirements3+ years of experience in data science, data analysis, analytics, business intelligence, or reporting.Extremely proficient in SQL; experience with R, Python is a plus.2+ years' Experience with PowerBI.Experience in doing exploratory data analysis, prototyping, testing hypotheses, performing root cause analyses, modeling business processes, building forecasts, creating predictive models, defining metrics, and/or measuring business performance.Track record of linking data and analytics to business strategy and operations to drive real impact.Working knowledge of probability and statistics.Experience with process improvement is a plus.Team player who builds strong relationships and establishes trust with business leaders, Engineers, and colleagues.Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to explain complex issues in a simple and intuitive way.Strong professional skepticism, including the ability to challenge assumptions, communicate limitations, and flag blind spots.Work collaboratively and independently; take ownership of quality, accuracy, and timeliness of deliverables.If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!TaskUs is an Equal Opportunity Employer
job_function: Investigación, Analista y Tecnología de la información

title: Data Tech Lead
description: About PayUPayU, a leading payment and Fintech company in 50+ high-growth markets throughout Asia, Central and Eastern Europe, Latin America, the Middle East and Africa, part of Prosus group, one of the largest technology investors in the world is redefining the way people buy and sell online for our 300.000+ merchants and millions of consumers.As a leading online payment service provider, we deploy more than 400 payment methods and PCI-certified platforms to process approximately 6 million payments every single day.Thinking of becoming a PayUneer and you are curious to know more about us? Read more about the life in PayU hereAbout The RoleBe part of a new Global Data Engineering team that provides Data as a Service for both internal purposes and to our customers. You will be involved in designing the architecture of new data systems and responsible for building scalable, robust, and high-quality infrastructure to support our global cloud-native data platform.Our stack includes Snowflake, Airflow, Kubernetes, Kafka, GitLab/Bitbucket, AWS, Python. We are looking for an engineer who is passionate about data and excited to learn and apply new technologies.What you’ll be doing:Designing architecture and suggesting new technologies and tools.Designing, developing, testing, deploying, and monitoring in-house services and tools to support our global data infrastructure.Working closely with engineering teams, data scientists, and product managers to support features on top of the data.Performing code reviews and prioritizing the requirements for the team; understanding the business needs.Evaluating and deploying new technologies to expand our data tech-stack and support our products requirementsMaintaining and working on sunsetting legacy systemsWhat are we looking for?We are looking for proactive individual contributorWe are looking for problem identifier/solverWe are looking for a contributor that can manage and plan according to priorities of the teamWhat you’ll need to succeed:Proven experience of more than 2 years in one of the following programming languagesJava, Nodejs or Python.At least 2 years of hands-on experience deploying production-quality code and using CI/CD tools.Strong knowledge with Big data tools and streaming technologies: Airflow, Kafka, or similar.Experience with AWS services such as EC2, EMR, RDS, Redshift or other cloud technology.Experience with distributed systems and microservices architecture.At least 2 years of experience with Relational SQL or NoSQL databasesAt least 2 years of proven experience working on architecture, business logic processes, data warehouse modeling, and insight delivery.Proven experience with data lake solutions.In a nutshell, passion for programming and not just for a programming languageHigh level proficiency in EnglishVery nice to have:A profound understanding of CI/CD pipelines.BS or MS in Computer Science, Engineering or related technical discipline or equivalent experience.Proven experience with Kubernetes and Docker.Proven experience with Data Streaming and Change data capture technologiesAbout us:At PayU, we are a global fintech investor and our vision is to build a world without financial borders where everyone can prosper. We give people in high-growth markets the financial services and products they need to thrive. Our expertise in 18 high-growth markets enables us to extend the reach of financial services. This drives everything we do, from investing in technology entrepreneurs, to offering credit to underserved individuals, to helping merchants buy, sell and operate online. Being part of Prosus, one of the largest technology investors in the world, gives us the presence and expertise to make a real impact. Find out more www.payu.comOur Commitment To Building A Diverse And Inclusive WorkforceAs a global and multi-cultural organization with varied ethnicities thriving across locations, we realize that our responsibility towards fulfilling the D&I commitment is huge. Therefore, we continuously strive to create a diverse, inclusive and safe environment, for all of our people, communities and customers. Our leaders are committed to create an inclusive work culture which enables transparency, flexibility and unbiased attention to each and every PayUneer so they can succeed, irrespective of gender, color or personal faith. An environment where every person feels they belong, that they are listened to, and where they are empowered to speak up. At PayU we have zero tolerance towards any form of prejudice whether a specific race, ethnicity, or of persons with disabilities or the LGBTQ communities.

title: Quality Compliance Analyst - Bogotá, Colombia; Medellín, Antioquia, Colombia; Cali, Valle del Cauca, Colombia
description: RolQuality Compliance AnalystPropositoAnalizar y evaluar riesgos de ciberseguridad y dar recomendaciones que permitan mitigar los mismos para contribuir al aseguramiento de los servicios.RequisitosProfesional en Ingeniería de Sistemas, Electrónica, Telemática o carreras afines.Especialista en seguridad de la información o ciberseguridad.Mínimo dos (2) años de experiencia trabajando en Centro de Operaciones de Seguridad (SOC), analizando riesgos de ciberseguridad y emitiendo recomendaciones.Con conocimientos en marcos de referencia en Ciberseguridad y gestión de incidentes como: NIST cybersecurity framework, ISO 27032, ISO 27035.Con conocimientos en soluciones de seguridad como: Logrhythm, Tipping Point, Deep Security,Desebale certificación vigente como auditor interno ISO 27001:2013 y CEH.Número de Vacantes: 1Condiciones LaboralesLugar de Trabajo: Bogotá, Cali y Medellín.Tipo de Contrato: A Termino Indefinido.Salario: A convenir de acuerdo a la experiencia.Horario: Lunes a Viernes de 8:00 a.m - 6:00 p.m.Teletrabajo autonomo.Esta vacante es divulgada a través de ticjob.co

Tienen en este momento sedes en Chile, China, USA y Rumania.Job DescriptionLa posición de Data Engineer deberá:Crear, implementar y mantener soluciones de pipelines ETL/ELT, Data Warehouse o Data Lake;Colaborar en equipos multidisciplinarios para implementar soluciones de ingeniería de datos;Garantizar la integridad de los datos a través de una atención rigurosa a los detalles y la validación, incluida la adherencia a todos los procedimientos normativos de cumplimiento de la privacidad y seguridad de los procesos;Interactuar con los Stakeholders para comprender los requisitos e implementar soluciones con los mejores herramientas.The Successful ApplicantEl perfil deberá cumplir con los siguientes requisitos:Tener un nivel intermedio o avanzado de inglés;Contar con 3 o más años de experiencia trabajando como Data Engineer, en ambientes On-premise o Cloud;Deseable experiencia con Data Management, Data Analysis o Data Science;Tener experiencia en la construcción y mantenimiento de pipelines ETL/ELT, Data Warehouse o Lata Lake;Haber trabajado con lenguajes como Python, Scala, SQL;Experiencia con Azure, AWS O GCP.What's on OfferLa oportunidad de hacer parte de una empresa global y trabajar con las mejores tecnologías a nivel mundial.Contact: Tomas CastroQuote job ref: JN-082022-5732256

title: Big Data Engineer
description: DescriptionEsta es tu oportunidad para unirte a un equipo diverso de personas apasionadas por el Big Data.En buenas manos ¡las tuyas! las enormes cantidades de información que las empresas recopilan hoy pueden convertirse en un activo muy valioso manejadas estratégicamente. Ayudamos a nuestros clientes a ser más eficientes haciendo el mejor uso posible de los datos, aprovechados por los expertos para impulsar un nuevo motor de crecimiento de servicios de información.Si te gusta aprender y disfrutas de una gran pasión por trabajar con nuevas tecnologías además de ayudar a los clientes a administrar los datos de manera efectiva para generar conocimiento y valor, este es tu sitio. Estamos buscando desarrolladores en Accenture, el lugar perfecto para continuar construyendo tu carrera. Nuestro equipo está creciendo por lo que siempre estamos atentos a nuevo talento como el tuyo. Las oportunidades dentro de las emocionantes iniciativas en el entorno digital que llevamos a cabo con nuestros clientes son ilimitadas, por tanto no te faltarán inspiración o desafíos.Algunas de tus responsabilidades: Desarrollo de software usando tecnologías Big Data Formar parte de equipos multidisciplinaresParticipación en proyectos para grandes clientes¿Te unes al Big Data | Accenture Technology team? ¡Aplica online!#BigDataNinjaQualificationsRequisitos: Titulación técnica: Informática u otras con experiencia equivalente (Telecomunicaciones, Matemáticas, Física, otras ingenierías, etc.) +2 años de experiencia real en producción con tecnologías Big Data (Spark, Hive, Kafka, Flink, etc.) Alguna/varias bases de datos NoSQL (MongoDB, HBase, ElasticSearch, Cassandra, etc.) Herramientas Agile (Jira, Jenkins, Bamboo, Git, Sonar, etc.)Valorable: Experiencia en AWS o Azure Certificaciones en AWS, Azure o Big Data (Cloudera, Databricks, MongoDB, Kafka, etc.) Experiencia en proyectos para grandes clientesAccenture ofrece igualdad de oportunidades y acepta solicitudes de todos los sectores de la sociedad y no discrimina por motivos de raza, religión o creencias, origen étnico o nacional, discapacidad, edad, ciudadanía, estado civil, orientación sexual o Identidad de género, o cualquier otra base según lo protegido por la ley vigente.

title: Second Line Support Analyst - US Sports
description: A Bit About UsGenius Sports is the official data, technology and commercial partner that powers the global ecosystem connecting sports, betting and media.Our mission is to champion a more sustainable sports data ecosystem that benefits all parties - from the rights holder all the way through to the fan.We are the trusted partner to over 500 sports organizations globally, capturing the highest quality data for many of the world’s largest leagues and federations such as the NFL, NBA, MLB, English Premier League, Serie A, FIBA and the NCAA.From enabling leagues to take control of their official data, to creating immersive fan experiences for sports, betting and media organizations, we are driven to the deliver the difference for our partners.What We DoSportstech Data capture, management and analysis tools that help leagues run their sport, unlock new revenue streams, and protect the integrity of their competitions.Video Fully automated streaming technology, production and distribution services that help showcase sports to the world.Sportsbook Everything a sportsbook operator needs to manager their operation and grow profits – all powered by the finest live sports data available.Media & Engagement We help brands and publishers engage and monetize sports fans with personalized campaigns and content they will love.The RoleAs a Second Line Support Analyst you will be part of a technical team helping support end users, data partners, and First Line Support team members with inquiries of various levels of difficulty for systems used by some of the most prominent sports leagues in the United States. Provide advanced technical assistance and training for software, hardware, API data feed usage. Critical thinking, advanced troubleshooting skills, and a superior customer service approach will be crucial to the team’s success.Main ResponsibilitiesProvide support to internal or external end users and data partners for inquires where the product is highly technical or sophisticated in natureReview data feed integration inquires using all internal tools available and working closely with all relevant teams until a resolution is reachedRespond to questions and issues where First Line product support has not isolated a fix for users or data partnersProvide technical training to First Line team to improve software or hardware troubleshooting techniquesEnsure all inquiries are logged in the applicable ticket system and properly summarized with issue and resolution stepsAdhere to technical metrics and relevant SLA’sEscalate issues as appropriate and work with the development team to address issues within the relevant SLA’sCreate, implement, and maintain process and knowledge management documents across relevant systemsWork with data partners to guide and ensure optimal connectivity to our data feedsCollaborate with all internal stakeholders on new feature requests or bug fixes including identifying requirements and pre/post deployment testingProvide onsite assistance for special events as required or neededAdhere to technical metrics ensuring that SLA’s are metRequirementsPrevious first or second line helpdesk experience troubleshooting software, hardware, network, or API issuesExceptional understanding of Windows OS, LAN/WAN connectivity, applications, hardwareWorking knowledge of all US sports including but not limited to Football, Basketball, Ice Hockey, Soccer, Volleyball, and BaseballAdvanced troubleshooting and critical thinking skills to identify root cause, workarounds when applicable, and proper resolutionFlexibility to work in shifts covering daytime, evenings, weekend, and holiday hours as neededEnergetic, supportive, and collaborative team-orientedStrong client-facing and communication skills (both written and verbal) in EnglishBasic System monitoring experienceHigh level of time management skills, organizing capabilities, and attention to detailWorking knowledge of API’sBasic understanding of scripting (Powershell especially a +)Desirable SkillsExperience with Graphite and Graylog monitoring tools Experience with ServiceNow or Freshdesk Exposure to Atlassian tools Understanding of data structure, functionality, design Required ExperienceA high school diploma with technical training 2+ years of prior Technical Support experience Desired ExperienceBS degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or equivalentWe OfferAs well as a competitive salary and annual leave allowance, our benefits include health insurance, skills training and much more, depending on location. We also offer a host of softer benefits, including many social events throughout the year such as summer and winter holiday parties, monthly team building events, sports tournaments, charity days and wellbeing activities.Genius Sports Group is proud to be an equal opportunities employer. We recognize and celebrate the benefits that a diverse and inclusive workforce bring to our business, our customers and our staff. We welcome and will consider all applications regardless of age, disability, gender re-assignment, marriage, pregnancy, maternity, race or nationality, religion or belief, sex and sexual orientation (and any other status protected by applicable law)

title: Data Engineer
description: Descripción de la empresaEn Experian Spanish Latam creamos oportunidades para crear un mejor mañana y estamos comprometidos con la innovación y el uso de las últimas tecnologías. Somos la compañía de servicios de información global, líder en el mundo, en donde ayudamos a las personas a tomar el control financiero y a acceder a los servicios financieros, a las empresas a tomar decisiones más inteligentes.Descripción del empleoEl objetivo general del área de DA Platform es: Cubrir las necesidades relacionadas con datos a las áreas analíticas, el suministro de herramientas adecuadas para el consumo y explotación de los mismos, así como la puesta en marcha de soluciones de forma innovadora, propendiendo por la automatización y el autoservicio, la integración de plataformas, la aplicación de tecnologías como Cloud Computing y Big Data y el desarrollo de un equipo con alto conocimiento en el negocio y que busca maximizar el valor del dato y sus plataformas.La principal responsabilidad es el control sobre diseño, desarrollo y mantenimiento de los sistemas de procesamiento de datos y el flujo de los datos para el DA HUB de SPLatam. Asimismo, deberá impulsar mejoras continuas en el área y garantizar su implementaciónPrincipales Entregables Flujos de datos implementados y automatizados Datos crudos y procesados (ej. atributos) disponibles en las plataformas analíticas Delivery y disponibilidad de las plataformas analíticasResponsabilidades Del Cargo Gestionar todos los aspectos relativos a la ingesta, procesamiento y acceso a los datos y la información (estructurada o no). Generar valor al dato a partir de la generación de atributos y transformaciones significativas para el negocio. Gestionar la calidad del dato, generando mecanismos de control. Implementar plataformas y/o procesos analíticos según sea la necesidad. Apoyar el proceso de implementación en la plataforma de Continuous Integration (CI) y Continuous Deployment (CD).RequisitosEducacion: Ingeniero de Sistemas, electrónico y afinesExperiencia Se requiere al menos 2 años de experiencia en plataformas Cloud. Se requiere al menos 3 años de experiencia desarrollando en Python y Java Se requiere al menos 3 años de experiencia en procesamiento con SPARK Al menos 1 año en cargos relacionadosConocimientos Técnicos Requeridos Plataformas Cloud: AWS, Azure y servicios serverless como S3, lambda, Glue, ect. Lenguajes: Python y Java. Deseable si también conoce Scala y R. Experiencia en procesamiento distribuido: Spark Teoría de bases de datos relacionales y no relacionales y lenguaje SQL. Sistemas Operativos basados en LINUX Conocimientos en el framework Hadoop. Manejo de ETLs Manejo de herramientas de BI como Tableau Conocimiento en herramientas GIT Analytics: conocimiento básico en Machine Learning y Advanced Analytics Fundamento de seguridad informática Deseable que conozca DatabricksIdiomas: Inglés intermedioCompetencias Fuertes habilidades de desarrollo/automatización.Actitud de resolución de problemas Excelentes capacidades de relación y trabajo en equipo. Capacidad de aprovechar las oportunidades para aprender nuevas habilidades y desarrollar fortalezas Auto motivado, orientado a los detalles y organizado con excelentes habilidades de comunicación. Capacidad para realizar múltiples tareas y soportar múltiples proyectos y plazos en un entorno dinámico y de ritmo rápidoInformación adicional Es un abanderado en el proceso de la transformación digital de la compañía en particular en el uso y aplicabilidad de tecnologías como Cloud Computing o Big Data, lo cual le genera un status quo a la compañía. Genera eficiencias y ahorros a otras áreas a partir del diseño e implementación de soluciones como la automatización de procesos. Apoya la maximización del valor de los datos, así como el cuidado y la calidad de los mismos. Apoya la generación de ingresos ya sea de Analytics o a través de productos del buró que consume soluciones generadas por el área como es el caso del desarrollo de Atributos.
job_function: Tecnología de la información y Ingeniería

title: Business System Analyst (BSA)
description: ¡En MetLife buscamos personas talentosas como tú! Ambiciosas, con sueños, ganas de crecer profesionalmente y asumir grandes retos!Si te apasiona el análisis, diseño y la ejecución de pruebas en un equipo de desarrollo de software/aplicaciones en un entorno ágil, este es el lugar donde puedes cambiar el rumbo de tu vida y llegar tan alto como quieras. ¿Qué retos te proponemos? Serás responsable de brindar soporte al Product Owner y al Scrum Master en la definición y características del producto y criterios de aceptación para que el equipo de desarrollo del producto pueda revisar, comprometerse y ejecutar dentro de un período de tiempo definido. Para esto tus principales desafíos serán: · Apoyar la creación, el refinamiento y la gestión de los requisitos o historias de usuario para agilizar la ejecución de las prioridades del programa, mientras se mantiene la integridad conceptual y técnica de las características o componentes para el equipo.· Garantizar que el equipo de desarrollo de productos comprenda la intención y los requisitos de las funciones y las definiciones de historias de usuario, y que esl equipo esté alineado con todos los criterios de aceptación o la definición de completado por requisito, función o historia de usuario.¿Qué debes tener para empezar este reto? · Ser Ingeniero de Sistemas graduado o a punto de obtener el título con Certificación en Requerimientos.· Al menos dos años de experiencia como analista de desarrollo de software y tres como analista en requerimientos de software.· Nivel de inglés B2 o superior.¿Qué te ofrecemos? Valoramos y exaltamos el éxito de nuestros colaboradores, es por eso que nos esforzaremos en motivarte y en brindarte incentivos valiosos para ti y tu familia. Con nosotros tendrás: · Contrato directo con MetLife.· Salario a convenir.· Crecimiento profesional y oportunidades de carrera.· Beneficios económicos y emocionales.· Excelente ambiente laboral. Esta vacante solo aplica para la ciudad de Bogotá MetLife, always with you, building a more confident future.

Invítalos a ser parte de nuevos y desafiantes proyectos que abarcan múltiples geografías favoreciendo su desarrollo profesional.Requerimientos:Actualmente en NEORIS estamos buscando Data Engineer Cloud - AWS . Persona dinámica (o), con deseos de aprendizaje de nuevas tecnologías, proactiva (o) y con orientación al logro.Ingenieros de Datos senior con experiencia en AWS en las siguientes tecnologias: AWS (Glue, Athenea, Redshift), Airflow, Python, SQL avanzado. Hemos completado más de 1200 proyectos de gran escala y nos enorgullecemos de trabajar para más de 350 clientes en todo el mundo. Proveemos un servicio de alta calidad con nuestras 27 oficinas, Delivery Centers y Laboratorios de Innovación, donde trabajan algunas de las mejores mentes de la industria para generar el futuro de los negocios.Ofrecemos: Crecimiento Profesional  Ambiente laboral dinámimico  Atractivo plan de beneficios  Prestaciones de ley  Oportunidades de desarrollo Te invitamos a conocernos en http://www.neoris.com , Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter o Instagram: @NEORIS. FREDY ALEXANDER ARIAS VIVAS

title: Data Analyst
description: Autoliv’s global Business Intelligence, Data Analytics team and Integration team is looking for a Data Modeler to help grow our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for conducting full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities, and design. This position will also develop analysis and reporting requirements and capabilities. They will work directly with business stakeholders to translate business requirements into data models that can be delivered to a development team for creation.What you’ll do:Create and maintain data mapping documentation for Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW)Create and maintain entity relationship diagrams to visualize the business relationships within the data (the model).Create and maintain conceptual-level data dictionary information.Work closely with the Autoliv business partners who use PowerBI and other tools to analyze data coming from the EDW Marts.Create and maintain Business Information Models (BIM’s)Gather Data Dictionaries and Metadata from Source System and Business partners.What is required:•A Bachelor's Degree in Computer Sciences, Mathematics, Information Systems or equivalent.•Fluent conversational English.•Working knowledge of Data as it is used for Analytical purposes•Basic SQL Skills is neededWhat’s in it for you:•Attractive compensation package•Recognition awards, company events, family events, university discount options and many more perks.•Gender Pay EqualityAutoliv is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Autoliv does not discriminate in any aspect of employment based on race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, gender, sexual orientation, gender identify and/or expression, age, disability, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local employment discrimination laws where Autoliv does business.

title: Data Analyst
description: Company DescriptionWood Mackenzie is the global leader in data, analysis and consulting across the energy, chemicals, metals, mining, power and renewables sectors.Founded in 1973, our success has always been underpinned by the simple principle of providing trusted research and advice that makes a difference to our customers. Today we have over 2,000 customers ranging from the largest global energy companies and financial institutions to governments as well as smaller market specialists.Our teams are located around the world. This enables us to stay closely connected with customers and the markets and sectors we cover. Collectively this allows us to offer a compelling combination of global commodity analysis with detailed local market knowledge.We are committed to supporting our people to grow and thrive. We value different perspectives and aspire to create an inclusive environment that encourages diversity and fosters a sense of belonging. We are committed to creating a workplace that works for you and encourage everyone to get involved in our Wellness, Diversity and Inclusion, and Community Engagement initiatives. We actively support flexible working and are happy to consider alternative work patterns, taking into account your needs and the needs of the team or division that you are looking to join.Hear what our team has to say about working with us:https://www.woodmac.com/careers/our-people/We are proud to be a part of the Verisk family of companies!At the heart of what we do is help clients manage risk. Verisk (Nasdaq: VRSK) provides data and insights to our customers in insurance, energy and the financial services markets so they can make faster and more informed decisions.Our global team uses AI, machine learning, automation, and other emerging technologies to collect and analyze billions of records. We provide advanced decision-support to prevent credit, lending, and cyber risks. In addition, we monitor and advise companies on complex global matters such as climate change, catastrophes, and geopolitical issues.But why we do our work is what sets us apart. It stems from a commitment to making the world better, safer and stronger.It’s the reason Verisk is part of the UN Global Compact sustainability initiative. It’s why we made a commitment to balancing 100 percent of our carbon emissions. It’s the aim of our “returnship” program for experienced professionals rejoining the workforce after time away. And, it’s what drives our annual Innovation Day, where we identify our next first-to-market innovations to solve our customers’ problems.At its core, Verisk uses data to minimize risk and maximize value. But far bigger, is why we do what we do.At Verisk you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create positive and lasting impact on business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. We have received the Great Place to Work® Certification for the fifth consecutive year. We’ve been recognized by Forbes as a World’s Best Employer and a Best Employer for Women, testaments to our culture of engagement and the value we place on an inclusive and diverse workforce. Verisk’s Statement on Racial Equity and Diversity supports our commitment to these values and affecting positive and lasting change in the communities where we live and work.Job DescriptionYour focus will be on delivering value to our clients by enhancing the quality and coverage of our upstream datasets. You’ll be called on to implement processes that monitor data quality, and devise means to resolve identified issues. A background in well data will stand you in good stead for this. Strong technical skills will be required to support this work, as you’ll be one of the architects for production processes that directly impact our users.You’ll have opportunities to grow. As Wood Mackenzie cements its transition to the latest technologies, we will expand our dataset coverage and enhance our analytics. You will be called upon to support their development.You’ll need to be flexible and able to manage your time and workload, since priorities can change at short notice as business needs arise.The level of appointment regarding which band on the company banding structure will be dependent on your skills, experience and capabilities demonstrated at assessment prior to offer of employment.Additional InformationVerisk Analytics has an amazing story to tell. In 2017, Forbes magazine named Verisk to its World’s Most Innovative Companies list for the third consecutive year and to its America’s Best Mid-Size Employers list. We also earned the Great Place to Work® Certification for the second consecutive year in recognition of our outstanding workplace culture.Verisk is a leading data analytics provider serving customers in insurance, natural resources, and financial services. We’ve been delivering data, analytics, and decision support services to our customers for more than 45 years, helping them protect people, property, and financial assets. At Verisk, you’ll be part of an organization that’s committed to serving the long-term interests of our stakeholders, including the communities where we operate.At Verisk, you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create a positive and lasting impact on the business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. Our culture of innovation means your ideas on how to improve our business will be heard. As key contributors to our success, our team members enjoy working in a business-casual, collaborative environment that offers state-of-the-art resources, advanced technologies, and an excellent benefits package.Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer.All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability.http://www.verisk.com/careers.htmlUnsolicited resumes sent to Verisk, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Verisk business mailing address, fax machine or email address, or directly to Verisk employees, will be considered Verisk property. Verisk will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume.

title: AML Data Analyst
description: About NubankTackling the complex banking system to empower people in one of the world's most bureaucratic markets seems like a crazy idea, right? But that's why, how, and where Nubank was born. We fight complexity through our transparent and straightforward products and experiences: a no-fee credit card, a rewards program, a lending platform, and a digital savings account. In a nutshell, we are the most innovative tech company in Latin America, and we are obsessed with building financial services and products that make our customers love us fanatically. With over 34 million customers and $1.2 billion raised in investment rounds, we are the fastest growing digital bank in the world, with offices in Brazil, Germany, Mexico, Colombia and Argentina. And it's still only Day One for us!Our AML Data Analytics at NubankWe work to be at the forefront of (anti-money laundering) AML/CTF (counter-terrorism financing) in the world by leveraging Nubank resources to be recognized by stakeholders and avoided by criminals, without jeopardizing the experience of our real and fanatical customers’ experience.As a AML Data Analyst, You'll Be Expected ToSupport enhancing, monitoring, and maintaining an expert rules system for anti-money laundering alerts to reduce the alert volumes to be sent over and prioritize cases for AML operations analysts.Acquire AML and data analysis proficient knowledge to identify challenges and opportunities in the AML program and leverage analytics and automation tools to address them. Create risk models, hypothesis testing, and alerts forecasting to enable the company to be protected and compliant while making pro-business and customer-centric decisions. Apply machine learning/AI for data modeling. Emulate scenarios that help identify money laundering activity.Develop segmentation model building projects using machine learning and statistical analysis techniques.Produce and maintain proper documentation of models and tools deployed.Collaborate with the design and establishment of processes for agile execution of threshold tuning projects per approved methodology that allow for proper performance while maintaining documentation necessary for compliance testing, internal audit, and regulators validation.Partner with our engineers, data scientists, designers, and business partners to coordinate and prioritize tasks involving your analysis and developments. Prepare data storytelling and visualization using key performance metrics for senior management and business partners for presentation, forecasting, and further analysis.Work as part of a team of data analysts supporting automation tools development for Anti-Money Laundering (AML) Processes and Data Integrity projects, including requesting, profiling, extracting, analyzing, testing, and reviewing data.Review data quality to ensure reports and analyses are meaningful and accurate. Work with Business Analysts to complete data mapping within project deliverable timelines. Work with Analytics Engineers collaborating with specification, design, and implementation data architecture solutions for AML systems. We are looking for an AML Data Analyst professional who has:Ability to tackle complex problems involving a number of topics/variables, such as business, regulatory, operations and product features. Great business judgment and ability (and interest) to make, both, strategic and operational decisions. Solid analytical background. Must be comfortable manipulating big and small datasets to make decisions (SQL knowledge is required).Experience in project management and business analysis to translate detailed specifications into new or enhanced solutions. Familiarity with ETL is a plusExperience with business intelligence tools, like: Looker or Data Studio, and data visualization best practices.Familiarity with data modeling using statistical algorithms.Programming data analysis skills (Python, R …) is a plus. AI/ Machine learning knowledge is a plus. Previous experience with AML, Fraud or Risk Management is a plus. Full professional proficiency in English. BenefitsHealth and life insuranceFood card15 days of paid vacation with 25% vacation bonusHoliday Bonus ("Aguinaldo") of 30 days of pay per yearNuLanguage - Our language learning programExtended maternity and paternity leavesChance of earning equity at Nubank Interviewing and onboarding are currently done virtually due to COVID-19. Everyone new to the team and our current staff will remain working from home until it is safe to return to our offices. When it’s time, we will require a fixed cadence of visiting the office in which employees go to their Business Unit's (BU) base location. Employees will have an employment contract based on the cities that Nu’s offices are located, considering their country of hire. More details can be shared during your hiring process.

description: Frubana está revolucionando a cadeia de distribuição de alimentos e abastecimento de restaurantes na América Latina! 🚀Nossa missão é baratear a comida, garantindo uma alimentação mais acessível a todos. 🍍🍉🍊🥑Trabalhamos para oferecer aos donos de restaurante a experiência de realizar todas as suas compras através de nosso e-commerce, com preços competitivos e entrega ágil. 🚛Com isso, conseguimos reduzir de 30% para 2% o desperdício na cadeia produtiva.Tecnologia e Diversidade são alguns dos nossos pilares e fomos considerados a segunda empresa mais inovadora da América Latina em 2021! ✨Saiba mais também sobre nossas últimas rodadas de captação, onde nomes como GGV, SoftBank, DST Global, Monashees e Tiger aportaram mais de R$ 1 Bilhão em nosso negócio em 3 anos. 📈Frubiteam:Formarás parte del equipo de Marketplace que esta introduciendo y desarrollando nuevas categorías para ser la opción favorita de nuestros clientes. Estamos buscando personas analíticas que tengan experiencia apoyando a el equipo comercial en la mejora continúa de sus procesosLo que harás:Evaluación de nuevas oportunidades de negocio;Mejora continua de procesos;Desarrollarás las herramientas de visualización necesarias para el equipoInterlocución entre el área de Marketplace y otros stakeholders internos; Aterrizaje de ideas del equipo, organización visual de datos para posibles proyectosLo que necesitas:Pregrado en Ingeniería Industrial, Economía;Excelentes habilidades en Excel;SQL intermedio;Pensamiento crítico y analítico;Habilidades excepcionales de comunicación y negociación;Self learner y muchas ganas de aportar al equipo;Inglés será considerado un plusSe usted es:Una persona de numeros;Ownership;Tiene disposición para aprender;Te invitamos a navegar en:Nuestra plataforma: https://www.frubana.com/Nuestro Career Site: https://jobs.frubana.com/Conoce algunas noticias sobre Frubana:https://forbes.co/2021/06/01/actualidad/frubana-levanta-us65-millones-tras-triplicar-sus-ventas-abasteciendo-restaurantes/https://www.forbes.com/sites/rebeccaszkutak/2021/06/01/restaurant-tech-startup-frubana-was-able-to-triple-its-sales-during-the-pandemic/https://www.portafolio.co/negocios/emprendimiento/frubana-el-emprendimiento-quiere-expandir-su-negocio-a-america-latina-552736https://www.fastcompany.com/90600367/latin-america-most-innovative-companies-2021https://news.crunchbase.com/news/pivots-and-persistence-how-startups-in-latin-america-are-finding-ways-to-survive-the-current-crisis/https://forbes.co/2020/04/17/emprendedores/frubana-recauda-us25-millones-para-su-plataforma-agro/
