title: Data Analyst
description: ¡Forma parte del equipo de Apple Leisure Group (ALG) y convierte los sueños de vacaciones en recuerdos para toda la vida! En Apple Leisure Group nos esforzamos por ser la primera opción en viajes de vacaciones, enriqueciendo vidas y uniendo al mundo.Considera tu siguiente paso de carrera como Data Analyst para AMSTAR, una de las 14 marcas líderes de mercado de Apple Leisure Group. En este rol te ocuparas del análisis de la información, creación de indicadores y manipulación de bases de datos; particularmente de catálogos de personal, archivos de vacaciones, costos de personal incluido budget y forecast, entre otros. De igual manera, estará encargado de la transformación de dicha información para convertirlo en reportes de lectura (dashboards) de acuerdo a las necesidades del negocio.Un Data Analyst exitoso será responsable de: Recopilar métricas y datos de personal de una variedad de fuentes, encuestas de salida, registros de empleo, estadísticas laborales, costos de personal, entre otros Crear presentaciones sobre temas relacionados al análisis de la información de las bases de datos de recursos humanos en diferentes Unidades de NegocioAnalizar e identificar errores, así como brindar soluciones y presentar informes a nivel ejecutivoIdentificar y recomendar objetivos razonables a corto y largo plazo, y puntos de referencia para métricas clave del área de Recursos Humanos.Un Data Analyst exitoso tendrá:Licenciatura en Ingeniería en Sistemas, Administración de Negocios Experiencia en el desarrollo de informes a nivel ejecutivo y capacidades analíticas. Experiencia en la creación e implementación de informes, hojas de trabajo, dashboards.  Experiencia en puestos afines al análisis de datos (1 a 2 años)Certificacion en Recursos HumanosManejo de MS Office/Excel avanzadoExcelentes comunicación verbal y escrita tanto en español como en inglés. Capacidad analítica y deductiva para sustraer información y transformarla adecuadamente a las necesidades del negocio (diferentes Unidades de Negocio). Experiencia en Nóminas, Recursos Humanos. Realización de reportes ejecutivos. Apple Leisure Group ® (ALG) es un grupo líder en administración de marcas de resorts, viajes y hotelería en América del Norte con un modelo comercial único que brinda servicios a viajeros y destinos en todo el mundo. ALG, a través de su grupo de empresas afiliadas, brinda constantemente un valor excepcional a los viajeros y un sólido desempeño a los propietarios y socios de resorts mediante el aprovechamiento estratégico de su cartera de marcas, que comprenden:Vacations: El vendedor más grande de paquetes de vacaciones y vuelos chárter en E.U.A. para viajar a México y el Caribe, transladando aproximadamente 3.2 millones de pasajeros anualmente a través de marcas de vacaciones bien establecidas.AMResort: Resort Brand Management: administración de resorts de lujo de 5 y 4 estrellas a través de la cartera de marcas galardonadas de AMResorts®AMSTAR: Servicios de gestión de destinos: los mejores servicios de gestión de destinos en su clase proporcionados por Amstar® DMC y Worldstar®UVC: Programa de Lealtad: Exclusivo programa de lealtad Unlimited Vacation Club®Trisept Solutions: Soluciones tecnológicas: proveedor de soluciones tecnológicas innovadoras Trisept Solutions®, que conecta a más de 88,000 agentes de viajes con proveedores de viajes líderes.Para conocer más sobre Apple Leisure Group, visita appleleisuregroup.com.Nuestros ValoresEn ALG, llamamos a nuestros colaboradores Colleagues, ya que somos más que solo empleados. Estamos unidos como un equipo que trabaja hacia una misión y visión común. Estamos comprometidos a vivir los valores organizacionales bajo los cuales operamos:Somos empáticos * Somos auténticos * Somos proactivos * Actuamos juntos * Nos importan los resultados * Tenemos sed de más * Hacemos todo con pasión

title: Data Analyst, Quality Assurance
description: About The TeamAs a leader of the Quality Assurance Team, you’ll influence and impact not only agents and auditors but stakeholders throughout the Support Organization. We are passionate about Customer Love and know what stellar, efficient customer service looks like. We are champions of scalable, repeatable processes that protect and enhance the Customer Experience. You will work to identify trends actively, develop and implement quality process improvements, as well as add your voice to our cross-functional partnerships.About The RoleThe Quality Assurance Data Analyst reports to the Quality Assurance Manager and supports the Quality Assurance, Sr. Data Analyst with all aspects of the operation. You will act as system administrator for the QMS software for effective execution of audits, ensure data reports are pulled and provided, dashboards are updated for key leadership insights and decision making, support the Sr. Data Analyst with adhoc data requests, and support the execution of calibration exercises within our teams both internal and external.You’re Excited About This Opportunity Because You Will…Directly support our auditors by maintaining QMS software, rubrics, automations, and calibration exercises.You will partner with the Sr. Data Analyst, Sr. Associates, and Quality leadership to directly support data and tracking efforts for the Quality Assurance TeamYou will provide timely and accurate reports, data metrics, data input on a regular basis to support an operation of 20,000 global teammates and audits performed on the Customer Experience. We’re Excited About You Because…Minimum 1 years in a contact center environmentMinimum 1 year working with data reporting, metrics reporting, or analysis Preferred 1 year of experience as a quality auditorExceptional verbal and written skillsExcellent attention to detailExperience working in a high paced environmentExcellent Problem Solving, Leadership, and Customer Service skillsProficient with technology, especially computers, software applications, and phone systemsExperience working with: SalesForce, MaestroQA, TableauProficient in Excel or google sheets with ability to do basic and intermediate formulasExperience working with cross-cultural teamsAbout DoorDashAt DoorDash, our mission to empower local economies shapes how our team members move quickly, learn, and reiterate in order to make impactful decisions that display empathy for our range of users—from Dashers to merchant partners to consumers. We are a technology and logistics company that started with door-to-door delivery, and we are looking for team members who can help us go from a company that is known for delivering food to a company that people turn to for any and all goods.DoorDash is growing rapidly and changing constantly, which gives our team members the opportunity to share their unique perspectives, solve new challenges, and own their careers. We're committed to supporting employees’ happiness, healthiness, and overall well-being by providing comprehensive benefits and perks.Our Commitment to Diversity and InclusionWe’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.If you need any accommodations, please inform your recruiting contact upon initial connection.

title: Marketing Data Analyst
description: Company OveriewFounded in 2004, MSIGHTS (msights.com) provides cloud-based marketing data integration services to some of the world’s most sophisticated global advertisers. As marketing channels proliferate, so do the data sources marketers must examine in order to quantify results and guide strategy. MSIGHTS services make marketers more efficient and successful by providing a single view of overall marketing performance with actionable insights on what works and what doesn’t. The MSIGHTS Platform automatically collects and reconciles disparate data, making it immediately available to fuel a wide variety of analytical and visualization tools.Job DescriptionThe Business Analyst resource is responsible for maintaining and aiding operation processes. He/she also aids in development of new products and features. The ideal candidate will be a general problem solver who is excited about investigations, can multi–task and possesses the flexibility to work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment with rapid technology changes and complex customer demands. This position requires a great capacity to take initiative and the ability to self-learning to become an expert in data workflow integration into the MSIGHTS platform and its different modules.<b style="box-sizing:border-box; font-weight:700; font-family:"Franklin Gothic Book", sans-serif; font-size:10pt">ResponsibilitiesDevelop, operate and provide maintenance on tools to access/download data from different sources.Develop a complete understanding of all different data sources that feed the MSIGHTS platform.Proactively work with technology to ensure a successful process of data operations.Develop internal work plans for continuous improvement to outline the critical success factors and metrics.Perform ad hoc data analysis, research and QA as required to ensure data integrity and resolve existing or potential data issues.Identify value-added processes and areas of improvement based on client feedback and translate those into actionable steps for development and implementationQualificationsExceptional ability to go through our internal training sessions and learn the MSIGHTS Platform from a user and marketer’s perspective.Strong communications skills, both written and verbal, and the ability to work well with an internal team.Must be detail oriented, committed to quality, and client focused, all while being flexible and entrepreneurial in a fast-paced international work environment.Exceptional project management, analytical and problem solving skills, and experience applying these skills to resolve application design considerations and client business issues.A strong working knowledge of MS Office (Excel, Word, and PowerPoint) is essential. An ability to quickly learn software programs is a major plus.Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent.For interested candidates, please submit your resume in English as it will be reviewed by global teams.

title: Data Analyst

Review of obsolete products, or with little sale. Support with registration of tickets in Service Now. Administration of the Comprabunzl.mx platformLoad budgets to AS400, TM1. Experience in methodologies and processes for managing large-scale databases. Demonstrated experience in handling large data sets and relational databases. Understanding of addressing and metadata standards. title: CX Data Analyst (Remote)
description: About BaubapWe are a fast-growing, Mexican fintech startup with the mission to become the bridge to people’s financial freedom through technology.We are providing microloans to people in financial need through a fast and efficient process, always treating them with the respect and dignity they deserve.Our long-term vision is being the most inclusive digital bank in LATAM with more than 2.5 million clients.MissionBecome the bridge to people’s financial freedom through technology.VisionBy 2030, be the most inclusive digital bank in LATAM with more than 2.5 million clients.About Your Role (Role Mission)You will be in charge of requesting and analyzing data related to customer experience KPIs (CSAT, NPS, NPR, revenue), in order to create and guide actions that allow us to improve these KPIs. As a customer experience analyst, you will be conducting surveys to collect client feedback, analyzing data, and creating reports with the findings.You will be working closely with the Head of CX, improving the customer experience lifecycle along all the stages: acquisition, onboarding, engagement, retention and advocacy.Day to dayWorking closely with other areas (development, data, marketing, customer champions) to follow up on implementations for specific initiatives from CXStrong focus on analyzing trends within funnel, lifecycle and CX metrics, aiming to propose improvements for the overall customer experienceCreation of initiatives to improve onboarding stage, focusing on reducing blockers within the sign up, loan request and disbursement processes, by escalating any error that could appear on these steps and/or proposing improvements, helping customers to move from onboarding to engagement stagesAnalyze the results of the collections experiments performed by data team, in order to find useful iterations or to create new experiments, helping customers to move out from unpaid statuses and to continue their lifecycle with usOversee the collections strategy (SMS, robocalls, email, push) aiming to create or iterate on initiatives that allow us to increase recovery ratesRequirementsExperience in CX and mapping customer journeys (analyzing data and proposing initiatives based on data)Analytics skills (google sheets, pivot tables, dashboards)Ideally experience in customer service or customer support, through different channelsActive financial services customerMedium English (is a must)Nice to have:Collections experience is not a must but can give you extra pointsYour Skills Data driven mindset: You have a strong focus on data analysis, identifying trends and creating initiatives to achieve results, based on data. Product mindset. You are able to identify valuable insights from the customer interactions and transform them into actionable, product-driven solutions. Highly empathetic. You care deeply about the users and strive for providing them the best, memorable and humane experience possible. Ownership. You are able to work without constant direction. You are the 'owner' of our own work and have the autonomy and freedom to execute it. Proactivity. You act without being told what to do and bring new ideas to the team. You thrive working in a lean and agile environment with hands on approach. Curiosity and creativity. You’re innovative, extremely creative and constantly looking for ways to tweak and optimize the way we do things. Communication. You are an excellent communicator and engage with other team members to share ideas and discuss topics. You are able to give constructive feedback and lead productive discussions.BenefitsBeing part of a multinational, highly driven team of professionals,Flexible and remote working environment,High level of ownership and independence20 vacations days / year + bonus1 month Christmas bonusHealth & Life insuranceVales de despensa $2700 mxn / monthCoworking contributionHome office set-up budgetUnlimited budget for Kindle booksCompetitive salary.

title: Market Data Insight Specialist
description: Daimler Truck AG group is the leader in the global automotive industry with more than 120 years of experience in 200 countries.Our people reflect the company values: Passion, Respect, Integrity and Discipline; we are looking for engaged individuals to join this diverse group, which manages ever-changing challenges.Daimler, a leading and pioneering group worldwide in the automotive industry with more than 120 years and presence in more than 200 countries.In Mexico, it has the following divisions: Mercedes Benz Autos, Daimler Trucks, Daimler Buses and Daimler Financial Services.In our people, we can reflect our corporate values:Passion, Respect, Integrity, Discipline, and we are looking for highly committed people to join the group in an environment of diversity and constant challenges.Position objectives: Collect and analyze quantitative and qualitative information from Trucks and its environment in order to prepare insights, foresights, competitor and customer profiles, trends of the Industry, forecasts to support DTM strategy using traditional methods supported with the use of data science and big data tools and software.Position objectives:Collect and analyze quantitative and qualitative information from Trucks and its environment in order to prepare insights, foresights, competitor and customer profiles, trends of the Industry, forecasts to support DTM strategy using traditional methods supported with the use of data science and big data tools and software.Indispensable Requirements (Candidates who do not meet these requirements may be disqualified): Market ResearchCommercial Vehicles LandscapeStatistics and data managementData Science Tools, model and data interpretationSoft skills: Analysis and Problem SolvingDecision MakingPlanning and OrganizationEffective CommunicationApplication of Information TechnologiesDegree: Bachelor’s Degree in Quantitative Marketing, Market Research, Economics, Industrial o mechanical Engineering or similar with high knowledge and experience using Big Data and Data Science Tools.Location: Santa FeWe want a company in which new ideas flourish and shape the future of mobility. Diversity is our driving force for innovation, makes us more successful and contributes to integration.At Daimler, any form of discrimination is prohibited when it is based on one or more of the following grounds: ethnic or national origin, skin tone, sex, gender, age, disability, social, economic, health or legal status, religion, physical appearance, immigration status, pregnancy, language, sexual orientation, marital status, family responsibilities, language, criminal record or any other reason. We are many and diverse, we do not hide whom and how we are. We are Daimler Trucks Mexico. #Truck #TrucksMain activities: Conduct market research and qualitative/quantitative comparisons of Freightliner and competitors. Prepare detailed profiles/reports and communicate results to business partners and management team.Collect and analyze economic & industry data. Evaluate market segment data to identify new markets and trends. Monitor the truck industry and customer segments for notable trends and developments.Conduct market research and prepare forecasts to support product planning, marketing, sales and aftersales teams about market trends, competitors and pricing definition.Present to dedicated forums (Commitees, MPSC, Mexcom, Dealer)Work Location OpportunityDaimler Trucks AG is firmly committed to developing a work environment that supports empowerment and inclusion for our current and future employees. We recognize that our ability to adapt will enable us to compete for a broader range of talent. Additionally, our business and the people who work within it will be successful and profitable if we remain agile and flexible in our approach to work.To continue to build a great place to work for all, we are committed to a culture that supports flexibility and encourages a positive working environment that achieves the needs of our business and employees.Diversity allows us to employ people with different experiences, abilities and points of view, and that is what enhances our culture and brings us to the forefront among the top global companies.At Daimler, we value the diversity between our employees.In order to enrich the culture, Daimler acknowledges the importance of including people with different points of view and lifestyles into our company. When we select our talent, we focus on abilities; we don’t discriminate based on ethnicity, nationality, gender, race, age, disability, social condition, health, religion, immigrant status, opinions, sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression, marital status, university or appearance.Exceed your expectations and get ready to be part of our team!

title: Data Engineer (ETL)
description: Experience: Senior LevelHello! Are you ready to Work from Home and transform your career?We're looking for a Senior Data Engineer to join the engineering team at Modus. Want to help our clients build awesome solutions to accomplish their goals and vision? Are you interested in working from home with some of the best talents on the planet? Then keep reading.About YouYou love building great solutions. Your work could be supporting new feature development, migrating existing features, or creating new database architectures and ETL processes. You'll have a primary focus on Data Engineering and experience with tools ranging from PowerBI and Tableau to custom Python development and SQL.You are a Data Engineer with cloud platform experiences such as Azure, AWS, or GCP. You participate in onboarding new data sources in ELT/ETL as well as in the development, enhancement, and maintenance of the in-house ETL and database systems. You are very proficient with SQL and SQL Server.You have good hands-on experience with Azure services like Data Factory and Azure CI/CD pipelines. You helped move data from one database to another using Azure Data Factory. You also have experience in designing Power BI datasets and dashboards, including complex DAX functions.You have a good understanding of data warehouse modeling. You enjoy supporting the team with data testing, as well as working to ensure deployment and integration tasks are completed successfully. You are able to come up with initiatives to continuously improve platform performance and reliability, in addition to recommending changes in project design concepts to improve efficiency. You regularly contribute to requirement gathering sessions.You relish creating high-quality code from the comfort of your own home. Your engineering projects will focus on understanding customers' needs and translating those needs from product specifications into functional, production-ready code. You'll have the opportunity to ship code daily that will be used by customers.You love learning. Engineering is an ever-evolving world. You enjoy playing with new tech and exploring areas that you might not have experience with yet. You are a self-driven, self-learner willing to share knowledge and participate actively in your community.Having overlap with your team is critical when working in a global remote team. Modus requires all team members to overlap with EST morning hours daily and for our client, we need you to be aligned with EST/PST. In addition, reliable high-speed internet is a must.[In reference to requisition 992]Things You Might DoModus is a fast-growing, and remote-first company, so you'll likely get experience on many different projects across the organization. That said, here are some things you'll probably do:Give back to the community via open source and blog postsTravel and meet great people- as part of our remote-first lifestyle, it's important that we come together as needed to work together, meet each other in person and have fun together. Please keep that in mind when you apply. Teach and be taught: Modus creates active teams that work in internal and external projects together, giving opportunities to stay relevant with the latest technologies and learning from experts worldwideInteract directly with internal and external clients to represent Modus and its valueWhy Modus Create:Our Benefits may vary according to the Country you are located in, so please reach out to our recruiter in case you have any questions.If you live in USA and you become a full time employee at our office we offer:Competitive compensationHealth insurance (medical, vision, and dental) and other benefits (FSA and HSA)401(K) match to up to 3.5% of your annual salaryRemote workThe chance to work side-by-side with thought leaders in emerging techFlexible Time Off/PTOIf you live in Romania and you become a full time employee at our office we offer:Competitive compensationMedical insuranceBookster subscription, gym reimbursementPossibility to work from homeThe chance to work side-by-side with thought leaders in emerging techIf you live in Costa Rica and you become a full time employee at our office we offer:Competitive compensation100% Remote work (could vary according to the client's needs)Travel according to client's needsCompany paid private insuranceThe chance to work side-by-side with thought leaders in emerging techSocial Security (CCSS) by lawIf you live anywhere else you can become a contractor, and then we offer:Competitive compensation100% Remote work (could vary according to the client's needs)Travel according to client's needsThe chance to work side-by-side with thought leaders in emerging techDo you have what it takes? Apply today!About Modus CreateModus Create is a digital product agency that accelerates digital transformation. We use high performing small teams, emerging technology, and "new school" product development tools and methods to accelerate business outcomes. We support our clients across four core delivery areas: business and product strategy consulting, customer experience, cloud services, and Agile software delivery.Driven by a team of world-class talent, we have been recognized by the Inc. 5000 list of fastest growing private companies 5 years in a row, the Washington Business Journal list of Fastest Growing Companies in the Washington, DC area two years in a row, and a top company for remote work by FlexJobs. We're also an official partner to Atlassian, AWS, Cloudflare, GitHub, InVision, Ionic Framework, and Vue.js!Based on the model of an open source team, Modites work remotely, and are located across the globe. That's allowed us to hire the best talent in the world, no matter where they live. Our highly collaborative, autonomous, and effective working environment is fueled by a team unified by a love of continuous learning. Our years of thought leadership including books, whitepapers, blog posts, conference and MeetUp talks, demonstrate our commitment to sharing what we've learned.We encourage every Modus employee to do the same. Our company is a platform for the growth of our employees. Through working with our distributed team of experts on challenging projects, every person that joins the Modus team can expect to continue growing and learning every day. This is your chance to be part of building something great.Federal law requires Modus Create to confirm the identity and employment eligibility of all persons hired to work in the United States as full-time employees. The statement above does not apply to 1099 Contractors or International ContractorsModus Create is committed to creating a diverse environment, and each of us contributes to inclusion. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

title: Data Access Analyst
description: Descripción de la empresaBosch fue fundada en Stuttgart en 1886 por Robert Bosch (1861-1942), y por más de 130 años se ha distinguido por una cultura corporativa única, basada en valores sólidos que nos impulsan a mejorar cada día. Nuestros productos, presentes en una amplia variedad de terrenos, contribuyen a mejorar la calidad de vida de millones de personas.Descripción del empleoNuestro analista en manejo de accesos es encargado de prevenir riesgos y daños financieros relacionados con la privacidad y seguridad de la información y con la administración de accesos a los sistemas de información, basado en políticas y directivas centrales de la compañía.Participar en los entrenamientos proporcionados por las divisiones centrales.Responder preguntas, atender las reuniones relacionadas a temas de acceso de datos en la localidad de soporte.Dar soporte de manejo de accesos a las aplicaciones de las localidades asignadas y creación de los “Application Authorization Concepts”.Soporte en auditorias.Solicitar accesos a los roles y transacciones para asegurar la continuidad de los negocios, y en caso de ser necesario, contribuir a mitigar riesgos con la asignación y/o remoción de accesos.Soporte en la recertificación de accesos por localidad y departamentos, de acuerdo a la directriz central y división a la que reporta el negocio.Dar soporte a los Application Owners para dar cumplimiento a las directrices globales y divisionales.Brindar soporte y consultoría a los temas relevantes de Manejo de Accesos en sistemas SAP y no SAP.RequisitosLicenciatura en informática, sistemas computacionales o afín.1 a 3 años de experiencia profesional.Inglés intermedio/avanzado.Experiencia en auditorias y seguridad de accesos.SAP preferentemente o algún otro ERP system (Access Management).Experiencia en temas y sistemas IT y procesos corporativos.Información adicionalConoce más sobre cómo trabajamos en Bosch y las nuevas vacantes en nuestras redes sociales:Facebook: Bosch Talento MéxicoInstagram: Bosch Campus MéxicoLinkedIn: Bosch México

title: Data Analyst B2B
description: Acerca de AutolabAutolab es un emprendimiento de alto crecimiento en el sector automotriz. A través de una plataforma tecnológica, ofrecemos a nuestros clientes finales un servicio de reparación de vehículos confiable, asequible y con gran servicio. Todas las reparaciones son realizadas por una red de talleres independientes que se asocian con Autolab (talleres aliados). Autolab atrae clientes a los talleres y les ofrece como valor agregado un software para manejar la relación cliente-taller. Este tech stack permite a Autolab controlar la calidad y eficiencia de la operación, logrando así un servicio único de cara al cliente final.Estamos en modo crecimiento, expandiendo nuestra red de talleres aliados rápidamente y adquiriendo nuevos clientes para los talleres aliados.Sobre el rolEstamos buscando un Data Analyst, su rol será garantizar la finalización exitosa de las tareas analíticas, desarrollo de negocios, presentaciones de alto nivel con clientes, seguimiento a tareas específicas del equipo B2B y prueba e implementación de nuestro producto.Trabajará junto con KAM comerciales y líderes de operaciones e informará directamente al VP de B2B. Para tener éxito en este rol, debe tener una forma de pensar analítica natural, excelente comunicación, manejo Excel y Power Point avanzado y ser capaz de explicar conceptos difíciles.ResponsabilidadesAnalizar y evaluar los procesos comerciales actuales e identificar áreas de mejoraInvestigar y revisar procesos comerciales y operacionales y nuevos avances de TI para hacer que los sistemas sean más modernosPresentar ideas y hallazgos en reunionesCrear iniciativas en función de los requerimientos y necesidades del negocioDesarrollar proyectos y monitorear el desempeño de proyectos específicosColaborar con la alta dirección, socios, clientes y técnicos. Requisitos+2 años experiencia relevanteExperiencia creando informes detallados y dando presentaciones. Experiencia influenciando equipos de alto rendimientoConocimiento avanzado en Excel y Power Point. Habilidades de pensamiento analítico y conceptual. Excelente comunicación oral y escrita. Info AdicionalUbicación: CDMX (Cuauhtémoc)Disponibilidad: Inmediata

title: Analista de datos
description: Financiera Independencia pertenece a un grupo financiero mexicano, donde el valor humano es fundamental en su día a día. Por lo cual, deseamos tener a colaboradores comprometidos, honestos y con ganas de sumarse a nuestra FUERZA IMPARABLE comoAnalista de Datos.OBJETIVO DEL PUESTOAdministrar las diferentes bases de datos del grupo para que las aplicaciones hagan uso eficiente de sucontenido, se pueda acceder a la información que los usuarios tengan autorizada, mantener la integridad y quesea posible recuperar la información.FUNCIONES PRINCIPALESAdministrar y dar mantenimiento a las bases de datos en SQL server, Administración de Mongo DB 3Respaldar y recuperar las bases de datos.Monitorear Bases de Datos, diagnosticar y solucionar incidencias, administrar accesos y atender problemas de las bases de datos.Aplicar cambios/liberaciones en las bases de datos.Administración de usuarios, roles y privilegio en BDsConocimientos Teórico- TécnicosBases de datos SQL, postgre, Oracle, alguna de estas funciona bien.Lenguajes de programación Java o PythonUso de BigQueryAnálisis de informaciónConocimiento de software de reportería:, Power BIFormación Académica: Ingeniería en Sistemas, Computación o InformáticaPrestaciones y beneficios adicionalesSueldo bruto mensual de: $18,000 BRUTOSPrestaciones de ley y algunas superioresSeguro de vidaZona a Laborar Santa Fe y/o Periférico tenemos oficinas en ambas zonas y pueden elegir la más cercanaHorario de Lunes a Viernes de 9:00 am a 6:30 pm

title: Data Analyst / Business Intelligence
description: 1 año de experiencia como data analyst o business intelligence.Detalles sobre nuestro cliente: Nuestro cliente es una empresa consultora cuya actividad principal es la inversión de capital y financiamiento de pymes.Tus actividades y responsabilidades diarias:Análisis de datos internos y externos procedentes de distintas fuentes y sistemas.Desarrollar procesos de extracción, transformación e integración de datos.Categorización de información desde distintas bases de datos para realización de una sola.Modelaje de resultados para identificar áreas de mejora y proponer soluciones eficaces.Seguimiento y reporting ejecutivo.Generar pronósticos y proyecciones del proceso de negocio.Control y seguimiento de proyectos asignados.Tu compensación económica por tu colaboración:$15,000 libres mensuales.Prestaciones de ley.Los horarios en que trabajarás son: Lunes a Jueves de 8:30 am a 2:30 pm y 4:00 pm a 7:00 pm.Viernes de 8:30 am a 3:00 pm.Requisitos:Licenciatura o Ing. en Tecnologías Computacionales, Sistemas Informáticos, Matemáticas Aplicadas, Estadísitca, Finanzas y Economía.1 año de experiencia como data analyst o business intelligence.Experiencia en el sector retail.Experiencia en el uso de ERP.Manejo de bases de datos.Manejo avanzado de Excel.Si eres una persona con habilidad para analizar datos, resolver problemas de manera proactiva y con gusto por la tecnología, ¡esta posición es para ti!.

title: Data Analyst
description: This role has been designated as ‘Edge’, which means you will primarily work outside of an HPE office.Job DescriptionHewlett Packard Enterprise is the global edge-to-cloud company advancing the way people live and work. We help companies connect, protect, analyze, and act on their data and applications wherever they live, from edge to cloud, so they can turn insights into outcomes at the speed required to thrive in today’s complex world. Our culture thrives on finding new and better ways to accelerate what’s next. We know diverse backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good. If you are looking to stretch and grow your career our culture will embrace you. Open up opportunities with HPE.Hewlett Packard Enterprise advances the way people live and work. We bring together the brightest minds to create breakthrough technology solutions, helping our customers make their mark on the world.Defines, develops, evaluates and oversees the implementation of pricing models and strategies designed to optimize revenue, market share, brand positioning and long-term profits. Partners with Sales/Marketing, Business Development, Finance and other key stakeholders to correctly position product portfolio and establish pricing programs aligned with product/sales strategy and revenue recognition requirements. Prioritizes and delivers on opportunities to monetize products offered initially at little to no cost, or to implement upsell opportunities as products are repositioned in the marketplace. Monitors the ongoing business environment to ensure competitive pricing/market position and directs the development and analysis of pricing models and projections. Oversees the implementation of pricing proposals across the organization.Applies advanced subject matter knowledge to solve complex business issues and is regarded as a subject matter expert. Frequently contributes to the development of new ideas and methods. Works on complex problems where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of multiple factors. Leads and/or provides expertise to functional project teams and may participate in cross-functional initiatives. Acts as an expert providing direction and guidance to process improvements and establishing policies. Frequently represents the organization to external customers/clients. Exercises significant independent judgment to determine best method for accomplishing work and achieving objectives. May provide mentoring and guidance to lower level employees.How You'll Make Your Mark Provides highly insightful analysis exercising a strong understanding of the business to determine the best method for achieving objectives. Identifies opportunities for process improvement and policy development and engages in the design. Data mining using state-of-the-art methods. Enhancing data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic systems Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis. Doing ad-hoc analysis and presenting results in a clear manner Creating interactive dashboards & KPIAbout You Bachelors in Business, Data Science or related field Masters preferred Typically 5+ years working with Big data Experience with common data science toolkits, such as R, Python is required Experience with data visualization tools, such as Power BI, Tableau, etc., Proficiency in using query languages such as SQL or Hive Experience with NoSQL databases Good understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms Ability to apply analytical problem solving skills. Enhanced pattern recognition techniques Good scripting & programming skills and someone who is Data-oriented Excellent ability to analyze and organize data to unveil opportunities Strong multi-tasking and prioritization skills. Excellent written and verbal communication skills Excellent project management skills. Strong business acumen. Good understanding of sound business processes, ability to identify, develop, and drive operational improvementsJoin us and make your mark!We Offer A competitive salary and extensive social benefits Diverse and dynamic work environment Work-life balance and support for career development An amazing life inside the element! Want to know more about it?HPE is an Equal Employment Opportunity/ Veterans/Disabled/LGBT and Affirmative Action employer. We are committed to diversity and building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We do not discriminate and all decisions we make are made on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. Our goal is to be one global diverse team that is representative of our customers, in an inclusive environment where we can continue to innovate and grow together.Hewlett Packard Enterprise ValuesPartnership first: We believe in the power of collaboration - building long term relationships with our customers, our partners and each otherBias for action: We never sit still - we take advantage of every opportunityInnovators at heart: We are driven to innovate - creating both practical and breakthrough advancementsHPE is an EOE / Female / Minority / Individual with Disabilities /At HPE our goal is to provide equal opportunities, work-life balance, and constantly evolving career opportunities.If you are looking for challenges in a pleasant and international work environment, then we definitely want to hear from you.Apply now below, or directly via our Careers Portal at www.hpe.com/careersThen let’s stay connected!https://www.facebook.com/HPECareershttps://twitter.com/HPE_Careers#MexicoJobMarketingJob LevelExpertHewlett Packard Enterprise is EEO F/M/Protected Veteran/ Individual with Disabilities.HPE will comply with all applicable laws related to employer use of arrest and conviction records, including laws requiring employers to consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description: We’re recruiting for a mid to senior level Business Intelligence Analyst to join our Data Product Team.You'll have experience in using SQL within the Microsoft BI stack, as well as in the effective use of visualization tools such as Tableau for delivering self-serve dashboards.This role requires a combination of keen technical and analytical data analysis abilities combined with a creative flair for producing engaging and insightful reporting through Tableau.The team serves a global business meaning you’ll need strong stakeholder and project management skills combined with the drive to deliver results against short timeframes.It’s the perfect fit for an analyst who enjoys creating global data solutions, working with Tier 1 clients, fixing problems and helping plan future products to implement or upgrade.RequirementsAbility to speak and write English.Knowledge and experience working with:Python, SQL and TableauBenefitsWe count with attractive benefits for our staff which will make even more enriching experience!

title: Analista Jr de Datos Maestros
description: Importante laboratorio Farmacéutico está en búsqueda deAnalista Jr de Datos Maestros de SAPRequisitos Licenciatura en Informática o afin. Experiencia de un año Manejo de Windows, Office, Plataforma, Google, SAP Inglés técnico Actividades Administración de Datos Maestros en SAP Establecimiento de estrategias de comunicación Construcción, migración y limpieza de Datos Maestros Implementación de reportes de control Ofrecemos Sueldo competitivo Contratación directa por el laboratorio Prestaciones superiores a las de ley (vales de despensa, fondo de ahorro, seguro de vida, seguro de gastos médicos mayores, etc.) Zona de trabajo Santa Fe Postúlate por este medio adjuntando tu CV actualizado¡Únete a la gran familia Siegfried Rhein!SIEGFRIED RHEIN es un laboratorio farmacéutico comprometido con la salud en México que ofrece un amplio portafolio de productos de alta calidad que brindan soluciones terapéuticas a una gran variedad de patologías con las que diariamente se enfrentan los Profesionales de la Salud en nuestro país.Dentro de nuestro portafolio destacan marcas de gran reconocimiento por su eficacia, alta calidad y seguridad, cuentan con la preferencia de la comunidad médica, quién las ha convertido en productos que ocupan los primeros lugares en prescripción médica dentro de sus respectivas clases terapéuticas. Nuestro objetivo es la mejora continua de la calidad de vida, la esperanza y bienestar de los mexicanos a través de la preservación de la salud.

title: Data Analyst - Remote - Work From Anywhere
description: We are experiencing tremendous momentum, and are expanding our team. Our Data Analyst (or Sr. Analyst, depending on experience) is a highly strategic hire, and will sit in our data solutions organizationOur Data Analyst will leverage their quantitative and technology skill sets to help continually refine and improve our existing product suites through iterative testing and reporting. This position will be essential in building and deploying the reporting system that will track the volume and health of our various data feeds and products. This position will also have a role in creating the next generation of our data products and methodologies through analytical prototyping, deep exploratory analysis, and pilot client engagements. The analyst will participate in cross-functional interfacing with our client success, data operations, and product and engineering teams to align analytic requirements and fulfill customer ad hoc requests as needed.Our Data Analyst can sit anywhere in the US or Mexico CityRequirementsGeneral RequirementsBachelor’s degree or equivalent in quantitative field (comp sci, physics, math, etc.); masters degree a plus1-2 years hands-on experience in big data; analytics; experience in the ad/mar:tech industry is a big plusFluent in English, both verbal and written Excellent interpersonal skills Professional attitude and continual willingness to go the extra mile to delight the customer Strong organization skills with the ability to multitask projects from start to finish Excellent critical thinking and ability to understand real-world problems, and apply data and quant skills to solve themEssential Technical SkillsStrong SQL experience with a deep understanding of aggregate functions and various join typesExperience with Python3 and associated analytical solutions like scikit, pandas, pysparkExperience writing code in a notebook interface (Jupyter, Databricks, etc)Experience using and deploying dashboards with self-service reporting tools (Tableau, Amazon Quicksight, etc)Experience working with petabytes of data and the associated challengesExperience querying large datasets for purposes of producing summary data and/or generating new data sets (ETL)Ability to concisely visualize and explain characteristics of large datasets to a non-technical audiencePreferred Technical SkillsExperience with Apache Spark, Databricks Notebooks, mlflowExperience with various file types (csv, parquet, JSON) as well as potentially complex or nested column types (arrays, structs, etc)Fluent in Scala and associated analytical libraries Experience with Data Lake architecture Strong AWS experience with S3, Athena, CloudFormation Experience with Mobile (iOS/Android) technologies like SDKs, IDFAs/AAIDs, etc. Experience with data science and machine learning techniques across predictive modeling, classification, test/control measurement (ancova, panel-based measurement), population/census weighting, stratified sampling, etc. Familiarity with data and infrastructure monitoring and alerting toolingBenefitsWork from anywhere. We hire the best talent regardless of where they want to work. Vacation: unlimited, "take-what-you-need" Equity: Included, grant based on experience Standard benefits: Healthcare, 401K, etc.About TrueDataFounded in 2013, is a rapidly growing company with employees concentrated in Los Angeles, Chicago, New York & Mexico City. TrueData empowers growth champions by delivering data solutions that are accessible, actionable and True.TrueData believes that high-quality data will power the AI and algorithms of the future, and Truedata is at the forefront of this trend. TrueData delivers real, people-based data that is never inferred, modelled or extrapolated. It is TrueData’s unwavering dedication to deliver real, quality data at scale.TrueData works with the broadest set of data types on the market, providing brands, marketers, AdTech vendors and publishers a single platform for an array of data services – from Identity resolution and audience segment activation to flexibility and control of data licensing while remaining privacy safe.

title: Jr. Data Analyst - Mexico [Remote]
description: The Role:The Jr. Data Analyst, referred to as the QCO, will be managing, analyzing, and cleaning data on a real-time basis, providing feedback to field teams, and collaborating with members of the Enveritas global team. We think you'll be excited to join us as Enveritas will invest heavily in your growth and success. You will have the backing of a global team with deep experience in coffee sustainability and technology to help you reach your goals.What you will be doing:Monitor quality of data collected on a daily basis and communicate to respective Field CoordinatorsPrepare daily Quality Control reports, weekly close-out materials, retraining materials, etcFollow up on a daily basis with FCs to correct rejected surveys and solve issues with problematic enumeratorsMonitor completed surveys and check for bad data or erroneous randomization protocols employedSupport close-out and finalization of data, including preparation of contextual insights about coffee regionsManage backcheck survey process and supervise backcheck person (s) for the country/regionDeveloping ToolsTest and help to design Data Quality tools and survey questionnaires using smartphonesSupport customization of smallholder, mill/estate and backcheck surveys for the countryCollaborate with other members of the Latin America Data & Insights team to develop and improve DQ protocols Provide support to Product, Data and Engineering teams for development, integration and beta testing of new tools and systemsAnalysis and InsightsPrepare and share weekly analysis and statistics on the progress of data collection with country teams and the complete Latin America operations teamContribute to analysis projects and country stakeholder presentations using coffee verification data and insightsProvide data and analytical support for special projects, as they arise (other Enveritas surveys, advanced analysis projects and reports)TrainingParticipate in the training of Field Coordinators and enumerators; lead sessions on Data QualityTrain Enveritas field ops team on new survey and data quality tools, as they are released Other duties as assignedDesired Knowledge & Experience You Bring:Data driven: Experience managing and conducting quantitative and qualitative research with strong data quality management knowledge is highly desirable Detail oriented: Puts high attention on details and helps teams to improve quality of the dataComputer skills: Including proficiency in Microsoft Office and Google Docs applications, familiarity with quantitative data collection software/platforms; knowledge of Python or other programming languages beneficial, but not required Excellent verbal and written proficiency in Spanish and working proficiency in EnglishQuick learner and effective team-playerExcellent communication and analytical skills; flexible problem-solving attitudeBeneficial but not required:Knowledge of Python or other programming languages desired, not requiredExperience with coffee farming highly advantageous (raised in coffee growing families, participated in research conducted on coffee)Work location and hours:We are a fully remote team (no office) with the potential for travel to various coffee regions; the QCO will have occasional visits to the office. Full-time availability and willingness to work during non-business hours, including weekends if neededWillingness to travel to remote areas. Expect about 30% of your time dedicated to travelingWhat we can offer:Enveritas offers competitive salaries benchmarked on local context. Commensurate with experience, the expected base salary for this position is between 20,000 and 25,000 Mexican Pesos per monthProfessional Development StipendWeekly all-hands meeting with global team (virtual)Annual all-company retreat (as Covid and other travel restrictions allow)We offer a fun, open, flat, and agile work culture that mitigates the communication challenges posed by being a global organization. The QCO will join other team members and the Data Analysts in a series of activities and different projects to manage data quality throughout the region.The Enveritas team is about 60 members globally; our team is made up of program & field operations managers, data scientists, product managers, software engineers, agronomy and coffee industry experts, and multi-generational coffee farmers.Application Process, typical stages include:Submission of application. Priority consideration for applications received by January 15th. Role alignment interview; an opportunity to learn if this position is a mutually good fitCase StudyFinal interview; the candidate will interview with Regional ManagerAll finalists will need to provide three professional referencesWe recognize that people come with a wealth of experience and talent beyond what we list as qualifications. Your life experiences help build core competencies and knowledge that may be transferable to our openings. We are dedicated to hiring employees who reflect the communities we serve and strongly encourage qualified candidates from all backgrounds to apply.Our work is complex and nuanced, so the more diversity we have in the voices working on our problems, the larger of an impact our work can have for the world. Enveritas is an Equal Opportunity Employer encouraging an inclusive and diverse workforce. We embrace and celebrate the unique experiences, perspectives, and cultural backgrounds that each individual brings to the workplace.About Enveritas:Enveritas offers a new approach to sustainability assurance for companies and farmers. We are building sustainability solutions for smallholder coffee farming communities that are currently beyond the reach of existing certification and verification approaches. At Enveritas, we have developed a rigorous, scalable, and transparent verification method. This verification is the backbone of our Responsible Sourcing platform that helps companies meet their sustainability targets by investing in the areas that need it most.Enveritas is a startup non-profit focused on helping 100 million people out of poverty by 2030. Founded in 2016 and fast-growing, Enveritas now operates in 26 countries and provides sustainability verification free of charge for smallholder farmers. Using leading-edge AI, Enveritas has developed innovative approaches to monitor deforestation and calculate carbon footprints in the supply chains of multinational firms. We are a fully distributed team of about 60 team members plus over 300 field staff in our partner organizations with an annual operating budget for 2021 at approximately $10M.Please feel free to contact us at jobs@enveritas.org should you have any questions about this position. Questions about this opportunity or process will not reflect negatively on your application

title: Data Analyst, Global Workplace Services team
description: We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our global GWS Performance & Project Management Office team as part of our Global Workplace Services (GWS) team. You will report to our Head of GWS Performance & PMO.The GWS team makes Spotify a great place to work by providing spaces and services that bring our culture and values to life and keep band members safe. We cover all aspects and the full life cycle of our buildings and consist of GWS Performance & PMO, Real Estate, Workplace Build Projects, Workplace Experience & Support (Office Management, Workplace IT and Travel) and Business Protection.In this role you will utilise your experience and skills to help us drive an insights-led culture within GWS. Your main responsibilities will be to solve complex data problems, deliver insights, build data models, and establish metrics and dashboards to support our team in decision-making.You will be the first data analyst in GWS and work closely with band members in Real Estate, Workplace Build, Travel, Office Management, Workplace IT, Business Protection and FP&A.What you’ll doCollaborate with the GWS teams to understand and identify data needs and come up with technical proposals on how to proceedBe a key partner in building out a data-informed approach within GWSDevelop, launch and maintain data pipelines for data and metricsExplore, understand and organize existing data and metricsBuild and maintain user-oriented dashboards and actionable data visualizationsSupervise key metrics and understand the root causes of changes and trendsEnsure data integrityWho you areYou have 4+ years of relevant experienceMinimum a Master Degree from an accredited institution within computer science, engineering, statistics, mathematics, economics or another quantitative subject areaYou have strong interpersonal skills and are comfortable working with multiple stakeholdersStart-up attitude. You are prepared to collaborate and tackle problems outside of your comfort zoneYou know how to tackle loosely defined problems and come up with relevant answers and impactful insightsYou have experience working using SQL to extract and transform complex datasets into more easily consumable formats.You have worked with Tableau (or another BI tool), connecting to multiple data sources to create reports and dashboards.You have strong analytical and quantitative skills and the ability to identify and translate data into insights and insights into actions.Fluent in spoken and written English together with strong communication skillsPreferably, you have worked within the field of workplace experience and have a sense for the analysis required to drive decisions and evaluate resultsAccustomed to working in a high paced international environment where change is the only constantWhere you´ll beWe’ve introduced Work From Anywhere to give you more options!While we will ask you to pop into the Stockholm office from time to time, we are giving you the flexibility to work from home should you choose to do so.Working hours? We operate within the Central European time zone for collaborationSpotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: HR Data Analyst
description: The Company:It’s no surprise that 6sense is named a top workplace year after year — we have industry-leading technology developed and taken to market by a world-class team. 6sense is Top Rated on Glassdoor with a 4.9/5 and our CEO Jason Zintak was recognized as the #1 CEO in the small & medium business category by Glassdoor’s 2021 Top CEO Employees Choice Awards.In 2021, the company was recognized for having the Best Company for Diversity, Best Company for Women, Best CEO, Best Company Culture, Best Company Perks & Beneﬁts and Happiest Employees from the employee feedback platform Comparably. In addition, 6sense has also won several accolades that demonstrate its reputation as an employer of choice including the Glassdoor Best Place to Work (2022), TrustRadius Tech Cares (2021) and Inc. Best Workplaces (2022, 2021, 2020, 2019).6sense reinvents the way organizations create, manage, and convert pipeline to revenue. The 6sense Revenue AI captures anonymous buying signals, predicts the right accounts to target at the ideal time, and recommends the channels and messages to boost revenue performance. Removing guesswork, friction and wasted sales effort, 6sense empowers sales, marketing, and customer success teams to signiﬁcantly improve pipeline quality, accelerate sales velocity, increase conversion rates, and grow revenue predictably.The Role:Our People team is looking for a People Data Analyst to join our team! Reporting into the Sr. Manager, People Technology and Analytics, you will have the opportunity to build and design People Analytic dashboards to drive data-driven decisions.We are looking for a detail-oriented, inquisitive, problem-solver who wants a hands-on role in delivering analytical products and insights to support our people team, leadership team, and managers.Essential Duties & Responsibilities:Support People team in delivering meaningful metrics, establishing data definitions, and defining reporting cadence. Create/edit custom reports and user-friendly dashboards to make proactive and solution-driven business recommendations. Manage data governance by streamlining and establishing data audit processes to ensure data integrity and proper controls are in place. Provide support on any ad-hoc reporting requests. Identify data gaps and partner with Workday Analyst to configure data needed to track in HRIS system. Monitor regularly scheduled reports and reach out to end-users on a regular basis to request business justification for the report. Required Skills / Experiences:Undergraduate degree or equivalent relevant experience 2+ years of experience in Human Resources or Data Analytics Advance knowledge of Excel (vlookups, pivot tables, if statement, etc…) Advance knowledge of data visualization in Excel, Powerpoint, Tableau. Experience in Workday, ADP Workforce Now, Kamsa, Lattice, Greenhouse, is a plus Every person in every role at 6sense owns a part of deﬁning the future of our industry-leading technology. You’ll join a team where curiosity is prized, no one’s satisﬁed with the status quo, and everyone’s all-in on the collective good.6sense is a place where difference-makers roll up their sleeves, take risks, act with integrity, and measure successby the value we create for our customers.We want 6sense to be the best chapter of your career.Feel part of somethingYou’ll be part of building tomorrow’s tech, revolutionizing how marketing and sales teams create, manage, and convert pipeline to revenue. And you’ll be seen and appreciated by co-workers who challenge you, cheer you on, and always have your back.At 6sense, you’ll experience the passion from customers and colleagues alike for our market-leading vision, and you're entrusted with applying your unique talents to help bring that vision to life.Build a careerAs part of a company on a rocketship trajectory, there’s no way around it: You’re going to experience unparalleled career growth. With colleagues as humble and hungry as you are, and a leadership philosophy grounded in trust, transparency, and empowerment, every day is a chance to improve on the one before.Enjoy access to our Udemy Training Library with 5,000+ courses, give and get recognition from your coworkers, and spend time with our executive team every two weeks in our All Hands gathering to connect, learn and ask leaders about whatever is on your mind.Enjoy work, and your lifeThis is a place where you’ll do your best work and inspire others to do theirs — where you’re guaranteed to make real connections, for life, along the way.We want to help you prioritize health and wellness, today and tomorrow. Take advantage of family medical coverage; a monthly stipend to support your physical, mental, and ﬁnancial wellness; generous paid parental leave beneﬁts; Plus, we have an open time-off policy, so you can take the time you need.Set for successA vision as big as ours only comes to life when we’re all winning together.We’ll make sure you have the equipment you need to work at home or in one of our oﬃces. And have the right snacks, pens or lighting with our work-from-home expense reimbursement allowance. We also partner with WeWork to make sure that if your choice is a hybrid of home and oﬃce, we have you covered in the locations they’re offered.That’s the commitment we make to every one of our employees. If this sounds like a place where you'll thrive as you take your success to the next level, let’s chat!6sense is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. If you require reasonable accommodation in completing this application, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, please direct your inquiries to jobs@6sense.com.

title: Data Analytics Coordinator
description: The Data Analytics Coordinator is responsible for interpreting data and converting it into information, which can offer ways to improve the business, thus affecting business decisions. Will gather information from various sources and interpret patterns and trends. Once data has been gathered and interpreted, the Data Analyst will report back what has been found in a comprehensive study/report. Proactively identify trends and usual patterns that could impact the business reporting and KPIs (Transactions, commissions, statements, premium, etc.) analyze root causes and generate action plans to correct and prevent in the future. Main activities:1. Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports 2. Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics, and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality 3. Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems 4. Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets 5. Filter and “clean” data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems 6. Develop efficient methods for transactions, deposits, statements reconciliations  7. Work with different departments (Dev, IT, RPA, Compliance, Legal, CDM, OPS) to understand root causes and develop action plans

title: Data Governance Analyst
description: Data Governance Analyst Concentrix Catalyst is the experience design and engineering team of Concentrix, a leading global solutions company that reimagines everything CX through strategy, talent and technology. We combine human-centered design, powerful data and strong tech to accelerate CX transformation at scale.Our Data Governance Analyst will be key drivers of good process, insight, safeguards and community for all things data at Catalyst. This will require working closely with technical and business partners through the lens of good data governance practice.Major parts of good data governance practice are documentation, communication, and managing master data. As the data governance analyst, you will be helping to keep our data governance tools up to date and fully enmeshed with our ecosystem, allowing the business to do what is right with the right data.Finally, good data governance means being involved across the organization. You will be able to interface with multiple disciplines at varying levels across the organization. Facilitating understanding and control of our data assets.Your Responsibilities:Update and maintain our data governance tool setsSupport Master Data Management activities including business rule creation, monitoring, documentation, and maintenancePerform profiling and analysis activities on our dataSupport the application of process to business and technologyIdeate and facilitate the development of Data Governance controlsPartner with Internal Audit and legal teams to support auditing functionsWork with technical teams to provide insight into potential data issues What You Will Bring to Amherst:Exceptional communication skillsProficiency in SQLExperience in data analysis, data profiling, transformation, and data reconciliation techniques.Experience with Data Governance tools such as Alation or ColibraExperience with MDM tools such as Profisee, Realtio, or SemarchyExperience with data concepts including warehousing, structured/unstructured data, and accessibilityExperience in the application of Data Governance process and best practicesA passion for making a difference for the enterprise through our work5 years working in a data related role2-5 years of experience with data governance efforts

title: Marketing Data Analyst
description: ABOUT POSTPILOTPostPilot is a marketing automation platform that helps ecommerce stores send powerful postcard marketing campaigns to their customers. The team behind PostPilot also runs Handwrite, which helps organizations connect with their audiences using handwritten cards, produced by handwriting robots.ABOUT YOU Are you an SQL and reporting wizard? Does a beautiful dashboard get you excited? Can you do a chi-squared test in your sleep?Are you proactive and constantly exceeding expectations with your deliverables?You will be working directly with our account management team, taking customer data and preparing a variety of reports upon request. These will be provided to our clients to show the results of various marketing campaigns.You will be using SQL and various reporting platforms, such as Metabase. We're looking for someone that not only completes tasks efficiently, but thinks about how to improve the process and output.REQUIREMENTS Must be available during US business hours (EST).Must be fluent in English to understand and process requests without confusion.We are looking for a long-term engagement with someone that wants to be a part of our team.Proficient in SQL, ExcelUnderstanding of statistics and probabilityIdeally, some experience with marketing dataExperience communicating complex analyses in a simple and easy to understand wayThis is a full-time remote position

title: Junior Data Engineer
description: This successful candidate will be responsible to plan and coordinate the administration of databases, to ensure accurate, appropriate, and effective use of data, including database definition, structure, documentation, long-range requirements, and operational guidelines.It involves designing, developing, and supporting new and current ETL processes employing industry standards and best practices to enhance loading of data from and into different source/ target systems.Additionally, you will perform quality control audits to ensure accuracy, completeness, and proper usage of data in tables and various support tools, such as database dictionaries. Reviewing database design and integration of systems including client/servers, mainframes and making recommendations regarding enhancements and or improvements will also be part of your activities. You may establish and maintain security and integrity controls, provide appropriate consulting, interfacing and standards relating to database management and monitor transactions activity and utilization. Preparing and/or reviewing activity, progress and performance of current process and jobs.Responsibilities:Provide support and technical issue resolution in Production environmentCreate, developing and maintain data modelsPrepare plans for all ETL procedures and architecturesModified delivered ETL jobs based on Functional RequirementsMonitoring and tuning data loads and queriesPrepare various code designs and ensure efficient implementations of the sameMonitor data warehouse work and provide subject matter expertiseDeveloped multiple Proof-Of-Concepts to justify viability of the ETL solutionAttending and contributing to project development meetingsQualifications:Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science Information Systems, other related discipline, or equivalent experiencePrograming experience in performance tuning and testingKnowledge of database technologiesExperience in ETL 2 years2+ years in OracleExperience in PL/SQLUnix/Linux and Windows operating systemsExperience in data warehousingExperience in Snowflake (preferred)Experience in Business Intelligence (preferred)Experience in writing complete SQL queries stored proceduresKnowledgeable of testing and data validation techniqueAbility to communicate to wide variety of audiences, technical and businessAbility to learn new software and technologies quickly.Ability to work either independently and in team and communicate effectively with Business Analyst, Report Developers and QA team.Knowledgeable in logical, conceptual, and physical design.Knowledgeable in modelingStrong analytical skills and problem-solvingDesign and build new database structuresAbility to transform business requirements into technical requirementsCompuCom is committed to providing equal employment opportunities in all employment practices. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, age, disability, protected veteran status, sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Online Data Analyst
description: We are hiring freelance English & Spanish speaking Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, e.g., verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.RequirementsFull Professional Proficiency in English & SpanishYou must be living in Mexico for the last 2 consecutive yearsAbility to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website informationYou must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in MexicoBeing open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. Maps, News, Audio tasks, Relevance)Applicants must be 18 years or over.Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.
