title: Data Quality Analyst
description: Concentrix Catalyst is the experience design and engineering team of Concentrix, a leading global solutions company that reimagines everything CX through strategy, talent and technology. We combine human-centered design, powerful data and strong tech to accelerate CX transformation at scale. Capabilities/Technologies· Knowledge and experience with SQL· Ability to consume, identify, and document data quality issues· Experience in validation of diverse data inputs to assess conformation to requirements· Experience in synthesizing data quality requirements to technical staff to facilitate the creation of controls and dashboarding in support of monitoring.· Experience with a visualization tool such as Tableau or Power BI· Familiarity with concepts in data architecture, data modeling, transformation, and data reconciliation techniques.· Knowledge of the modern cloud-based data stack, Data Bricks, Cloudera etc.· Experience with Data Governance tools such as Alation or Colibra· Experience with data concepts including warehousing, structured/unstructured data, and accessibilityResponsibilitiesMonitoring of adherence to quality baselines and adherence to Data Governance and control policies.Definition of technical remediation of data quality issues in the data eco-system; independent of the application layer.Communication with the business should any data quality issues bubble up.Engaging with the business to establish risk criteria.Recommendations of data processing improvements to mitigate future risk.What You Will Bring to the team:· Exceptional communication skills· Proficiency in SQL· Experience in data analysis, data profiling, transformation, and data reconciliation techniques.· Experience with Data Governance tools such as Alation or Colibra· Experience with MDM tools such as Profisee, Realtio, or Semarchy· Experience with data concepts including warehousing, structured/unstructured data, and accessibility· Experience in the application of Data Governance process and best practices· A passion for making a difference for the enterprise through our work· 5 years working in a data related role· 2-5 years of experience with data governance efforts

title: SEO Data Analyst
description: We value inclusivity and diversity at Envato. Research shows candidates from neurodiverse and underrepresented backgrounds often only apply for roles if they meet all the criteria. We like to make our hiring decisions based on experience and passion, so if you’re keen to apply and need reasonable adjustments please let us know. We also encourage you to let us know the pronouns you use at any point during the recruitment process. About EnvatoOur focus is on helping people to complete their creative projects, with our author community earning every time that happens. Envato proudly impacts the lives of creatives all over the world, from web developers and graphic designers to marketers, videographers, photographers, and more.We’ve built a community where anyone can get their creative projects done, and where creators bring their ideas to life and in the process, earn a living doing what they love. It doesn’t get much better than that!We are a global and rapidly scaling business. Blending purpose and profit, we're a passionate B Corp , committed to making a positive impact on the communities we engage in . You can read more about our purpose and values here .We’ve embraced flexibility for a long time - where we can, let’s make work, work for you! Our roles can be based ANYWHERE in Mexico and while we all mostly work from home we’re proud of how we keep our global team connected.PurposeThe SEO Analyst will be guided to work on tasks with the goal of gaining and improving organic traffic and engagement while mitigating risks to organic traffic. This will be done as directed by SEOs and by working collaboratively with other SEO team members and within cross functional teams. This role requires a mix of SEO subject matter expertise, the ability to work with data and common sense to understand what might work and what might not. We expect the successful candidate to be able demonstrate sophistication in the use of SEO tools, craftsmanship in data manipulation, consolidation and visualization tools and a solid understanding of how data driven SEO can drive organizations forward.Key Duties & ResponsibilitiesWorking on general SEO tasks such as keyword research, site audits, competitive research or backlink profile auditsWorking with data to measure performance (e.g. monthly reporting) and to build data source prototypes for programmatic SEOConducting SEO experiments. Identifying testing opportunities. Advise follow-up actionsContribute ideas for growing traffic and engagement in line with business success metricsHelp identify demand shifts, trends and underserved customers to turn these into opportunitiesCollaborate with the Content Marketing team to define, prioritize and track performance across content marketing platforms (eg  : blog, information and educational content across several sites)Collaborate with internal stakeholders on ad hoc requestsMaintain up to date understanding of digital landscape and share knowledge with internal teamsAs part of the SEO team, taking ownership of the organic search performance of one or more of Envato’s websitesSkills & Qualifications2+ years experience in SEO, ideally in eCommerce or at a marketplace, good knowledge of data tools used in SEO, digital marketing and eCommerce.Strong analytical capabilities, including good understanding of both eCommerce and Organic Search KPIsMarketing, data or product analyst background or very good hands on experience in large scale data analysis and manipulation (ETL).Strong data querying skills (e.g. SQL) are a must as well as big data tools (e.g. Google bigquery, aws athena)Self starter with experience working with multiple stakeholders to achieve positive resultsInquisitive mindset and willingness to learn and try new thingsExperience with conducting SEO experiments, validating outcomes and recommending next stepsExposure to dashboards and data visualization (e.g. Tableau, Google Data Studio)DesirableUnderstanding of technical aspects of content discovery, crawling, rendering and rankingBasic Python knowledge to run and adjust existing scriptsBasic understanding of current web development technologies and how they might affect organic search performanceExperience in SEO Tools API integrations,SEO processes for content marketing (e.g. KW analysis, content briefs)A bonus would beExperience with aggregator websitesExposure to international SEOExperience in the domain of trading in creative assets or other digital productsExperience in scripted web crawling would be greatHigh level knowledge of other marketing channels’ strategies (social, affiliate, paid).What We OfferCompetitive Salary based on qualifications30 days - Christmas Bonus12 vacation days (from the first year)100% holidays bonusPrivate Health Insurance (SGMM)5% Grocery Coupons (With legal cap)5% Savings Funds (Fondo de Ahorro)Internet/electricity allowance (monthly paid)Profit-share, Mexican entity.Round trip tickets around Mexico to a place you haven’t been twice a year.Unlimited ebooksPaid for educational courses that relate to your workTop line equipmentWhat next?Submit your resume and answers to the below questions. Good luck!About Us We’re BCorp certified & believe in succeeding sustainably as one global team. We’re committed to ensuring all our team feel welcome, included, and respected We support the flexibility to work from anywhere, great benefits above the law, generous parental leave, wellness programs, social connection and learning opportunities to help you grow.Envato is proud to be a 2022 Circle Back Initiative Employer and we commit to respond to every applicant.

The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.  This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks. title: Senior Data Analyst
description: MissionImprovado is committed to empowering the revenue of marketing teams to make business decisions through data simplification. Today, data lives in many different silos and business users need to rely on scarce technical resources in order to get the answers they need to do their job effectively. Improvado is changing that!Product & CompanyImprovado is a modern data stack SaaS company, headquartered in San Francisco, with offices across the globe. We built a no-code revenue data platform centralizing data from hundreds of marketing & sales sources.We are a Series A startup with $30 million raised in investments. We are rapidly scaling and doubling revenue growth every year.Today, we are excited to be partnering with companies like ASUS, Illy, Activision, Adroll, Docker, Hims, OMD, the University of San Francisco, and many others.CultureAt Improvado, we are extremely curious, open, and hard-working. We take great pride in our diverse culture and remote-first approach. We value diversified experiences of opinion and we know that this makes us stronger. We are looking for great people who want to grow and develop fast, personally, and professionally.Responsibilities Deep diving into the customer's business, their marketing tools, data structure, DWHs, etc Researching and testing 3rd-party marketing APIs Custom cases Implementation (SQL) Being an expert in terms of building ETL/ELT pipelines behind Improvado's customers Learning the Improvado product and contributing to its improvement Routine tasks automation and optimization Requirements gathering and writing specs for new data integrationsRequirements 3+ years of experience working as a Data Analyst, Web Analyst, or similar roles in the Marketing Area Strong SQL skills (you can write complex JOINs, window functions, etc) It's dead easy for you to work with 3rd-party APIs (REST/SOAP)Nice To Have Deep knowledge of Marketing Analytics You have worked in a consulting-like organization or digital marketing agency Excellent knowledge of ETL/ELT Concepts You are a BI tools expert (Tableau, Google Data Studio, etc) Experience in working with DBT Python coding skills Ability to write queries through PostmanWhy Improvado?  Remote OK or office in Guadalajara (with flexible working hours) Strong product/market fit: marketing data product for US-based enterprises 20 working days of vacation Mexican holidays and additional days off Ideal time & stage to benefit from companies growth - just got Series A :) Extremely fun & open startup environment Opportunity to receive a sponsorship for courses to keep learning new technologies (in accordance with the duties performed and the necessary growth) Chance to get the company's stock options in the future

title: Remote Data Analyst Jobs
description: A well-established company providing media auditing and audience measurement services for the out-of-home industry is looking for a Data Analyst. Together with the data scientists and teams, the selected candidate will contribute to building the company’s future data analytics business. With nearly a century of business operations, the U.S.-based company is focusing on broadening its historical mission and embracing the digital era. This full-time, long-term position requires at least 4 hours of overlap with EST.Job Responsibilities:Evaluate and assess the quality of external data sources and suggest improvements Manage the company’s audience measurements data suites by supporting the data integrity across all product releases and creating quality reports Analyze and generate insights from historical and real-time data sources Deploy statistical tools or machine learning techniques to identify, analyze, and interpret patterns and trends in complex data setsDesign and build data dashboards and other visualizations to enable operations, marketing, and senior executives to answer complex inquiries and derive actionable insightsWork with data engineers, data scientists, and management teams to identify process improvements Job Requirements:Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)At least 3+ years of relevant experience as a data analyst Extensive experience in Python and R Prolific experience in SQLNice to have experience with Snowflake and SigmaPassionate about data and data visualizationExcellent analytical and problem-solving skillsAbility to work independently and with minimal supervisionFluent in verbal and written English

title: Sr. Business Intelligence Analyst
description: At G-P, our mission is to break down barriers to global business, enabling opportunities for everyone, everywhere. With remote-first and diverse teams all around the world, our people are the key to achieving this mission. That’s why we trust our Dream Team members with the flexibility and autonomy to do their best and most innovative work, encourage and support their personal growth and career development, and believe in recognition for a job well done.The work you’ll be a part of here will have a positive impact on people and their work/life possibilities around the world. Our industry-leading SaaS-based Global Employment Platform™ enables our customers to expand and grow into 180+ countries, creating more opportunities for global success – without requiring entity or subsidiary setup. Beyond the power of our platform, we never forget that behind every hire is a human being. And that brings us to you.Beyond a competitive compensation and benefits package, what we offer to all employees is the clear and simple promise of Opportunity Made Possible. Come expand your skills in new ways and experience the thrill of impacting the way the world works, today and in the future.About the position: A Sr. Business Intelligence Analyst within GP will be leveraging data to spot relevant insights, identify trends and opportunities for the departments of Finance and Operations. Will create visually appealing reports and dashboards that correctly communicate key findings to stakeholders. We are looking for a data driven mind with a passion for analytics. This role will become a key team member on the processes of gathering, understanding and aligning business requirements across the company. What you will do:Gather, understand and align requirements and objectives across the business to then leverage the correct data.Create Dashboards and reports that will bring relevant insights to different types of audiences.Effectively communicate findings across different stakeholders.Suggest, Innovate and propose new ideas that support the team objectives.What we are looking for:5+ years of experience in similar roles.SQL for data retrieving and analysis: Intermediate-Advanced.Tableau for Dashboard and Story Creation: Intermediate-Advanced.Data-Driven Mind.Good communication skills.*Extra: Knowledge of AI and ML.*Extra: Python or Data Robot - IntermediateCV written in English is a plus as this position reports to or works closely with English speakersAbout UsG-P helps growing companies unlock their full potential by making it possible to build highly skilled global teams in days instead of months. Through our SaaS-based platform, we help find, hire, onboard, pay, and manage team members, quickly and compliantly, to expand growth opportunities for everyone, everywhere – without the hassle of setting up local subsidiaries or branch offices.  G-P. Global Made Possible.Globalization Partners is a proud Equal Opportunity Employer, and we are committed to building and maintaining a diverse, equitable and inclusive culture that celebrates authenticity. We prohibit discrimination and harassment against employees or applicants on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, and pregnancy-related conditions), gender identity or expression (including transgender status), sexual orientation, marital status, military service and veteran status, physical or mental disability, genetic information, or any other legally protected status.Globalization Partners also is committed to providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need an accommodation due to a disability during the interview process, please contact us at people@globalization-partners.com.

title: Remote Data Analyst Jobs
description: A US-based member-only company that supplies superior quality natural and organic food products is looking for a Data Analyst. The selected candidate will be taking ownership of the company's merchandising analysis and providing in-depth insights on how to improve the user experience and member engagement. The company is bringing the benefits of healthy and fresh eating to the customer’s doorsteps with the click of a few buttons. They have managed to successfully raise $200mn+ in funding so far. This role requires 6-8+ hours of overlap with the PST time zone.Job Responsibilities:Assist Product Management, Data Science, Marketing, and Technology teams to gather, manipulate, evaluate, and documenting new, complex data and sharing cohesive data stories Drive member acquisition growth through sponsored social marketing platformsUse the scientific method to create A/B tests and MVA experiments, encompassing ad creatives, targeting tactics, and onsite experiences, among other thingsMonitor key performance indicators, offer data-driven recommendations, and lobby for the internal resources needed to keep member growth goingDeliver ideas and insights based on both competitive and online analyticsDefine critical success criteria and establish data-driven and prioritized roadmaps to produce solutions to break down unclear situationsCollaborate with internal stakeholders in business development, product development, design, and engineering to develop and implement the most innovative growth ideasGather, manipulate, analyze, and document raw, complicated data, and then present coherent data stories to business and technical audiencesDevelop a thorough grasp of user activity patterns and insights, as well as the relationship between engagement measures and conversion rates, customer lifetime value, and financial successCreate dashboards, visualizations, and detailed datasets to give meaningful merchandising, category activity, and profit potential insights.Serve as a tactical liaison with Product Management teams to give the most accurate and timely information possible that'll help drive business decisionsJob Requirements:Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)At least 4+ years of relevant experience as a marketing data analystDemonstrable experience working with SQL, Python/R, Tableau, Looker, and DomoNice to have some experience with Google Analytics, Amplitude, or Mixpanel Prior experience with A/B testing, cohort analysis, conversion optimization, and customer segmentation is desirableGood leadership abilities, a positive attitude, and an active / self-starter mindset Enthusiasm for turning data into insights and helping others uncover the power of their dataHelp develop a healthy team environment by being a team player with character, humility, and honestyAbility to communicate data stories to business and technical audiences in a clear and concise mannerProficiency and solid foundation in statistics

title: Senior Data Analyst, Growth
description: We believe in a world where homes are owned by regular people. Our mission is to provide authentic belonging experiences, empowering residents to become homeowners and homeowners to be financially free.Belong is changing what it means to rent a home by putting people first. It’s where hospitality meets consumer real estate—and it’s about to redefine an entire industry. We’re backed by Andreessen Horowitz (a16z), GGV Capital, Battery Ventures, and Fifth Wall just to name some of our all-star investors.We are looking for a Senior Product Analyst who will play a key role in growing our core products for homeowners and residents across several markets. The Senior Product Analyst is a role embedded within the product and engineering teams and is responsible for driving growth and strategic improvements through the end-to-end product development cycle. We are looking for someone with quantitative skills combined with strong business acumen and product sense as well as cross-functional collaboration skills.Responsibilities Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining of structured and unstructured data to extract key insights that drive strategic product and business decisions for BelongAbility to effectively present the data in a way that helps the company see and understand key insights into how our consumers interact with our ecosystem of productsIdentify growth opportunities that remove barriers to product adoption, engagement, retention, and monetization.Understand funnels, two-sided marketplace flywheels, multi-product ecosystems, and end-to-end consumer behaviors to shed light on the historical and future adoption of our products.Own, define, analyze and monitor metrics that help inform the health and success of Belong products in all markets we serve.Own, design, interpret and communicate A/B experiment results to product and stakeholder teams.Partner with cross-functional teams in product, business, and engineering teams on projects that identify new opportunities and help accelerate the growth and adoption of all products Influence teams across the company through the presentation of data-driven recommendations Demonstrate ability to switch between tactical execution and high-level strategyRequired QualificationsBS or MS degree in a technical discipline like Math, Statistics, Economics, Operations Research, or other relevant technical fields.4+ years of experience in a data analytics or data science role in an analytical, business strategy, marketing, or engineering organization.4+ years of experience with data querying and manipulation using SQL, Python, or R.Experience with design and running experiments Strong communication and presentation skills.Self-starter, comfortable with ambiguity, experience initiating and driving projects with minimal oversight and guidance.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Data Engineer
description: We have an open position for Data Engineers!What you need to know:· Require at least 4+ years of experience with Java, Hadoop/Pyspark and SQL· Conversational English Level· Nice to Have: AWSWhat you look in you:· Track record of proactively establishing and following through on commitments· Blend of consumer insights, competitive intelligence, and technical knowledge· Demonstrated use of analytics, metrics, and benchmarking to drive decisions· Excellent interpersonal, organizational, creative, and communications skills· Team player in driving growth results combined with a positive attitude· Strong work ethic and strong core values (honesty, integrity, creativity)· Problem solver who never stops thinking about ways to improve· Self-motivated, results-driven, and team-oriented leader· Killer consumer instincts and data sensibilities· Demonstrated success in previous rolesLearn more about Wipro at www.wipro.com/about-us/We are Wipro, a leading global information technology, consulting and business process Services Company. We harness the power of cognitive computing, hyper-automation, robotics, cloud, analytics and emerging technologies to help our clients adapt to the digital world and make them successful.Our #wiproites have:Full-time contract, 100% payroll salary30 days BonusVacations according to Mexican law, 6 days after the first year of service, which are increased 2 days for each year of service.We provide you with major medical expenses insurance which covers you and your dependents, including dental and visual plan.Life insurance for you, 12 base salaries in case of natural death and 24 in case of accidental death.We have an Employee Assistance Program where medical, psychological and nutritional help is offered 24/7 by telephoneWe have Pantry Vouchers of $1400 MXN per monthBirth assistance, from 10 months as an employee, help of $25,000.00MXN is offered in case of natural birth, and $32,000.00 MXN in case of cesarean sectionSupport to the newborn of $ 4000 MXNWe also give a Bonus per quarter based on performance, which apart from being an economic incentive, helps you get promotions if your performance exceeds expectations.We have courses and certifications online totally free through our platforms such as (AIDEMI) Udemy where you can learn a variety of courses, from technology to hobbies and languages.

title: Data Cloud Engineer
description: ¡ATRÉVETE A SER PARTE DEL DESAFÍO! ¡VEN Y ÚNETE A NUESTRO EQUIPO JUNTOS PODEMOS MARCAR LA DIFERENCIA!¿Sabías que Accenture está liderando la transformación digital en el mundo?Accenture es una empresa líder mundial de servicios profesionales, que ofrece una amplia gama de servicios y soluciones en estrategia, consultoría, digital, tecnología y operaciones. Nuestro principal propósito es colaborar con nuestros clientes, para que puedan convertirse en negocios de alto rendimiento. Accenture está presente en más de 200 oficinas, 120 ciudades, 56 países y aproximadamente 390.000 empleados en todo el mundo.Oferta· Desarrollo profesional de acuerdo a tu perfil e intereses.· Trabaja en una de las mejores empresas.· Uso de metodologías y herramientas innovadoras.· Contacto directo con expertos de todo el mundo.· Capacitaciones constantes.· Ambiente de trabajo en equipo y colaboración.· Participación en Proyectos Internacionales.SkillsAmplio dominio del framework Spark (EXCLUYENTE)Conocimiento de ecosistema Cloudera - HUE, HDFS, Hive, Impala, Oozie, HBaseperationsDominio de Unit Test y Scala StyleConocimiento en procesos ETL.Conocimiento avanzado de Git, Jenkins, Sonar, Veracode, noSQLAccenture no discrimina por motivos de raza, religión, color, sexo, edad, discapacidad, nacionalidad, orientación sexual, identidad o expresión de género, ni por ninguna otra razón cubierta por la legislación local.Oportunidad Laboral Equitativa Todas las decisiones del empleador deben tomarse sin tomar en cuenta la edad, raza, creencias, color, religión, sexo, nacionalidad de origen, discapacidades, orientación sexual, identidad o expresión de género, información genética, estado civil, estado de ciudadanía u otra base protegida por la federación, estado, o leyes locales. Los candidatos no estarán obligados a revelar registros sellados o cancelados de condena o arresto como parte del proceso de contratación. Accenture se compromete a proporcionar oportunidades de empleo para veteranos a nuestros hombres y mujeres de servicio.

title: Digital Analyst
description: About Brillio:Brillio delivers disruptive digital solutions across capabilities such as Design Thinking, Product Engineering, Data Analytics, Digital Front Office, Digital Infrastructure through a team of 4,000+ experts technologically elevating 200 companies globally. Our core values of Customer success, We Care, Entrepreneurial (mindset) and Excellence - drive everything that we do, from the very first day. Find your passion and build your career with Brillio.Location: Mexico RemoteThe Opportunity: -The role is an individual contributor who must have extensive knowledge in product analytics-This role has the responsibility for doing exploratory analysis and put together insightful narratives about customer behavior. Analysis could range from operations, marketing, digital product, and executive-level reporting.Selected candidate will be required to:-The analyst we are looking for is hungry to find answers that drive the business day today.-An ever-present curiosity drives this analyst to search for insights in the data to add more context to their analysis and find that impact a business reaching millions of customers.-Having the ability to present to varied audiences and help the business digest and action on the data is a must.To succeed, this role’s responsibilities would involve:Must have Technical Skills:-Advanced English (being able to write, listen and communicate fluently).-5 years of relevant experience.-Strong quantitative background (statistics, computer science).-Expert knowledge of clickstream digital analytics tools (Specifically Adobe/Google Analytics).-Understanding of and experience with writing queries to obtain and blend needed data (SQL).-Experience using Alteryx or another data blending tool.-Experience working directly with clients in an agency setting.-Experience presenting data analysis with strong storytelling capabilities.Nice to have Technical Skills:-Understanding of and expertise with visualizing data (Power BI, Tableau, Looker, Domo).-Understanding of and expertise with data transformation/automation tools (Python).Soft Skills:-Team player with experience of working with distributed and global teams.-Excellent communication skills with the ability to articulate and present complex information concisely to both technical and non-technical audiences.-Analytical and critical thinking skills, prepared to challenge conventional thinking.Know what it’s like to work and grow at Brillio: https://www.brillio.com/join-us/Know more society and does not discriminate on the grounds of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other basis as protected by applicable law.

title: Data Analytics Engineer
description: MonJa’s data science team uses credit and other financial data to produce actionable insights for its clients.  We are looking for a Data Analytics Engineer to join us! You will be responsible for developing and maintaining MonJa’s proprietary financial data analytics platform. Your work will include orchestrating our workflow automation software; maintaining and supporting our monthly financial reporting processes; responding to client inquiries and requests; and working closely with other internal team members and clients to find new ways to unlock the power of data. Job RequirementsStrong experience in numeric programming using PythonExtensive expertise in SQLExperience in ETL and orchestration technologies such as Apache AirflowFamiliarity with cloud environments (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)Experience with remote working in a team environmentUnderstanding of or willingness to learn quickly about industry nomenclature, the financial investment process, and assessment of client needs and pain-pointsThe ability to tackle new, complex challenges is necessary and therefore requires that candidates can acquire new skills quicklyProficient in English written and verbal communication in a professional settingAbout MonJaMonJa is a US-headquartered FinTech company that creates automation and decisioning technologies for financial services, as well as credit analytics and order management systems for consumer and business loans. The platform combines automated underwriting, an AI-powered risk algorithm and loan scoring functionality to create an end-to-end lending management solution for small business loans. We are looking for like-minded individuals to join our team to scale automation in financial services. Job Type: Full Time, RemoteEmployment Type: Full Time*Please submit your resume in English*

title: Sr. Data Analyst (Strategic Finance and Executive Reporting)
description: Location (Remote): Canada, Mexico, United StatesAbout DockerDocker is a remote first company with employees across Europe and the Americas that simplifies the lives of developers who are making world-changing apps. We raised our Series C funding in March 2022 for $105M at a $2.1B valuation. We saw a 4x year-over-year ARR growth last year and continue to grow! Join us for a whale of a ride!About The RoleReporting to the FP&A leader, the Sr. Data Analyst will be responsible for building, interpreting and auditing KPIs and dashboards to deliver real-time visibility into and measurability of corporate level business performance for our executive and extended leadership teams. Working with stakeholders across virtually every business function, the Sr. Data Analyst will contribute to driving a cohesive view of the key leading and lagging indicators of business value, leverage data to improve predictions and forecasts, assess performance relative to targets and scale our reporting and analytics capabilities to the next level.This is a strategic, high-impact role that will help shape the future of Docker’s growth by providing analytics and insights to grow recurring revenue, improve unit economics and influence key decisions across the business.In addition to being a core member of the Finance team, this role will be a key contributor to the centralized Business Insights team, owning the financial requirements and roadmap to scale Docker’s data infrastructure and sources of truth for critical business metrics and insights.Responsibilities:Maintain and enhance reports and dashboards to provide visibility into business and operational performance, including daily/weekly/monthly/quarterly executive-level business performance scorecardsWork closely with the centralized Business Insights & Operations teams, Data Engineering, data analysts and other stakeholders across the company to document and drive the Finance, executive reporting and analytics requirements and roadmap Drive SaaS metrics standardization, real-time visibility and regular audits of metrics and dashboards including ARR growth accounting and customer segmentation, cohort analysis, retention rates, funnel analysis and conversion rates etc.Collaborate with extended stakeholders across the business to improve accuracy and concerns with the data and provide recommendations to improve existing processesDeliver insights and narrative-driven analysis on business performanceQualifications:Minimum 3 years experience supporting SaaS businesses in an analytical roleExpert knowledge of SaaS business models and financial acumenRelevant experience in Analytics, Data Science, Investment Banking, Consulting, Strategic Finance or Business OperationsStrong proficiency in data modeling & SQL required. Experience with Python and/or R a bonusStrong proficiency in leveraging data visualization tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau, Power BI) requiredStrong communication skills with the ability to influence in a fast-paced, cross-functional environmentProven ability to translate insights into action, working with large data sets, translating business drivers into financial forecasts and distilling key learnings to drive strategic planning and initiativesExcellent written and verbal communication and requirement gathering skills. Expert documentation practices are a must.Highly organized and effective planning and prioritizing skills; able to adapt and succeed in ambiguous situations with changing business requirementsExpectations (30/90/1 year)30 day:Onboard and meet the Finance & BizOps teams, attend team meetings and start building a mental model of Docker’s business model current business/analytics opportunitiesGet up to speed on our data stack, pipelines and data/financial models, dashboards and key metrics90 day:Take full ownership of existing Strategic Finance reporting deliverables Deliver the “next-generation” of our weekly executive reporting scorecardDrive and deliver mission-critical financial data & analytics roadmap items and ad-hoc projects/analysisRecommend opportunities for continuous improvement across the Strategic Finance, BizOps and broader Data teams at Docker1 year:Play a pivotal role in Docker’s future growth, building the foundation to enable world-class strategic analytics and business insights as we scale. The true opportunity of this role goes beyond just what you’ll solve for at Docker, we are leveraging the modern data stack to prescribe world-class solutions for the financial analytics challenges all high-growth software companies are facing.Perks:Freedom & flexibility; fit your work around your lifeVariety of virtual and in-person social events to build connections and have funHome office setup; we want you comfortable while you workGenerous maternity and parental leaveTechnology stipend equivalent to $100 net/monthPTO plan that encourages you to take time to do the things you enjoyWhaleness Days: companywide day off each monthQuarterly, company-wide hackathonsTraining stipend for conferences, courses and classesStock Options; we are a growing start-up and want all employees to have a share in the success of the companyDocker SwagMedical benefits, retirement and holidays vary by countryDocker embraces diversity and equal opportunity. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We believe the more inclusive we are, the better our company will be.Due to the remote nature of this role, we are unable to provide visa sponsorship.

title: Senior BI Analyst
description: EPAM is a leading global provider of digital platform engineering and development services. We are committed to having a positive impact on our customers, our employees, and our communities. We embrace a dynamic and inclusive culture. Here you will collaborate with multi-national teams, contribute to a myriad of innovative projects that deliver the most creative and cutting-edge solutions, and have an opportunity to continuously learn and grow. We are looking for a Senior BI Analyst!DescriptionWe are looking for a talented BI Analysts to extend our team of professionals who can help our customers achieving their digital transformation through data in variety of industries. We are passionate about delivering value from data and are searching for people with the same mindset to join our team!What you’ll doPlan and execute elicitation/discovery activities to engage both business and IT stakeholders.Design and drive stakeholder workshops/interviews to define and prioritize their business needs.Translate business needs into requirements and work with delivery team through the entire project lifecycle (overseeing developments and acting as a Product Owner / Business Analyst )Perform data discovery, data assessment, data profiling.Prototype business needs and validate prototypes with business stakeholder before sending to mass production using mockuping / prototyping / data visualization tools.Conduct Sprint review sessions or UAT with customer stakeholders.Work in collaboration with customer stakeholders / delivery management / technical leads in design phase of the data products that should address the business needs.Prepare post-development / post-production materials to support stakeholders in increasing adoption of deliverables (e.g., trainings / training materials / marketing materials).What you have3+ years experience in working in data domain on data and analytical projects.3+ years experience in working with requirements on BI / Data / Analytical projects (gathering, presenting, estimating, prioritizing, etc.).Good ability translate business needs into data requirements (incl. proficiency in validating and visualizing data requirements to customer).Experience in end-to-end data and analytics project delivery as part of the team (for example data visualization / reporting / BI, advanced analytics solutions) utilizing Agile and waterfall app.Ability to use modern data visualization tools for visualizing and prototyping business needsExperience in working with data profiling, data discover tools, using industry best practices.Ability to take ownership for the end-result, and to help developers to get there.Good understanding of Proof of Concept / Minimum Viable Product / Minimum Loveable Product terms.Excellent communication skills. Ability to manage customer expectations, present and explain project deliverables to senior stakeholders onsite and offsite . Ability to work individually or in team environment without supervision.Experience in working with business and IT stakeholders, as well as end-users.Knowledge of the data and analytics landscape and recent trends.Nice to haveExperience in prototyping data solutions.Industry expertise (Finance / Insurance / Oil and Gas / Supply Chain / Marketing).Experience in acting as Product Owner / Data Product Owner roles on analytical projectsHands-on experience with one or more wireframing, prototyping tools (e.g., using Figma).Development expertise building data visualizations using Tableau / Power BI / any modern data visualization tool.Experience running on-site customer workshops.Experience in working with data on cloud on major cloud providers (Azure, AWS, GCP).Math/numerical background with good analytical mindset with, knowledge and understanding of basic data analysis and visualization concepts, understanding of hypothesis testing, data mining, clustering, regression.WE OFFERCareer plan and real growth opportunitiesUnlimited access to LinkedIn learning solutionsInternational Mobility Plan within 25 countriesConstant training, mentoring, online corporate courses, eLearning and moreEnglish classes with a certified teacherSupport for employee’s initiatives (Algorithms club, toastmasters, agile club and more)Enjoyable working environment (Gaming room, napping area, amenities, events, sport teams and more.)Flexible work schedule and dress codeCollaborate in a multicultural environment and share best practices from around the globeHired directly by EPAM & 100% under payrollLaw benefits (IMSS, INFONAVIT, 25% vacation bonus)Major medical expenses insurance: Life, Major medical expenses with dental & visual coverage. (For the employee and direct family members)13 % employee savings fund, capped to the law limitGrocery coupons12 vacations days plus 4 floating daysOfficial Mexican holidays, plus two extra holidays (December 24th & 31st)Relocation bonus: transportation, 2 weeks of accommodation for you and your family and more30 days of salary End of Year bonusMonthly non-taxable amount for the electricity and internet bills

title: SAP Data Engineer
description: Job SummaryThis position is responsible for the administration of our Master Data tools and workflows and for writing queries and alerts that bring transparency into data quality.Ways of the Carhartt LeaderWe are all leaders at Carhartt. Some of us are asked to lead from day one, others one day. We are all given a seat at the table.Lead Self:· Be Dependable: trusted and reliable to do the right thing, treating others with dignity and respect.· Be resilient: learning from failure and acting boldly to set and adjust priorities.· Be authentic: aware of strengths and weaknesses and always working to improve, valuing the contributions everyone brings.Lead Others:· Empower Others: while goals are clear, we are flexible about the path to get there and create a map for the future.· Grow Together: maximize individual strengths to achieve our objectives, establishing open and effective lines title: Associate Data Engineering Analyst
description: Ready to be a Titan?Play a pivotal role as our Data expert! As a Data Engineer Analyst you will be part of the engineering team at ServiceTitan to help improve our products and build new ones. This is an exciting role for an engineer analyst to come in and contribute in major feature development in the rapidly growing startup. We build for perfection, use the most modern tools, have an amazing culture, and love to solve complex problems. If you share the same values, you might find yourself in a perfect company.What You'll Do:Analyze, Translate business requirements into data requirements by conducting complex data analysis, organization, and combining raw information from different sources.Improve Quality, Explore ways to enhance data quality and reliability. Improve the quality and accuracy of the information, enabling businesses to make more responsible business decisions.Design, Collaborate with data architects and scientists on several projects to apply data to a company’s business needs What You'll Bring:At least 3-5 years of Data experienceMust be able to work in a fast-paced, agile work environmentMust be able to analyze & organize data structures and datasetsMust be able to profile the datasets, and data objects, ability to query & determine data granularity, document the specs, data types, lineage Must be able to perform expert-level data validation, source-to-target mappings, kpi calculation through SQL based on the logic provided, sql joins, and data cleansingMust be able to profile the data for structure profiling, relationships & contentStrong SQL writing/ reading experience. Must be able to infer SQL to plain logic & vice versaMust be able to work with complex & large SQL to extract fields & logicFamiliarity with data modeling, ability to edit tables/areas in the diagram, import/ export SQL to though the data modeling toolsFamiliarity with cloud-based database tools like Snowflake/ Redshift/ Azure ecosystem - ( not a must-have ) Traditional oracle/ SQL server experience is good tooBe Human With Us:Being human isn’t about checking every box on a list. It’s about the experiences we have, people we meet, and the perspectives we share. So, if you have the skills but are hesitant to apply because of your background, apply anyway. We need amazing people like you to help us challenge the conventional and think differently about the problems that we’re solving. We’re in this together. Come be human, with us.What We Offer:When you join our team, you’re not just accepting a job. You’re making a career move. Here’s how we’ll support you in doing some of the most impactful work of your career:Flextime, recognition, and support for autonomous work: Flexible time off with ample learning and development opportunities to continue growing your career. We offer a comprehensive onboarding program, leadership training for Titans at all levels, and other programs and events. Great work is rewarded through Bonusly, peer-nominated awards, and more. Holistic health and wellness benefits: Company-paid medical, dental, and vision (with 100% employer paid options and 90% coverage for dependents), FSA and HSA, 401k match, and telehealth options including memberships to Headspace, Galileo, One Medical, Ginger and more. Support for Titans at all stages of life: Parental leave and support, up to $20k in adoption reimbursement, on demand maternity support through Maven Maternity, free breast milk shipping through Maven Milk, pet insurance, legal advisory services, financial planning tools, and more.At ServiceTitan, we celebrate individuality and uniqueness. We believe that the convergence of fresh perspectives and experiences from all walks of life is what makes our product and culture so great. We strongly encourage people from underrepresented groups to apply. We do not discriminate against employees based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity or expression, age, disability, pregnancy (including childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical condition), genetic information, protected military or veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.

and confidence “story telling” using visual representations of data both collected and analyzedExceptional project and time management skillsBeing detail-oriented, comfortable with repetitive tasks, great people. title: Data Analyst
description: We’re looking for a talented Data Analyst to help us change the world of digital advertising together!WHO WE ARESeedtag is the leading Contextual Advertising Platform. Our proprietary, machine learning-based technology provides human-like understanding of the content in the web, the highest level of brand safety in the industry and unmatched cookieless targeting capabilities.We engage with the market on both demand and supply side to create, activate and launch high-quality advertising campaigns at scale. We are committed to creating a more beautiful, respectful and engaging way to do advertising.KEY FIGURES2014 · Founded by two ex-Googlers2018 · 16M total turnover & Internationalization & Getting growth2021 · Fundraising round of 40M€ & +11 countries & +260 Seedtaggers2022 · Fundraising round of 250M€ + expansion into the U.S market YOUR CHALLENGEYou will propose new analysis to get the most out of our current data and define what additional data will be needed to improve our current Contextual UnderstandingYour data visualization skills will be key to grasp the attention of the public and transmit complex information into simple explanationsYou will get full ownership of our contextual data to offer insights and communication strategies to our most relevant clientsYou will present your results internally and externally, co-creating contextual strategies with big clients (from Nissan to Coca-Cola, Heineken, Tag Heuer, etc.)You will help us build contextual tools that would allow the democratization of data inside the company: from sales, to marketing, to operations, the different teams should be using contextual data in their day-to-daySome experience building extract, transform, load (ETL) data pipelines will be needed here.You will analyze performance of our current Contextual products and actively proposing improvements together with the Product TeamFinally, you will build a strong knowledge of the ecosystem and sector to develop a strong instinct of how to improve our products and positioning. Creativity here will also be a must!During all these tasks, you will be using the latest technologies developed by our Machine Learning Engineers: amazing NLP and CV models to get the most out of massive amounts of data!YOU WILL SUCCEED IN THIS ROLE IFYou have a relevant degree in engineering, mathematics, statistics or an analytics related fieldYou have between 1 and 3 years of work experience in Data Analysis or a related fieldYou are proficient in SQL and Python: data treatment and data visualizations are a mustYou have an analytical mind capable of structuring complex problems into simple, iterative, solutionsYou have full proficiency in Spanish and EnglishYou are energetic, proactive and eager to work in a dynamic environmentYou are a real team player with good communication and cooperation skillsYou have proven ability to work in a fast-paced, informal, dynamic and exigent environmentYou like to have fun while working and don’t take yourself too serious!It would be a big plus if youHave previous experience in a startup or have a background in consultingHave previous experience in presenting and communicating data analysis results and insights to external stakeholdersSEEDTAG PERKS🚀 Key moment to join Seedtag in terms of growth and opportunities💯 One Seedtag: Work for a month from any of our open offices with travel and stay paid if you’re a top performer (think of Brazil, NY..., 🏖️)⌛ Flexible schedule to balance work and personal life🇬🇧 Optional company-paid English courses.📚 Access to learning opportunities (learning & development budget)🍻 We love what we do, but we also love having fun. We have many team activities you can join and enjoy with your colleagues! A Yearly offsite with all the company, team offsites, and Christmas events.🏋 GympassBENEFITS OF WORKING AT SEEDTAGGrowth: International, highly demanding work environment in one of the fastest growing AdTech companies in Europe. We reject "that’s the way it’s always been done". In Seedtag you can find an energetic, fresh workplace, multicultural work environment where our members are from different countries in Europe, LATAM, US and so many more!Impact: The chance to have a direct impact, here you don't work for the sake of working, we all have an impact on seedtag in our own way, rowing in the same direction.Diversity of methodology and people: Seedtag DNA is unique and highly appreciated by very different types of Seedtagers. We embrace diversity and encourage everyone to seek the best version of themselves and to show who they really are. With a total flexible methodology.Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you, you can work from home, the beach or the office. The important thing is to work on your goals.Are you ready to join the SEEDTAG adventure? Then send us your CV!

title: Data Analyst
description: En Wunderman Thompson inspiramos el crecimiento de marcas ambiciosas; el talento que lo hace posible es el que queremos atraer, tener y hacer crecer > ¡Tu!Somos una agencia creativa que combina creatividad, consultoría y tecnología, ofreciendo alternativas end-to-end en una escala global llevando inspiración a través de la marca y la experiencia del consumidor para presentar resultados extraordinarios.Somos más de 20,000 expertos en 90 mercados alrededor del mundo; nuestro talento reúne narrativa creativa, perspectivas diversas, pensamiento inclusivo y capacidades verticales altamente especializadas que conducen al crecimiento de nuestros clientes. Ofrecemos una amplia experiencia a través del ciclo entero del consumidor, incluyendo comunicaciones, comercio, consultoría, CRM, CX, Data, Producción y TecnologíaQueremos conocer a nuestro próximo: Data Analyst Responsabilidades:- Liderar el modelo de madurez y evolución de la estrategia de medición.- Definir el modelo de datos para la cuenta, acorde a las políticas establecidas- Controlar end-to-end las herramientas de tagging y analítica sin mayores implementaciones de código fuente (programación)- Asegurar el cumplimiento del Best Practice en gestión de datos · Soporte en temas de analítica basado en Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager y Google Looker Studio- Reportes de analítica con entendimiento más allá de los números; aprendizajes y propuestas de optimización- Entendimiento de estrategias de adquisición, comportamiento y conversión; y audiencias- Seguimiento y representación visual de user journey y embudos de conversión; y reportes de embudos multi-canal- Sistematizar acciones de tagueo, reporting y parámetrización- Tagueo de campañas con base en una convención de nomenclaturas- Identificar objetivos de negocio y traducirlos en tags para su medición- Implementación de pixeles, scripts, tags- Configuración de eventos, objetivos y conversiones personalizadas para Facebook, Twitter, Google Ads y Google Analytics- Creación de dashboards, setup y mantenimiento- Configuración de GTM- Proponer accionables de gran impacto para las actividades de marketing- Ayudar a definir el alcance de las ideas en la estrategia de medición y clarificar casos de uso- Participar activamente en los procesos- Participar en reuniones con cliente y tercerosHard Skills:Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager y Google Looker StudioEn Wunderman Thompson estamos comprometidos activamente con la construcción de un espacio de trabajo inclusivo, equitativo y diverso donde todas las personas se sientan bienvenidas, valoradas y escuchadas y sean tratadas con dignidad y respeto.En Grupo Wunderman Thompson no se discrimina por motivos de raza, religión, orientación sexual, identidad de género, condición física o socio económica ni por ningún otro motivo.Como líderes y socios creativos dentro de la industria es nuestra responsabilidad cultivar un entorno que refleje nuestro más grande activo: nuestra gente. Creemos que este compromiso inspira el crecimiento y ofrece resultados equitativos para nuestro equipo, nuestros clientes y comunidades a las que servimos.Wunderman Thompson es una agencia de WPP. Para más información, por favor visita nuestro sitio web y síguenos en nuestras redes sociales Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn e Instagram.Confiamos en el interés legítimo como base legal para procesar información personal bajo el GDPR con fines de contratación y solicitudes de empleo.

title: SQL Data Analyst

This role will need to have the ability to interpret results using simple data aggregation and statistical analysis to complex data mining. This position will also be responsible for data quality, expanding reporting access and providing training to an ever-growing population of users.  ResponsibilitiesUnderstand the day-to-day issues that our business faces, which can be better understood with dataCompile and analyze data related to business issuesDevelop clear visualizations to convey complicated data in a straightforward fashionInteract with end users (HR and other departments) to understand business issues and provide advice about data that are available to support the business.Develop simple to complex HR reports and dashboards using data from multiple HR data sources.Perform complex data manipulation and aggregation of data from multiple HR data sources.Design and develops dashboards to answer relevant business questions and communicate report data in a concise and easy to understand format.Integrate disparate data from multiple systems and tools.Create and manage interfaces to/from HR systems. QualificationsBachelor's or Master's degree related 2 years' Data Analysis experience2 years of proficiency in SQLAdvanced EnglishHR Technology is a plus We offer:Competitive SalaryBenefits of law and aboveHybrid Scheme

title: Supply Chain Data Analyst

title: Data Analyst Frubana Capital
description: ¡Frubana es una Scale-Up B2B de tecnología de rápido crecimiento que está revolucionando el mundo de los alimentos y el sector restaurantero en LatAm! 🚀Nuestro objetivo es que la comida en LatAm sea más accesible a través de una cadena de suministro eficiente y digitalizada, y de un producto (App) y experiencia de cliente innovadora. Actualmente operamos en México (CDMX, Puebla, Guadalajara), Brasil (São Paulo, Belo Horizonte) y Colombia (Bogotá, Barranquilla, Medellín), conectando al campo y a diferentes proveedores con la ciudad. Servimos a +60.000 clientes en LatAm; crecemos a una tasa de +15% mensual. 🥑🍍🍅Hacemos parte de Y Combinator, la misma aceleradora de AirBnB, Dropbox y Rappi. Adicionalmente contamos con una de las bases de inversionistas más sólidas del mundo: Monashees, GGV, Softbank, Tiger Global, Lightspeed, entre otros.¡Únete a nuestro equipo! ⚡This role is specific to a new business: Frubana Capital, our financial inclusion arm. Our clients struggle with access to credit and with being good at managing cash. We want to change that. We are currently focused on building a seamless experience for restaurants to access the financial sector by embedding financing and payment solutions into our platform.As Data Analyst, your mission is to help us understand, build and automate FruCap’s operations, and inform our strategy. If you have an analytical mind, an entrepreneurial mindset and like to see the impact of your work, this role is for you .The type of questions you will be looking to answer in your day-to-day work: How do we create an easy way for clients to manage their working capital and build a healthy credit score? How do we get a restaurant to adopt digital payment methods?What will you do?Challenge yourself every day, thinking and building innovative solutions to encourage our customers to buy more and more product categories at FrubanaDevelop the ability to generate data-driven insights, detect opportunities and turn them into concrete business actions that drive Frubana's growth - you will be a key part of the company's growth engine!Constantly experiment - you will design and implement pilots to test new ideas to help our customers discover Frubana's product catalogAdapt to change in a dynamic work environment where you will live the adrenaline of driving Frubana's metrics and resultsRequirements...Good command of Google Suite and Google Sheets (is a must)Some knowledge of SQL and database queries. If you don’t, no problem. We can teach you if you are committed to learningAutonomy and flexibility to execute tasks and projectsAbility to execute fast, and with attention to detailAgile and hands-on problem-solving mindsetExcellent numerical and analytical skills, as well as communication skillsEnglish and Portuguese are a plusTe invitamos a navegar en:Nuestra plataforma: https://www.frubana.com/Nuestro Career Site: https://jobs.frubana.com/Conoce algunas noticias sobre Frubana:https://forbes.co/2021/06/01/actualidad/frubana-levanta-us65-millones-tras-triplicar-sus-ventas-abasteciendo-restaurantes/https://www.forbes.com/sites/rebeccaszkutak/2021/06/01/restaurant-tech-startup-frubana-was-able-to-triple-its-sales-during-the-pandemic/https://www.portafolio.co/negocios/emprendimiento/frubana-el-emprendimiento-quiere-expandir-su-negocio-a-america-latina-552736https://www.fastcompany.com/90600367/latin-america-most-innovative-companies-2021https://news.crunchbase.com/news/pivots-and-persistence-how-startups-in-latin-america-are-finding-ways-to-survive-the-current-crisis/https://forbes.co/2020/04/17/emprendedores/frubana-recauda-us25-millones-para-su-plataforma-agro/

title: Data Analyst
description: Autoliv’s global Business Intelligence, Data Analytics team and Integration team is looking for a Data Modeler to help grow our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for conducting full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities, and design. This position will also develop analysis and reporting requirements and capabilities. They will work directly with business stakeholders to translate business requirements into data models that can be delivered to a development team for creation.What You’ll DoCreate and maintain data mapping documentation for Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) Create and maintain entity relationship diagrams to visualize the business relationships within the data (the model).Create and maintain conceptual-level data dictionary information.Work closely with the Autoliv business partners who use PowerBI and other tools to analyze data coming from the EDW Marts.Create and maintain Business Information Models (BIM’s)Gather Data Dictionaries and Metadata from Source System and Business partners.What Is RequiredA Bachelor's Degree in Computer Sciences, Mathematics, Information Systems or equivalent.Fluent conversational English.Working knowledge of Data as it is used for Analytical purposesBasic SQL SkillsNew graduates with the basic knowledge mentioned are welcome.What’s In It For YouAttractive compensation packageRecognition awards, company events, family events, university discount options and many more perks.Gender Pay EqualityAutoliv is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. title: Master Data Analyst
description: Kerry es la compañía líder mundial en sabor y nutrición para las industrias de alimentos, bebidas y farmacéutica. Todos los días nos asociamos con los clientes para crear productos más saludables, más sabrosos y más sostenibles que consumen miles de millones de personas en todo el mundo. Nuestra visión es ser el socio más valioso de nuestros clientes, creando un mundo de nutrición sostenible. Una carrera en Kerry le ofrece la oportunidad de dar forma al futuro de la comida mientras le brinda oportunidades para explorar y crecer en un entorno verdaderamente global.Acerca del rol:Nuestro Master data Management estará en el pilar de materiales y productos para Latinoamérica, siendo guardían de la información, revisando datos, aprobaciones de creaciones y extensiones de materiales y productos que estén correctos y válidos y actualizados en sistema.Responsable de las actividades diarias de administración de los datos como las siguientes:Realizar solicitudes de datos maestros de productos y clientes.Responsable de definir los Procedimientos Operativos Estándar (SOP) y las Instrucciones de Trabajo.Responsable de garantizar la precisión y la integridad de los datos maestros de productos y clientesResponsable de comprender los procesos integrales para mantener los clientes, datos y productos en todas las áreas comercialesResponsable de la armonización de datos a través de múltiples fuentesTrabajar en estrecha colaboración con el equipo (de partes interesadas) y adherirse a los principios y estándares de proceso implementadosTrabajar con TI para coordinar y definir los impactos de los usuarios comerciales de los cambios en la aplicación MDM, incluida la resolución de problemas y la planificación de mejoras y actualizaciones.Calificaciones y habilidades requeridas para el rol:Carrera concluída y titulado(a).6 meses o más de experiencia administrando grandes volúmenes de datos.Inglés avanzado.Buen manejo de excel en creación de tablas pivote, funciones below cups,Deseable conocimiento en Power BI.Establecimiento de buenas relaciones de trabajoExperiencia con estructuras de datos, relaciones y procesosSólida experiencia en tecnología.Demostrar competencia en: comprensión y corrección de discrepancias de datos; lectura y traducción de modelos de datos; consulta de datos; identificación de anomalías de datos y análisis de causa raíz.

title: Data Analyst
description: The RoleWe are looking for a Data Analyst to help us drive accurate and timely reporting for various internal customers including Sales, Marketing, Account Management, and People Operations. This person must be a result focused, data-driven, relentless problem solver who is comfortable operating without much direct oversight. Ultimately the role will be responsible for helping us drive sustainable growth across the portfolio of Solera companies.What You’ll DoCreate reports and dashboards for internal customers including Sales, Marketing, and othersMake updates to reports and dashboards per request of leadershipMaintain existing reports and dashboards to ensure accurate and timely reporting of key metricsHelp drive overall data centralization and transformation strategy from various data sourcesSupport Sales analytics strategy to enable predictable growth Work with executive stakeholders to help define, support, and implement needed reportingRequirements:Excellent communication skills.Experience with Salesforce is a must.Experience with Power Bi is a must.Advance English level (conversational and written).Advance level of excel.Knowledge creating data bases from scratch or working with ETL tools.Experience implementing Q&A processes.Bachelor’s degree.What You’ll BringExperience generating Sales reporting and analysisExperience working with VP+ stakeholders.Ability to drive execution relentlessly in complex matrixed environment. Demonstrated ability to translate growth strategies into sales plans and solve business problems .Ability to build relationships with critical functions supporting Sales (Finance, HR, IT, etc) Expert in Sales Tools, Sales Processes, and Sales Operations.

title: #7457 - Data Analyst
description: DescriptionQualitest, the largest quality assurance company in the world, is recruiting employees for a localization/software-testing project in partnership with one of the world’s largest tech providers. We are looking for a passionate Data Analyst.ResponsibilitiesInterpret data, analyze results using analytical tools and provide ongoing reports and corrections to the data.Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.Filter and “clean” data by reviewing performance indicators to locate and propose corrections in the database.Locate and define new process improvement opportunities.Work with engineering teams to develop and implement tools for improving data collection and analysis of data, data analytics, and other strategies that improve the processes.Work with management to prioritize business and information needsThis position has shifted hours from 10:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. or 11:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. six days a week.RequirementsDetail-oriented, organized, and able to work on multiple projects over the course of a dayHigh Proficiency in EnglishDemonstrated ability to work independentlyExcellent analytical skills, logical problem-solving skillsCreative, out-of-the-box thinkingExperience troubleshooting complex problemsMeticulously high level of attention to detail and accurate documentation of informationPerforms well under pressureExcellent interpersonal, communication, and listening skillsTeam player with ability to work well in a cross-functional team environmentHigh level of cultural sensitivity and awareness to work effectively with diverse teamsBenefitsWhy Qualitest?Work hard and play harder with our flexible and casual culture.Stay healthy – with private health insurance coverage offered from day 1 of employment.Shop and spend for things you need with our food card benefit which is accepted in over 6500 stores in Mexico.Get the help you need when you need it with our Employee Assistance Program which offers counseling services to you and members of your household at no cost. This service includes 6 free counseling sessions where you may speak with a licensed therapist, and licensed clinicians are also available to you 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.Gain access to over 3000+ training courses and peer-to-peer mentoring support, allowing you to become a master of your craft and learn new skills.Celebrating your achievements and milestones are important to us so we created our Employee Rewards and Recognition Programs. Be rewarded and acknowledged for what you do and who you are!Earn bonuses’ via our Client Referral and Employee Referral Programs. Refer and earn – tap your network for net-worth.Be a part of a company that strives to support for diversity and inclusion in the workplace – we are one, we are many at Qualitest. Celebrate culture, share knowledge with engineers from around the globe, and inspire each other through our differences.Intrigued to find more about us?Visit our website at www.qualitestgroup.com Check out our Career page: https://qualitestgroup.com/careers/ If you like what you have read, send us your resume and let’s start talking!

title: Data Analyst Sr
description: Buscamos el talento de una persona para desarrollar el conocimiento extenso en análisis de comportamiento digital, redes sociales, web y rendimiento de medios, con el objetivo de hacer recomendaciones, optimizaciones, ajustes y alertas para diversas cuentas, a partir del análisis crear o aportar en estrategias de rendimiento, monitoreo y de tendencias para la cuenta. Con el objetivo de poder realizar recomendaciones, optimizaciones, ajustes y alertas para diversas cuentas.Creación de reportes de rendimiento, listenings, benchmarks para las cuentas, tanto de redes sociales como de páginas web. Tableau, Datorama, Power Bi, Data Studio)Ofrecemos:Contrato directo por la empresaSueldo competitivoPrestaciones superiores a la leyTransporte corporativoEsquema híbrido
