title: Data Analyst
description: Desired Skills and Experience:- 2+ years of experience in wealth management operations, private equity, or capital markets- 2+ years of data analysis experience- Experience using Excel in a professional setting (vlookups, macros, pivots)- Ability to work in a fast paced environment, is detail-oriented, and has great communication skills- Has real-time problem solving skills and excellent sense of urgency- Is not afraid to ask questions and remains curiousPlusses:- Experience working with client financial performance reports, system conversions, investment performance, or performance measurement attributions (wealth management performance reporting)- Experience using Vestmark, Sylvan, Vision FI, or APL, Black Diamond, or Advent- CIPM License- Experience using SQLDay-to-Day:Our national investment banking, capital markets and wealth management partner headquartered in Center City, Philadelphia is looking for a Client Reporting Associate to join their Wealth Management Operations team in Center City.The Associate will be supporting wealth management functions pertaining to client performance reports. They will build out and analyze large data sets in their internal systems and relay any useful and essential data and calculations (in presentation format) to the advisory team for individual investors (i.e. rate of return, risk incurred, etc.). The Associate will also be responsible for reconciling any financial information within the reports, and reaching out to the appropriate internal parties if there are any discrepancies. In addition to coordinating with the advisory team, the Associate will be coordinating with the development team to efficiently and effectively create and modify the reports through SQL and Vestmark.This is a permanent, hybrid role in Center City, Philadelphia.

title: Data Analyst
description: KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: • Support the Supply Management team to ensure supply and minimize obsolescence related to product tests, national events and Limited Time Offers (LTOs). • Assist in forecasting activities for LTOs and regular menu items: o Manage sales vs. forecast process and run daily as needed o Perform historical sales analyses for the supply management team as needed o Manage the maintenance of the ARCOP restaurant unit listing o Assist in all forecasting for LTO promotions o Provide backup for the Supply Management Sr. Manager and Sr. Analyst  • Assist Manager in making production decisions for Unique Ingredients during LTOs: o Make judgment decisions on additional production runs on unique ingredients, during LTOs o Perform inventory need analyses during LTOs to make recommendations on production decisions  • Maintain external relationships with Distribution Partner account reps EDUCATION & REQUIRED EXPERIENCE: • BS/BA Degree. 2+ years’ experience in an analytical role (supply chain mgmt., accounting, finance, etc.)  • High analytical skills required • Project management experience preferred • Understanding of a foodservice supply chain or logistics environment a plus REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS or ABILITIES: • Excellent analytical/problem-solving skills (data evaluation, solution presentation, implementation) • Advanced computer skills for data processing, particularly Microsoft Excel • Ability to communicate ideas in a convincing, influential manner and at all levels in the organization • Ability to build positive/respected relationships with team members, suppliers etc. • Sound decision-maker and high level of initiative, hands-on and multi-tasking capabilities • Performance-driven, results-oriented with a strong work ethic • Excellent interpersonal skills including oral/written communications with a customer service mentality

title: Data Analyst
description: Houston, TX /Octopus Energy US 🇺🇸 – Data /Full-time/ Hybrid Welcome to the future of energyWe are both an electricity retailer and a tech platform and we think there is no better way to address our greatest challenge, climate change, than with the combination of those two.Through our proprietary tech platform, Kraken, we are changing the way people interact with their energy company - by making it approachable, low cost, easy-to-understand, and most importantly, 100% renewable. We’ve distinguished ourselves by being named 2020’s Energy Provider of the Year, which highlights our commitment to exceptional customer service. In many markets we are a leading employer on Glassdoor for best places to work.At Octopus, we’ve built the technology to serve millions of customers. We’re now looking to develop our reporting and dashboards, and provide analysis and key insights to inform the business in its ambitious growth.We’re looking for a mid-level to senior Data Analyst to support the core commercial functions, in effectively running an efficient supply business and providing excellent customer experience. In this role, you will help us collate, visualize and analyze a variety of data, and maintain and build our automated data processes.What You'll DoYour focus will be on analytics, blending a data analyst role with an analytics engineer: you’ll work across the whole data lifecycle to bring insights to teams such as operations, sales, and marketing.Work with the leadership team and other functions to understand priorities and data requirements, and scope new data projects and productsLead the building & maintenance of new data tools including data apps, BI dashboards, reports and automation pipelinesLead one-off analyses and deep dives, and present actionable findingsRecruit, develop and mentor team membersWork closely with other parts of the data science and data platform team and be an active contributor and leader in the global Octopus data communityAdvocate for a culture of transparency, trust, reliability and reproducibility in dataWhat Kind Of Areas You'll Be Working OnYou’ll be responsible for reporting and analytics across the whole customer experience and supply business including:Financial reporting, debt and billingAcquisitions, sales and marketingOperations: customer contact, feedback and team productivityRisk management, procurement and pricingRegulatory reportingWhat technology you'll be working with:In this role you’ll be building tools on top of our data platform with the support of our exceptional international data platform team. The core technologies that make up the platform are:Jupyter, Python, pandas and data science stack for analysisPostgres as primary storage for most of our back end applicationsTableau and Streamlit for BI dashboards and data appsAWS as our cloud providerDatabricks Delta Lake as our data lake and cloud data warehouseAirflow purely for job scheduling and trackingSpark for data processingdbt for data modellingPresto and SparkSQL for analyticsKubernetes, Git, Circle CI, Prometheus, Grafana and Terraform for infrastructure, version control, continuous deployment and monitoringWe're looking for someone who: Is curious and self-driven, who can take the initiative to search for answers themselvesIs capable of working in a fast moving unstructured environment, who can quickly assess and challenge what’s needed, prioritize tasks and deliver solutionsIs passionate about applying data and analytics to solve problems and automate tasksHas a strong technical skill set and experience in technologies listed above, to contribute individually, as well as leadBrings a proven record of managing teams of data analysts to deliver great tools and tangible outcomes Can inspire, train and lead the people around themHas experience in customer experience and/or energy retail (this is a bonus but not a hard requirement, we will consider candidates from other sectors)Is passionate about contributing to the energy transition, and being part of a company that is manically focused on helping our customers and society reach Net ZeroIf this sounds like you then we'd love to hear from you. Studies have shown that some groups of people, like women, are less likely to apply to a role unless they meet 100% of the job requirements. Whoever you are, if you like one of our jobs, we encourage you to apply as you might just be the candidate we hire. Across Octopus, we're looking for genuinely decent people who are honest and empathetic. Our people are our strongest asset and the unique skills and perspectives people bring to the team are the driving force of our success. As an equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute. Our commitment is to provide equal opportunities, an inclusive work environment, and fairness for everyone.

title: Data Analyst
description: About usgategroup is the global leader in airline catering, retail-on-board, and hospitality products and services. gategroup provides passengers with superior culinary and retail experiences, leveraging innovation and advanced technology solutions. Headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, gategroup delivers operational excellence through the most extensive catering network in the aviation industry, serving passengers from over 200 operating units in over 60 countries/territories across all continents.We work in an exciting industry – fast-paced and ever-changing. Industry trends and customer expectations are constantly evolving and it is critical that we are agile, innovative, and ready for change - and our people are our driving force. We offer attractive opportunities to be part of this fast-paced and truly international working environment.For further information, please visit www.gategroup.com.Job SummaryResponsible for mastery of SAP and SACS master data to ensure the operational effectiveness and excellence of the Operational Planning and Control Business Unit. Assist in the creation of master data models that are responsive to the diverse needs of our airline client base. Main Duties and Responsibilities:Perform continuous audits to ensure standard, consistent, and quality master data in catering systems is valid and correct.Interface with several internal groups, including the buyers and SAP coordinators across multiple kitchens, members of the Business Process Improvement team, and Pricing, Billing, and Menu Specification analysts for assigned accounts.Collect and interpret menu specifications for assigned accounts, and research and resolve any discrepancies.Work with JIRA issue reporting system.Partner with your assigned airline Account Executives, Gate Gourmet units, Pricing, and Billing Departments, Procurement Team, and Menu Administration Team and to identify our common problems and limit their frequency and volume. Working closely with your supervisor, Pricing and Data Analysts, and our customers to monitor and interpret any changes to airline specifications ensuring lead times are met upstream. Partner with your supervisor to find new ways to improve our systems and process.  Core Competencies Demonstration and or proven success in 2 of the 10 following job competencies: Analysis and Reporting Business Acumen, Planning, and Management Communication and Presentation Champions Diversity & InclusionCustomer Focus and Relationship Building Champion for Change Influencing Information and Technology Proficiency Leadership Problem Solving and Decision Making  Work Demands  Regular and on-time attendance. Hours regularly exceed 40 hours per week. Occasional travel by conventional means including aircraft, motor vehicle, and the like within the region and to other locations as required up to 30%. QualificationsEducation:Bachelor's Degree required, from an accredited university or equivalentWork Experience:3 years or more previous demonstrated analyst work experience. Proven experience within an SAP environment. Work experience in an operations or manufacturing environmentWork experience in a food production or food service environmentExperience working within a cross-functional teamPrior training and development experience preferredJob Skills:Must demonstrate and have basic skills in Microsoft Office applications, specifically Word, Excel, and Outlook. Must have solid analytical skills. Display an outstanding work ethic.Must work effectively in a team-based environment. Must have the ability and desire to meet required timelines.Strong mathematical aptitude. Language / Communication Skills:Ability to communicate well with internal and external customers, verbally and in writing.Job DimensionsGeographic Responsibility: USType of Employment: Full TimeTravel %: Up to 30%.Internal Relationships: GGate Gourmet units, Pricing, and Billing Departments, Procurement Team, and Menu Administration TeamExternal Relationships: Customer account teamsWork Environment / Requirements of the Job: Normal office environmentgategroup Competencies Required to be Successful in the Job:Thinking – Information Search and analysis & problem resolution skillsEngaging – Understanding others, Team Leadership and Developing PeopleInspiring – Influencing and building relationships, Motivating and Inspiring, Communicating effectivelyAchieving – Delivering business results under pressure, Championing Performance Improvement and Customer FocusDemonstrated Values to be Successful in the PositionEmployees at gategroup are expected to live our Values of Excellence, Integrity, Passion, and Accountability. To demonstrate these Values, we expect to observe the following from everyone:We treat each other with respect and we act with integrityWe communicate and keep each other informedWe put our heads together to problem-solve and deliver excellence as a teamWe have passion for our work and we pay attention to the little detailsWe foster an environment of accountability, take responsibility for our actions, and learn from our mistakesWe do what we say we will do when we say we are going to do itWe care about our coworkers, always taking an opportunity to make someone’s day betterThe above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by the individual(s) assigned to this position. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities, and skills required. Management reserves the right to modify, add, or remove duties and to assign other duties as necessary. In addition, reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this position.gategroup is an equal opportunity employer committed to workforce diversity. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status or other category under applicable law.For further information regarding Equal Employment Opportunity, copy and paste the following URL into your web browser: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdfIf you want to be part of a team that helps make travel and culinary memories, join us!

title: Data Analyst
description: ** LOCAL CANDIDATES ONLY** Position Overview:We are looking for a motivated, organized, and analytical thinker to join our Operations Team. The ideal candidate must be comfortable corresponding daily on the phone and through professional emails with people in municipal departments. You must have strong attention to detail, communication, and reading comprehension skills. You must be results driven, growth oriented, and able to balance multiple projects at any given time. Problem Solver Mentality● Must be able to handle rejection and overcome work obstacles Compensation:Commensurate with experience. Competitive Benefits Package including: 100% paid health insurance, dental, and vision coverage. Flexible Time Off and 401K contribution.

title: Data Analyst
description: Data AnalystWho Are We?SDG Group is a global consulting firm specialized in Data & Analytics. We are committed to unlocking the organizations’ potential and hidden value by offering in-depth analytics expertise to empower our clients all around the world and help them grow to expand their businesses. Innovation is in our DNA.We work on the pillars of “Triple Expertise,” which incorporates business process skills by domain,technological knowledge, and partnerships with cutting-edge software providers.Why Join Us?We’re looking for problem solvers, innovators, and collaborators who want to be a part of the mission to help us to further grow our company! You will have the ability to learn the latest technologies in the market and build strong relationships with technical and business leaders, all while deepening your expertise and enhancing your skills. We will work with you to create customized career plans which will allow you to grow independently, as well as with your colleagues. If you value inclusivity and want to join a culture that empowers you to show up as your authentic self, join us. Our goal is to move through the interview process in a timely manner while staying highly communicative. We are committed to ensuring that you are equipped with a comprehensive understanding of SDG Group and the role you have applied to.About The Data Analyst RoleAs a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing data using statistical techniques, implementing and maintaining databases, gathering data from primary and secondary sources, identifying, analyzing and interpreting trends from the data.What You’ll Be DoingIn collaboration with the other members of your team and your supervisor you will be in charge orparticipate in the following activities:Business requirements mapping to functional and technical designData structure analysis and data model designDevelopment of data transformation processesImplementation of metrics and visualizationsFront-end and user interface developmentWorking with team members by converting business requirements to achieve functional and technical designWhat We Look ForRelevant Bachelor’s Degree (Data Science, Analytics, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, Business Technology, STEM, etc.)Strong passion for data and technology with the aspiration to work in management consultingDemonstrated experience using SQL, Python or related languagesSome knowledge of BI technologies, data modeling, data management0 to 2 years of work/internship/academic experience in data analysis, data technology, business intelligence, analyticsExperience working with modern Business Intelligence, Analytics, or Data Management technologiesOutstanding oral and written communication skillsAbility and willingness to digest technical business information and present that with sensitivity to business stakeholdersAbility to build strong relationship with internal team members and client teamTeam Environment OrientationProductivity and autonomy, eager to accept challengesBenefits of Working With UsAt SDG, we’re constantly striving towards building a culture where people come first by creating an environment of transparency, collaboration and meritocracy. We take care of our global employees by making sure we offer the following:Full-time employment in an exciting and growing high-tech industry with a competitive salaryA professional career with opportunities for personal and professional growth and rapid career advancement based on meritocracy; every six months you’ll meet with your manager to share feedback, discuss new challenges, and review your salaryA creative and innovative work environment with flexible working options (flexible working hours, good mix of on-site and remote)Robust Healthcare and Benefits package including Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability coverage, and various other benefit options401k Retirement plan with Employer match3+ weeks paid vacation and flexible holiday Schedule

title: Data & Insights Specialist
description: PedidosYa es la empresa de tecnología líder en delivery y quick commerce presente en 15 países de América Latina. Nuestro objetivo es brindar experiencias únicas a nuestros usuarios a través de nuestra pasión por la tecnología. Somos parte de Delivery Hero, compañía alemana líder mundial en quick commerce.¡Somos un equipo inquieto de más de 6.000 personas y siempre vamos por más! Estamos siempre buscando personas con ganas de crear en cada momento, apasionadas por lo que hacen, y sobre todo, que quieran jugar en equipo. ¿Te quieres sumar?Tenemos una oportunidad para vos: Estamos buscando Data & Insights Specialist en el equipo de Quick Commerce Regional.¿Qué desafíos te esperan?Responsable de desarrollar soluciones de información para las Marcas que invierten en PedidosYa.Referente de las diferentes herramientas, velando por la calidad de la información, optimizando su consumo por parte de las Marcas y los equipos locales.Guiar la toma de decisiones de los equipos de Partnerships de cada mercado para la totalidad de las verticales de la compañía.Liderar las charlas con los equipos técnicos de data de PedidosYa y Delivery Hero. Ser un punto de conexión clave con la áreas de data de las marcas de partnerships haciendo foco en las Key Accounts, dando así soporte a la propuesta de valor de PedidosYa. ¿Qué tendrás que aportar?Graduados de carreras como ingeniería, licenciatura en administración, estadística, economía, análisis de negocio, informática, sistemas de información, o afines.2 años o más de experiencia en posiciones de estrategia de negocio, análisis y procesamiento de datos, consultoría o tecnología. Experiencia con herramientas de visualización como Tableau/Looker/Data Studio.Conocimientos de programación: SQL y/o Python. Dominio del idioma inglés.¿Qué podés esperar de PedidosYa?Trabajar junto con un equipo listo para jugar, dispuesto a compartir conocimiento, experiencias y desafíos.Tener la capacidad de generar impacto y crear en cada momento. Creamos una nueva industria y la reinventamos cada día. Una empresa en pleno crecimiento, con mucho contacto internacional en Latam y todo el mundo.Seguir aprendiendo en un ambiente dinámico, donde puedes explorar tu potencial y tus ideas al máximo. Un lugar donde puedas ser quien eres y disfrutar lo que haces todos los días.Flexibilidad y autonomía para definir junto con tu equipo la mejor manera de trabajar. La diversidad de talento potencia nuestra Cooltura y nuestra organización. Jugamos en Equipo en todo lo que hacemos, y lo que más nos gusta de eso es que promovemos la creación de equipos diversos e inclusivos que puedan aportar diferentes perspectivas a PedidosYa. Nuestras oportunidades laborales están abiertas a todas las personas, independientemente de su identidad de género, orientación sexual, origen étnico, religión, edad, discapacidad y/o otras características individuales.En caso de necesitar algún ajuste razonable o accesibilidad particular para tener la entrevista, por favor no dejes de aclararlo en tu postulación. Además, sentite libre de indicarnos tus pronombres (él/ella/elle) desde el primer contacto.Conocé más sobre PedidosYa: https://empleos.pedidosya.com/ #GeneramosImpacto #JugamosEnEquipo #CoolturaPeYa #ActitudPeYa #LaDiversidadNosPotencia

title: Vendor Data Analyst
description: Who we are: Office Beacon is a global leader in business process outsourcing. From call center to order management, Office Beacon is your business growth partner. Office Beacon is moving a step ahead by integrating new technology in its new advanced business software to provide its clients with a trusted system having the ability to streamline business processes, eventually increasing productivity in all possible aspects of the business. Office Beacon was founded in 2001 by one of North America's most successful entrepreneurs, Pranav Dalal. Nearly 20 years later, Office Beacon employs over 2,500+ service, technology, and design experts globally. Headquartered in Redondo Beach, California, Office Beacon has offices in India, the Philippines, Australia, and Canada. If you want to know more about us, please visit our website https://www.officebeacon.com/Vendor Data AnalystThis role will oversee various levels of reporting, analyses, and escalation for vendor performance and tracking. This role will also be responsible for creating and managing daily queries/reports using internal systems and databases. This person will assist in developing and improving vendor tracking data flow improvement strategies. In addition, this role will assist with outputting and managing all ongoing reports in a report repository. This role will report directly to the Director of Process/Quality & Automation. ResponsibilitiesWork is typically performed under no supervision, with only guidance as necessary when escalation to shipping partners is required. Usually, receive minimal guidance about how to complete work objectives. Able to independently evaluate processes, identify areas of improvement, and incorporate them into overall work objectives. Strong ability to manage to change priorities daily at times. ●	Analyze all tracking data to ensure parcels are delivered within expected time frames and are accurate and match 3rd party, shipping partners.●	Manage tracking data flow (flat files or API calls) between shipping partners ●	Escalate any missing tracking data or file consumption issues as required to the Help Desk/ IT team●	Format all shipping partner reports into a standard format to assist in regular analyses●	Must understand overall logistical workflows to various shipping lanes throughout the world (the Director of Quality will assist in training)●	Communicate key shipping partner delays or tracking issues to Customer Service leadership and other leadership as necessary●	Communicate delays and/or tracking issues to shipping partners as defined by the Director of Quality and VP of Ecommerce●	Manager shipping partner error upload processes ensuring errors are reviewed and addressed with no impact on client tracking experience●	Troubleshoot errors with shipping partners directly●	Add or format (map events) new vendor events in internal systems ensuring clear wording and verbiage are displayed in tracking systems●	Assist various report requests by utilizing Data Analyst or Report portal●	Look to automate report output for users (internal & external) so Support does not have to manually create or provide reports directly●	Working with peers to ensure optimal flow of workload and coverage in the absence of others.●	Partner with IT departments within to develop optimal solutions reducing the title: Analista de Reporting Pospago e Inteligencia
description: En Claro promovemos una cultura de respeto e igualdad de oportunidades. Seleccionamos a nuestros talentos basándonos en el valor que pueden agregar a nuestro negocio.Buscamos profesionales con capacidad para desenvolverse en un contexto de evolución e innovación digital, que generen nuevos desafíos y desarrollen oportunidades de negocios.Tus principales desafíos serán:Extraer y consolidar datos del negocio.Generar y realizar el análisis de diferentes reportes del producto.Serás responsable de monitorear y alertar sobre alteraciones en el comportamiento del producto pospago.Controlar y monitorear los sistemas de información del área.Asistir la tabulación de los datos obtenidos en el campo, su análisis y la presentación de las conclusiones, orientado a facilitar la toma de decisiones.Desarrollar e implementar el uso de técnicas y herramientas orientadas al mejor procesamiento, validación y análisis de la información.Realizar cortes de bases para colaborar en el diseño, ejecución y medición de las diferentes campañas.Qué necesitamos de vos:Formación universitaria finalizada o en curso, en carreras de Informática, Sistemas, Ciencias Económicas o Estadística (excluyente).Conocimientos de Excel nivel avanzado (excluyente).Aplicación y desarrollo de sentencias SQL (SQLl Server y Oracle) (excluyente).Se valorará tener manejo de herramientas de análisis y procesamiento de datos: Microstrategy, Tableau, Big Query, Reporting Services y/o Integration Services.Experiencia previa en tareas similares.Trabajo en equipo.Autonomía y dinamismo.Simplicidad en tu forma de pensar y hacer.Vocación de servicio.El puesto tiene sede en MontevideoCantidad de vacantes: 1El presente proceso de búsqueda comprende a las personas inscriptas en el Registro Nacional de Personas con Discapacidad que reúnan las competencias e idoneidad para el cargo previamente detalladas, de acuerdo a lo dispuesto en la Ley N° 19.691

title: Data Engineer
description: Interfood is one of the leading global dairy trading firms, both in physical as well as financial products. To support further growth of our business, Interfood is putting digital and analytics in the core of our business strategy. Our Global Analytics team acts as the innovation center on advanced analytics and data science, supporting the strategic agenda set by the Executive Committee. Over the past years, we have built a healthy analytics environment and we are keen to keep working on more use case developments and continuous improvement. This opportunity is for supporting data professionals to grow fast with our organization. You and your team will work in close collaboration and will maintain close ties with the other IT teams (Process & Projects, Digital & Integrations, Cloud & Ops) as well as business functions.Therefore, we encourage data engineers as well as software engineers who enjoy data engineering work to apply.In this role, you will:Collaborate with data analysts, data scientists, and other teams to analyze data requirements and deliver solutions.Design, build and maintain ETL pipelines.Develop and maintain platform monitoring and data quality monitoring jobs.Support migrating legacy data solutions to the new data platform.Creating a self-service data platform that allows business users and analysts to make the best use of the data available in an easy way.As our new Data Engineer you have/are:Advanced working knowledge of Python and SQL.Knowledge of distributed data processing frameworks (Spark, Hadoop).Experience with building and maintaining cloud-based data pipelines.Experience in monitoring / dashboarding (e.g. Datadog, Grafana, Kibana).Knowledge of IaC framework is a plus (e.g. Terraform).Familiar with CI/CD and SW engineering best practices.Up-to-date on the latest technologies and trends in the field of data.Experience in Agile working.Your profile:3+ years of experience in SW/Data Engineering.BSc in Computer Science/Engineering, Data Science, or related field.Good communication skills.A passion for data.Excellent in planning and execution.Our offer:Competitive compensation and benefits.We commit to help you stay on top of your game through tailored training and coaching organized with our partner companies.High exposure to business and projects with tangible impacts.International career opportunities.Travel internationally.Participate in fun team activities.* Candidates listed in the National Registry of Persons with Disabilities, who meet the requirements and are qualified for the position described in line with Law Number 19.691 are also included in this job offering.

title: Java Data Analyst
description: About DescartesDescartes Unites the People and Technology that Move the WorldThe need for efficient, secure, and agile supply chains and logistics operations has become ever more critical and complex.We’re one of the most broadly deployed logistics and supply chain technology companies in the world. More than 22,000 customers around the globe use our cloud-based solutions to transform the way they move inventory and information to enhance productivity, better serve customers, thrive competitively, keep pace with evolving regulations, and respond to rapidly changing market conditions. Descartes is publicly traded (Nasdaq:DSGX, TSX:DSG) with headquarters in Waterloo, Ontario, Canada, and offices and partners around the world.We’re growing fast and invite you to join our amazing team.Data Analyst Con JavaJava 8SQL (Strong knowledge) Oracle/PostgreSQLBI/Reporting tools (desirable)We are searching for a Senior Java developer with a passion for complex relational data models how would like to deepen his knowledge of data modeling and analysis and explore the fields of Big Data and Artificial Intelligence in the future. Knowledge of Microsoft’s Power BI suite is certainly a plus but not a prerequisite for this position.Location: This is a hybrid position and will require you to come to our Montvideo office a couple of days per week.Join UsAs we scale, we’re looking for new doers, collaborators and innovators to join Descartes in uniting the people and technology that move the world as the Global Leader in Logistics and Supply Chain Technology. We prioritize work-life balance and foster an environment with the space to take ownership, to be heard, and to carve a path for your individual accomplishments to help drive our success

title: Analyst- Montevideo
description: QualificationsBachelor's degreeExceptional problem-solving ability, logical reasoning, creative thinkingComfort with numbers and the ability to untangle complex issuesDemonstrated leadership capabilities; eager to break new groundStrong interpersonal and communication skillsTrack record of strong analytical and conceptual skillsFluent in both Spanish and English (verbal and written)What You'll DoYou’ll work in teams of typically 3 – 5 consultants in client engagements and receive extensive additional training to expand your skill set.This 12-24 month program was created to develop talents into real leaders through research, training, mentoring and coaching sessions. During the program, a variety of top management issues will be presented to you and to your highly talented team-mates, firm colleagues from different offices and practices, and clients. The results of your work will have lasting impact on some of the largest corporations in Latin America.Your team will be prepared to give you all the support you need to understand how we work and how we serve our clients. As you grow in this position, you can expect to gather and analyze information, formulate and test hypotheses, and develop and communicate recommendations. You will also have the opportunity to present results to client management and implement recommendations in collaboration with client team members.You will experience exceptional training as well as frequent coaching and mentoring from colleagues. This support includes a partner from your local office or practice assigned to you to help guide your career, helping you to develop your skills and build your network, as well as several weeks of formal training in your first two years.You might work across a variety of industries and functions, your innovative and design-oriented academic focus will come in handy for all analytical thinking and problem solving with the team and you will also help your team to bring diverse perspectives for the firm projects.You will assist client development and office-building efforts within each Spanish Latin America location and reach and relevance efforts (internal initiatives aimed at strengthening colleagues' knowledge of firm values and latest advancements through town halls, Values Day and others).On occasion/when available, you may have geographic focused travel.Who You'll Work WithYou will be based in Uruguay Location as part of our Spanish Latam Office, working in teams and directly with our clients.Your team colleagues will make you feel welcome and help you be at your best during client engagements. The Professional Development team will complement your experience by tailoring a learning and training program for you, considering your strengths and development needs.When you join McKinsey as an analyst, you are joining a firm that will challenge you and invest heavily in your professional development. In this role you will have the opportunity to work on teams and help the best organizations in the world – across the private, public, and social sectors – solve some of their most difficult problems, while you discover coaches, mentors, sponsors and friends in your learning program.

title: BI Marketing Sr Analyst
description: PedidosYa es la empresa de tecnología líder en delivery y quick commerce presente en 15 países de América Latina. Nuestro objetivo es brindar experiencias únicas a nuestras personas usuarias a través de nuestra pasión por la tecnología. Somos parte de Delivery Hero, compañía alemana líder mundial en Quick Commerce.¡Somos un equipo inquieto de más de 6000 personas y siempre vamos por más! Estamos siempre buscando personas con ganas de crear en cada momento, apasionadas por lo que hacen, y sobre todo, que quieran jugar en equipo. ¿Te quieres sumar?Tenemos una oportunidad para ti, estamos buscando BI Marketing Sr Analyst para sumarse a nuestro equipo.¿Qué desafíos te esperan?Analizar y dar seguimiento diario de los KPIs del equipo de Marketing, generando inputs para la toma de decisiones.Detectar desvíos y proponer proactivamente las mejoras. Diseñar y construir soluciones de reportes, tableros de control e indicadores de gestión que permitan análisis de información.Participar en proyectos para el negocio, en la estructuración de datos, definición de KPI’s, modelos de Looker, querys, SQL y reportes en Tableau.Detectar nuevas oportunidades para potenciar el negocio, a partir del análisis del mercado, competencia y comportamiento de usuarios.Dar soporte a las áreas de Campañas y Performance en relación al uso de herramientas de data.Trabajar en conjunto con otros equipos de Data de la región para potenciar los análisis.Seguimiento y coordinación de los reportes mensuales del Business Unit Uruguay junto al MD.¿Qué tendrás que aportar?Estudiantes avanzados o egresados de carreras como Administración de Empresas, Economía, Ingeniería en Sistemas, Estadística o afines.Experiencia de al menos 1 año en posiciones de Business Intelligence.Valorable la experiencia en empresas multinacionales.Manejo de office y de presentaciones efectivas.Experiencia en manejo de herramientas de Analytics (e.g. SQL, Tableau, Google Tools, Big Query, Braze, Datadog, Looker, PowerBI).Capacidad analítica y data driven.Habilidades de relacionamiento, comunicación y negociación.Buscamos personas proactivas, resolutivas, organizadas y con vocación de servicio.Muy orientados a los resultados y team players.Dominio intermedio del idioma Inglés.¿Qué podés esperar de PedidosYa?Aprender en un ambiente dinámico, donde puedes explorar tu potencial y tus ideas al máximo.Trabajar jugando en equipo, compartiendo conocimiento, experiencias y desafíos.Tener la capacidad de generar impacto y crear en cada momento. Creamos una nueva industria y la reinventamos cada día.Una empresa en pleno crecimiento, con mucho contacto internacional en Latam y todo el mundo.Un lugar donde puedas ser quien eres y disfrutar lo que haces todos los días.Flexibilidad y autonomía para definir junto con tu equipo la mejor manera de trabajar. La diversidad de talento potencia nuestra Cooltura y nuestra organización. Jugamos en Equipo en todo lo que hacemos, y lo que más nos gusta de eso es que promovemos la creación de equipos diversos e inclusivos que puedan aportar diferentes perspectivas a PedidosYa. Nuestras oportunidades laborales están abiertas a todas las personas, independientemente de su identidad de género, orientación sexual, origen étnico, religión, edad, discapacidad y/o otras características individuales.En caso de necesitar algún ajuste razonable o accesibilidad particular para tener la entrevista, por favor no dejes de aclararlo en tu postulación. Además, sentite libre de indicarnos tus pronombres (él/ella/elle) desde el primer contacto.Conocé más sobre PedidosYa: https://empleos.pedidosya.com/#GeneramosImpacto #JugamosEnEquipo #CoolturaPeYa #ActitudPeYa #LaDiversidadNosPotencia

title: Ingeniero/a de Core de Datos
description: HISPAM – Ingeniero de Core de Datos En Telefónica-Movistar, tenemos como misión hacer nuestro mundo más humano, conectando la vida de las personas, entendemos que son ustedes quienes le dan sentido a la tecnología y no al revés.Sabemos que las conexiones más importantes son las humanas, por eso hemos puesto en marcha un nuevo modelo operativo multi país para maximizar el valor de nuestros activos y el talento de nuestros colaboradores, unificando las operaciones de Argentina, Chile, Colombia, Ecuador, México, Perú, Uruguay y Venezuela, para formar Telefónica Hispanoamérica; unimos a las personas en lugar de aislarlas y las invitamos a ser ellas mismas, a expresarse, a compartir.Estamos buscando un/a  Ingeniero de Core de Datos  para que se sume a nuestro equipo y construya, junto a nosotros, ese mundo y compañía que aspiramos tener. Dirección: Tecnología (Hispam)  Área: Ingeniería de Core de Datos  HRBP: Diana Lozano  Líder:EDUARDO COTA FERNANDEZ  Ubicación/Domicilio  :  Argentina, Colombia, Ecuador, Perú, México, Uruguay, Venezuela  Nivel: 11  Reclutador: Camilo Almanza  Misión del Rol Ingeniería de las plataformas del Core de Datos Móvil (EPC, PCRF, DPI, DRA) para los países de Hispam. Es un rol multipaís donde deberá trabajar con proyectos en distintas operadoras del grupo Funciones Asociadas al Rol   Responsable de la implementación de plataformas del Core de Datos (EPC, PCRF, DPI, DRA) de nuevos vendors, así como la ampliación y actualización de las plataformas existentes Seguimiento del trabajo con los proveedores, gestión de proyecto, documentación, definición de configuraciones, LLD, pruebas de aceptación (ATP), pruebas funcionales, pruebas de regresión  Responsable de la implementación de los cambios de configuración requeridos en las plataformas Planificación y gestión de cambios, generación de órdenes de trabajo.  Realización de pruebas de nuevas funcionalidades y maquetas  Soporte de 2°/3° nivel ante problemas reportados por los grupos operativos  Seguimiento y solución de problemas en coordinación con proveedores y grupos operativos.  Participación activa en reuniones con diferentes áreas de la empresa y proveedores.  Coordinación con equipos globales y otras Operaciones de Telefónica.  Requisitos Indispensables  Título de Ingeniero o formación equivalente en Áreas de Ingeniería Eléctrica/Ingeniería en telecomunicaciones/Ingeniería telemática/Sistemas  Experiencia en la operación, ingeniería o planificación de equipamiento de core de datos (EPC, PCRF, DPI o DRA) de alguno de los proveedores actualmente instalado en las operadoras de la región  Disponibilidad para eventuales trabajos en ventanas nocturnas  Buen manejo de herramientas informáticas  Experiencia en ambientes de producción de servicios con alta disponibilidad. Tabla de equivalencia Técnico experiencia, Tecnólogo (5 años plataformas del Core) Requisitos Deseables  Experiencia en operación o ingeniería de equipamiento de core de paquetes (EPC) Nokia o Ericsson  Experiencia en operación o ingeniería de plataformas PCRF (Oracle/Huawei), DPI, DRA o DNS  Conocimientos de Redes IP/MPLS y Seguridad de la Información.  Dominio Avanzado de inglés  Competencias  Trabajo en equipo  Adaptación a los nuevos retos  Proactividad  Independencia en la resolución de problemas  Foco en el servicio  Manejo de la complejidad

title: Sr Database Engineer
description: Our Database Engineering team provides database expertise and services for activities necessary to implement and maintain database systems for the Global Product Development organization. As a Database Engineer in our team, you will be working on all activities necessary to implement and maintain database system for a product by implementing database changes and troubleshooting issues. You will perform operational work on Oracle and other database services provided by Google Cloud Platform, such as Google Cloud Spanner and Google Cloud SQL.What will you achieve? Installs database management systems Optimizes physical data structures, generates scripts to create and alter database objects such as tables, partitions, indexes, views, sequences, etc. Performs SQL review and performance tuning Responsible for capacity planning Prepares and executes data loading and data maintenance procedures Responds to incident tickets and produces quick and effective solutions to technical problems Provides technical assistance to development teamsWhat's in it for you? Working with most critical Sabre systems Opportunity to do something that has high impact and game changing in the travel industry Be part of one of the world’s largest Travel technology companiesMust Have Skills Experienced in setting up Oracle RAC clusters, backup and monitoring Experienced in managing database objects Expertise in database performance tuning and troubleshooting Advanced knowledge of ‪SQL and any of scripting languages used to automate database management tasks Basic knowledge of UNIX/Linux from DBA perspective Excellent verbal and written communication skillsNice To Have Skills Experience with data replication tools such as Oracle GoldenGate and/or Oracle Data Guard Experience with other relational databases such as MySQL, PostgreSQL and NoSQL databases Familiar with database schema migration tools such as Liquibase or Flyway Experience using cloud platforms such as AWS or GCP General experience with distributed architecture and/or high availability systems

title: Data Analysis Intern (Remote Internship - Analyst)
description: POSITION: Data Analyst InternLOCATION: RemoteSCHEDULE: Part-time (10-20h/week)About Brainnest:The business management and training company headquartered in Bremen, Germany. We are a success-driven firm that provides management advisory and contracting services customized to help companies from different industries with business management problems. Brainnest runs, leads, and manages complex projects and initiatives. We have begun from scratch when a network of professionals, Ph.D. holders, and highly skilled personnel bring to the business table their practical and academic years of experience to form up a concrete blueprint on which the company has been designed. Since 2020, we offer a combination of expertise, proficiency, and commitment, leveraging our deep industry experience and applying analytical rigor to deliver exceptional results for companies. We proudly provide top-class consulting and training services for a wide range of industries around the world. title: Data Engineer
description: Mural’s mission is to inspire teams to connect and innovate, while bringing purpose and intention to the craft of collaboration.Mural created the Collaborative Intelligence System™ to power cultures of effective collaboration where everyone is connected, contributing, and empowered to deliver business-driving outcomes.Founded in 2011, Mural is a leading innovator in visual collaboration for hybrid, remote, and distributed teams. We believe in what we build, and our team of more than 700 “MURistas” around the world collaborate in the Mural® app. Our values guide our intentionally inclusive product and culture, which includes collaboration design education and a flexible monthly stipend for learning, wellness, and coworking.Mural has raised $200M to date and is growing rapidly to fulfill our mission. The company is trusted by 95% of the Fortune 100, including innovative teams at IBM, Intuit, GitLab, Microsoft, and Atlassian.YOUR MISSIONAs a Data Engineer, you will grow our business by applying your knowledge of data architectures, APIs, and the delivery and transformation of data in a reliable way and help us expand globally.You’re responsible for building and maintaining the data pipeline architecture of Mural, creating internal data tools, as well as writing APIs and tools to help other teams work with data. You will collaborate closely with Product, Analytics and Data Science teams to help them achieve their goals. You will report directly to the Data Engineering Manager.In this role, you will:Help build the platform, tools and APIs vital to enable other teams to work with data.Improve the existing data platform and propose solutions.Work closely with Product teams to help them explore the feasibility of experimental data-driven features, helping them narrow down preliminary or unclear requirements, and building the tools and APIs vital to support those features. A strong analytical attitude is a must.Efficiently handle vast amounts of data from multiple sources and destinations, including relational and NoSQL databases as well as external systems, both in batch processing and real-time delivery.Follow modern development standards and methodologies such as code reviews, unit testing, continuous integration, and agile methodologyWork as part of a team. We value teammates who share their knowledge and like collaborating with others.Show initiative, completing your tasks and providing timely status updates to both the rest of your team and all of the customers, collaborators and partners.Take full ownership of the solutions you build. This means analyzing requirements, building, tracking and monitoring them, and troubleshooting them if problems arise.YOUR PROFILEThe top candidate will have the following skills:2+ years of relevant experience in software developmentA Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related fieldStrong Python skills in a professional working environmentFamiliar with Golang or Scala as a secondary programming languageCode an application from scratch following standard methodologies such as writing clean code with unit tests, and using continuous integrationExperience in designing and developing web services and REST APIsSophisticated knowledge of relational databases such as PostgreSQL, and ability to write non-trivial SQLExperience processing Real Time DataProven experience in data modeling, ETL/ELT development, and data warehousingPlease submit your resume in English.What We OfferIn addition to being part of our quest to help people empower their imagination, we offer:Competitive salary401K (US only)Company equityHealth insuranceFertility benefitsMuralvida stipend (for fitness, wellness, learning and coworking)Fully remote teamParental leaveEnd of year closureDesign thinking trainingsMural free forever planOUR VALUESWe bring people to our team that care about our mission to inspire and connect creative people globally, and who feel aligned with our values:Make others successfulAdapt to thrivePlay to wowThink globalExperiment like an ownerPracticing equality through imagination work.Mural is committed to creating diverse and inclusive workspaces where people can make a positive impact on the world and share their vision of how they achieve it. We are dedicated to working alongside multiple communities to help build this dream and bring it to life.We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

title: Contract: Senior Data Infrastructure Engineering
description: Upwork ($UPWK) is the world’s work marketplace. We serve everyone from one-person startups to over 30% of the Fortune 100 with a powerful, trust-driven platform that enables companies and talent to work together in new ways that unlock their potential.Last year, more than $3.3 billion of work was done through Upwork by skilled professionals who are gaining more control by finding work they are passionate about and innovating their careers.This is an engagement through Upwork’s Hybrid Workforce Solutions (HWS) Team. Our Hybrid Workforce Solutions Team is a global group of professionals that support Upwork’s business. Our HWS team members are located all over the world.Work/Project Scope:Data Infrastructure team at Upwork is the center of engineering excellence for best practices relating to provisioning, maintenance, right-scaling, cost-effective use, use-appropriate targeting of many types of stateful storage technologies: transactional databases, document databases, cache/key-value stores, streaming data stores etc.Senior Data Infrastructure Engineer with DI team is a hyper-collaborative data infrastructure domain expert with a strong desire (and skills) to automate.As Data Infrastructure Domain Expert you will:Ensure that the Data Infrastructure team has a ready-to-apply library of best-in-class homework, templates and decision tree that matches data usage patterns with data storage technology tech that is most effective in addressing needs of feature development teams.Keep technology vendor portfolio fresh through periodic data storage technology vendor scans, research, qualification and rating.Drive excellence in engineering workflows, process design, technology choices supporting data storage lifecycle events like version upgrades, proactive right-scaling, predictive issue pattern formulation and automation supporting preemption of unplanned outages.Design scale-appropriate data infrastructure governance process and automations that allow transparent, zero-downtime background servicing of hundreds of systems concurrently. Proactively eliminate manual servicing requirements through design of resilient data infrastructure systems and process automation.Author self-service best practices for data consumption, performance monitoring tools and workflows. Proactively advocate adaption of these by feature development teams.In collaboration with Data Science, Data Processing teams innovate data storage systems interfaces in support for ETL, data transformation and data quality systems with eye on low maintenance costs, low latency, higher throughput, simplicity of use.Be the domain expert for a set of storage technologies, including intimate understanding of query expression language/APIs, tuning, scaling, horizontal resiliency options.As Collaborative Solutions Innovator you will:Constantly gather input from feature development teams using our data infrastructure, identify developer experience improvement opportunities, design systems that prevent data infrastructure related incidents, guide feature teams towards safe systems use.Collaborate directly with "storage" teams of various cloud providers (AWS, GCP) in driving combined innovation and engineering standard methodologies. Help design, drive, coordinate case studies targeting improvements in design and use of vendored data storage systems.Integrate components and input from core infrastructure, information security and other internal "building blocks" teams in constructing data storage solutions.Participate in multi-department risk assessment exercises and design systemic mitigating solutions pertaining to data infrastructure security, disaster recoverability, business continuity.As Process Automation Specialist you will:Discover, pursue, document ineffective manual processes relating to the lifecycle of Data Infrastructure maintenance and use. Propose, implement process automation, using corporate workflow automation platforms, decision capture workflows.Individually create services, expose internal APIs for these services that allow other teams, workflows leverage data infrastructure automation components.Design multi-department process workflows and integrations supporting data infrastructure lifecycle. Manage delivery dependencies outsourced to other teams.Participate in on-call, incidence mitigation sessions. Capture experiences related to manual activities and convert them into automation primitives supporting self-service use by feature development, SRE, data-consuming teams.Must Haves (Required Skills):Demonstrable expertise (deployment, use) in some of the following data storage technologies: Postgres/MySQL (“on-prem”, RDS, Aurora), Kafka / Kinesis (“on-prem” or managed), ElasticSearch/OpenSearch/Mongo, Redis/Memcache, analytical databases like Snowflake/Clickhouse/Greenplum, data federation engines like Presto/Trino/Dremio/Athena.Demonstrable prior experience with Terraform for managing cloud infrastructure. Kubernetes, CloudFormation, Hashicorp Packer, Chef/Ansible knowledge are huge pluses.Demonstrable familiarity with engineering workflow automation tools like ArgoCD/Workflow, AirFlow, Jenkins.Strong scripting experience with Python (preferred), shell (secondary).Significant prior exposure to cloud vendors AWS (preferred), GCP, Azure. Demonstrable knowledge of specifics of resource creation and policy (permissions) management in cloud environments.Persistent drive to learn new things and deepen your expertise.You are a natural fit if:You have done projects like these before and are looking for a friendly, meritocratic, engineering-excellence-focused environment to call home.You are an established, modern DevOps/IT engineer hoping to specialize in data and resilient stateful storage systems.You are a seasoned DBA with a strong drive to build your infrastructure provisioning core competencies.You are an empathetic SRE or sales/solutions engineer hoping to enhance your domain specialist value in data space.You are a seasoned data engineer deliberately shifting your professional definition from daily grind of ETL to systemic fundamentals of stateful storage resiliency and infrastructure lifecycles.Upwork is proudly committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workforce. We never discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical condition), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.#LD-L1To learn more about how Upwork processes and protects your personal information as part of the application process, please review our Global Job Applicant Privacy Notice

title: Senior Data Scientist - Remote
description: DescriptionReq. #306925177Every business has data, however, to turn that information into actionable items and into a competitive advantage. As a Senior Data Scientist, it is your duty to create the tools and models that will allow businesses to take smart data driven decisions that allow them to solve present challenges and be prepared for the future.OUR VALUE, OUR PEOPLEWe aim to deliver truly transformative solutions around the world, with top-notch technologies, in high-performance professional teams. But none of these would be possible without our people, and that’s where you come in.As an EPAMer you will always be expanding your knowledge, facing and addressing the biggest challenges, and becoming the best version of yourself, both personally and professionally. We care about your development and to support your growth in the company, there are many career paths you can follow. Some of the positions you can grow into Lead Data Scientist , among others. What You’ll DoConvert large volumes of structured and unstructured customer data using. advanced analytical solutionsDevelop descriptive and predictive models that deliver better decisionsTurn analyzed data into actionable insights and business valueCreate high-quality data visualizationsCommunicate effectively with different departments and roles (product managers, engineers) to discuss complex data-driven findings and technical mattersEducate and train others on Data Science related mattersEstimate, plan and coordinate the delivery of large projectsCreate Data Science solution architecturePropose holistic Data Science solutions for customers problems What You HaveAptitude for problem solvingKnowledge of data focused applied mathematics (statistical analysis, machine learningDecent communication / presentation skills (including working English fluencyRDBMS/SQL knowledgeProgramming experience (Python preferred)Experience with Data analysis tools and libraries such as Python (NumPy / SciPy / scikit-learn / pandas / matplotlib), RKnowledge of Big Data stack; Spark / MLlibProficiency with at least one of the Cloud providersExperience with Data Science solutions productionalizationData visualization skillsExperience with NLP/text miningBachelor’s/Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Math, Applied Statistics or a related fieldExperience in data mining, statistics, or machine learningIn-depth domain understanding and ability to acquire new BenefitsLearning CultureProfessional growth opportunitiesPaid HolidaysCommunity Benefit We offerWe trust our people. We believe in team distribution and that you know what you are doing, which is why you will be able to work remotely and have a flexible schedule  We are both proud of working within a diverse and inclusive environment and acting in our role as an equal opportunities’ employer. You are welcome at EPAM for who you are.  You will be challenged while working side-by side with the best talent globally. We work with top-notch technologies, constantly seeking out new industry trends and best practices  We are a global design community eager to share knowledge, experiences, and mentoring. You will learn, contribute, and grow with usHow does it sound to know you can have a 20+year career with us constantly growing and without the need to look elsewhere? We offer access to learning platforms, classes, and workshops to support your development. You will be set up for success with our clear career paths and support in helping you achieve the goals you set for yourself, both personal and professional  We seek improvement in a proactive manner. You have the freedom to make recommendations, suggestions or simply comment on things without the pressure of adhering to hierarchy or strict processes  We work with a broad range of clients: Media, Entertainment, Life Sciences, Automotive, Finance, Technology, and Travel. You will play a key role in growing their business and potentially work in multiple new industries   About EPAMEPAM is a leading global provider of digital platform engineering and development services. We are committed to having a positive impact on our customers, our employees, and our communities. We embrace a dynamic and inclusive culture. Here you will collaborate with multi-national teams, contribute to a myriad of innovative projects that deliver the most creative and cutting-edge solutions, and have an opportunity to continuously learn and grow. No matter where you are located, you will join a dedicated, creative, and diverse community that will help you discover your fullest potential

title: Analista BI
description: Sobre PaigoSomos una fintech uruguaya 100% digital, comprometida con el desarrollo de productos financieros más accesibles, innovadores y justos. Unimos nuestra expertiz en el mundo de las finanzas y la pasión por la tecnología para revolucionar la banca tradicional, creando un vínculo más virtuoso entre las personas y sus finanzas.Sobre el rolEstamos buscando un Analista BI para formar parte de nuestro squad de Growth, enfocado en el producto Pago Después, una plataforma BNPL (buy now, pay later) .Buscamos una persona con un background analítico, capaz de explotar el potencial de los datos para brindar insights relevantes para la toma de decisión del negocio. nuestro producto¿Cómo será tu día a día? Trabajarás de manera colaborativa con el área de Growth para comprender sus necesidades analíticas y diseñar soluciones de datos que aporten valor al negocio.  Crearás y mantendrás dashboards y visualizaciones interactivas de datos.  Extraerás, procesarás y analizarás diferentes fuentes de datos con el objetivo de mantener y mejorar nuestras bases de datos.  Generarás bases de usuarios para realización de campañas de marketing.  Generarás análisis solicitados en función de las necesidades de las áreas involucradas.  Aportarás insights relevantes para el diseño y la ingeniería de productos a partir de la comprensión del negocio y del comportamiento de los clientes.  Analizarás datos de forma proactiva para responder preguntas clave de las partes interesadas o por curiosidad autoiniciada con la vista puesta en lo que impulsa el rendimiento empresarial, investigando y comunicando aspectos clave para mejorar la eficiencia y la productividad.¿Qué esperamos de ti? Licenciatura o estudiante avanzado en Economía, Estadística, Ingeniería o disciplinas relacionadas.  Experiencia en ciencia de datos u otros roles analíticos.  Dominio de herramientas de visualizaciones (Tableau, PowerBi o similar) y SQL. Será un diferencial si tienes… Familiaridad con lenguajes de programación (Java, Python, R).  Experiencia en la industria de servicios financieros.

title: Desarrollador Backend para Big Data
description: En Scanntech estamos buscando profesionales de informática con experiencia en el desarrollo de soluciones de backend sobre bases de datos relacionales y clusters de Big Data. Nos interesamos en personas con experiencia en programación y diseño de sistemas, dispuesta a utilizar sus habilidades en un contexto único y desafiante, que esté dispuesta a aprender de todo el ciclo de vida de una de las infraestructuras de Big Data más desafiante de nuestro país.  El equipo de Data Quality está abocado al control de procesos, identificación de anomalías, y correcciones e informes automáticos. Analizamos y controlamos la información generada por más de 20.000 puntos de ventas de retailing con más de 15 millones de transacciones diarias.Buscamos y aseguramos la calidad de la información que consumen la mayoría de las industrias alimentarias del continente.Te proponemos - Participar en todas las etapas de desarrollo, desde el relevamiento de necesidades hasta la puesta en producción. - Identificar nuevos requerimientos funcionales y técnicos que permitan escalar la plataforma. - Investigar y proponer alternativas tecnológicas para asegurar nuestra misión - Horario flexible, modalidad híbrida.RequisitosEstudiante avanzado o terminado de tecnicaturas, cursos de programación o carreras de grado como Ingeniería en Informática, Ciencias de la Computación o similares. Contar con un mínimo de 2 años de experiencia laboral en roles de programación. Conocimientos avanzados y experiencia en: - Programación, patrones de diseño y arquitecturas de software. - Desarrollo de procesos autónomos y orquestados. - Ecosistema Java y Spring Framework. - Bases de datos relacionales y no relacionales (SQL y NoSQL)Se valorará Conocimientos y/o experiencia en: * Maven o Gradle, GIT y Jenkins. * Hadoop, Spark, Hive. * Herramientas y estrategias de testing y code quality.¿QUÉ TE ESPERA EN SCANNTECH? -Somos una empresa con más de 600 funcionarios, en constante expansión.-Tenemos raíces en Uruguay y presencia en varios países. -Lideramos la transformación tecnológica que está cambiando el mundo retail.-Conectamos a más de 35 mil supermercados con las industrias de consumo masivo más importantes del mundo, con el consumidor final y con las empresas de servicios. -Potenciamos y hacemos crecer a nuestros clientes desarrollando soluciones innovadoras y únicas en el mundo.

Our customers are at the center of everything we do.Come and grow with our team, where together we will transform lives and communities. Additionally, you will have the opportunity to participate in challenging projects and bring your innovative ideas.This is your opportunity, come and be part of Sangre Tigo!Apply right now! Ingeniero de Plataforma de DatosOportunidad laboral en nuestra operación de Tigo ParaguayObjetivo De La PosiciónEl rol del Ingeniero de Plataforma de Datos se ocupa de administrar, gestionar, procesar y organizar datos, así como de implementar la infraestructura necesaria para almacenarlos de forma adecuada y que así estos puedan ser utilizados del modo más eficiente (al convertirse en datos estructurados, accesibles y fiables)Conocimientos TécnicosAdemás de 1 año o más de experiencia con repositorios o bases de datos, se espera que haya tenido experiencia y competencia en alguna de las siguientes áreas:Determinar de dónde extraer los datos, cómo recuperarlos y construir algoritmos para que el acceso a los datos brutos sea más sencillo y útil para la empresa o institución. Es decir, optimiza la obtención de datos para que estos sean fiables y de calidad.Desarrollo, testeo y mantenimiento de arquitecturas de datos. Debe detectar su potencial, corregirlas cuando sea necesario y descartar lo que considere oportuno.Identificar cómo mejorar la calidad, eficiencia y confiabilidad de los datos.Alinear los datos con las necesidades/objetivos de la organización para la que trabaja.Identificar tendencias y patrones ocultos que puedan afectar a los objetivos de la empresa.Herramientas y lenguaje de programación.Desarrollo de softwares para sistemas escalables.Utilizar los datos para determinar qué tareas se pueden automatizar o emplear en modelos predictivos y prescriptivos.Perfil Del PuestoProfesional de carreras de Ing. Sistemas, Ing. de Computación o ramas afines.Conocimiento y experiencia en fuentes de datos: Oracle o SQL Server.Experiencia en nube: AWS, Azure o Google (Deseable).Manejo de agendas como: Linux, Windows, Chrome, Airflow de planificación y automatización de flujos de trabajo para configuración.Inglés técnico intermedio - avanzado.Tigo is a company committed to the digital transformation of Paraguay through innovative products and services. We have a clear purpose: to build digital networks that connect people, improve lives and develop our communities. Since 1992, we have sought to transform lives, accelerating the deployment of our high-speed data networks and significantly increasing access to digital highways for millions of people who are today taking advantage of the new digital economy. At the heart of this transformation is our Tigo people, a group of committed and talented individuals who are the DNA of our company, which we proudly call Sangre Tigo. Our Sangre Tigo moves us to work together for our purpose, to be innovative and agile, transparent and responsible, to place our clients at the center of everything we do, to be engines of positive change. Our strong work culture has been recognized by the “Great Place To Work® institute since 2012, forming part of the local ranking of the best companies to work for in Paraguay.Millicom | Tigo is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer committed to a diverse workforce and nondiscrimination policy in all aspects of employment. We provide equal opportunity and access for all persons, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, status as a disabled veteran or other protected veteran, or any other protected characteristic, in all phases of the employment process and in compliance with applicable federal, state, and local laws and regulations.

title: Quality Assurance Sr. Analyst
description: Position SnapshotNestlé Business Services LATAM | Asunción, Paraguay.Integrated Marketing Services / Websites Senior AnalystAvailable Shift: Monday to Tuesday from 8:00 to 18:00Advanced English is mandatoryNestlé Business Services is looking for extraordinary people to join our world-class team.In Paraguay we are two Nestlé units:Nestlé Paraguay is the unit in charge of importing and distributing of all our 1# brands and they have been in the market for 23 years.On the other hand, we are Nestlé Business Services Asunción, the Nestlé service center. We’ve been in the market since 2018. We provide Backoffice services as Supply Chain, Financial, HR, and Digital & Social Media to all Nestlé in LATAM from México down the map. Our clients are our colleagues.We are a multicultural and diverse team of professionals. We are passionate about driving continuous improvement of processes with colleagues across the world. We care about delivering high quality services to support business agility and digital innovation.If this describes you, and you are looking to join a business where you can really add value, it’s time to consider joining Nestlé Business Services!Position SummaryThis role is responsible for the quality of the activities performed on Nestlé's websites and functional quality of technical solutions provided by the Website Content Management team and SEO team. QA Analyst is responsible for test execution within allocated timeframe, making sure that Project deliverables are compliant with brand requirements. Ensuring visibility of quality KPIs and projects deliverables.A day in the life of...Websites Senior Analyst focused on Quality Assurances is responsible to final assess all projects and changes before finalized. Is in constant contact with the team to understand business and projects needs to gurantee the proper delivebrable and our quality target, and supporting the deployment of the website strategy and its roadmaps.What Will Make You SuccessfulAdvanced English1-2 years of experience with websites (CMS, mainly Drupal, wordpress, joomla or magento)HTML and CSS knowledgeProject Management ability, specially focused on quality controlUniversity Degree on going/completed of computer science, marketing, business studies, communications, journalism, media studies, psychology.Knowledge on Agile methodologyAgility/Ability to learnAbility to connect with the partnersAbility to work with ticketing and workflow toolDetail-oriented

title: Data Engineer (Google Cloud Platform)
description: About YouYou are someone who wants to influence your own development. You’re looking for a company where you have the opportunity to pursue your interests and be able to grow professionally.You bring to Applaudo the following competencies:Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or a related field6+ Years of experience in data engineering3+ years of data delivery, ETL (extract, transform and load), and data warehouse design, analysis, and programming experience3+ years in Google Cloud Platform data pipeline enabling systems like DataProc, DataFlow, Pub/Sub, BigQueryExperience with Apache Beam or Apache SparkExperience with an excellent grasp of relational and dimensional data modelingExperience in one or more of the following DBMS: PostgreSQL, MySQL, Google Cloud Datastore, CosmosStrong mathematical, statistical, and analytics skills1+ years of Agile experienceExcellent communication, collaboration, and teamwork skillsEnglish is required, as you will work directly with US-based clientsYou will be accountable for the following responsibilities:Extract data from different sources and transfer it into a data warehouse environment.Designing, maintaining, and implementing transactional and analytical data storage structures.Design, build and maintain data pipelines, consuming from multiple sources and servicing multiple tenants.Model continuous learning by staying up on data systems, strategies and best practices in Google Cloud Platform and SaaS platformsElaborate informative, expressive, and meaningful reports that support business decision-making processes through the information provided.Reporting and subsequently translating the emanating results into good technical and consistent data designs.Technical skills:Languages: Apache Beam, or Apache SparkCloud Provider: Google Cloud Platform.Willing to work from 9 am to 7 pm GTM-6 time zoneAdditional InformationHere at Applaudo Studios values as trust, communication, respect, excellence and team work are our keys to success. We know we are working with the best and thus treat each other with respect and admiration without asking.Submit your application today, and don't miss this opportunity to join the Best Digital team in the Region!We truly appreciate all the hard and outstanding work our team makes every day at Applaudo Studios, and that's why the perks that we offer, are deeply thought and designed as a way to thank them for their commitment and excellence.Some of our perks and benefits:Work from homeFlexible scheduleCelebrationsSpecial discountsEntertainment areaFlexible work spacesGreat work environmentPrivate medical insurance*Benefits may vary according to your location and/or availability. Request further information when applying.

title: Analyst:in Traineeprogramm Business Development (m/w/d)
description: Deine AufgabenAusarbeitung und Umsetzung von Wachstums-, Prozess-, Produktinitiativen Die Skalierung (Analyse, Strukturierung, Digitalisierung, Ergebnismessung) der operativen Prozesse in enger Zusammenarbeit mit dem ManagementVorbereitung und Umsetzung eigener Ideen, Lösungen, EntscheidungenMotivation und Guidance der Teams im Hinblick auf Liberta Partners Standards und Werte Bindeglied zwischen Liberta Partners und unseren Unternehmen, inkl. Verantwortung für Vorbereitung und Einhaltung der Prozesse der ZusammenarbeitDein Profil Erfolgreich absolvierte Praktika in den Bereichen Unternehmensberatung, Wirtschaftsprüfung, Private Equity, Investmentbanking oder in mittelständischen UnternehmenSehr gutes abgeschlossenes Bachelor- oder Masterstudium an einer renommierten Universität/Business SchoolHands-on Mentalität, unternehmerische Denkweise, nachgewiesene analytische sowie quantitative Fähigkeiten und MittelstandsaffinitätBereitschaft zum Einsatz bei Portfoliofirmen vor Ort im DACH-Raum für jeweils 10-12 MonateAffinität zu den digitalen Möglichkeiten der heutigen Welt und zu moderner UnternehmensführungGelassenheit, natürliche Überzeugungskraft und TeamfähigkeitUnser AngebotVerantwortung, Gestaltungsfreiheit und eine steile Lernkurve in Zusammenarbeit mit einer der innovativsten und agilsten Private Equity Gesellschaften im MittelstandsbereichFachliche und persönliche Entwicklung im Rahmen des Talentprogramms durch: Mentor:inbegleitung, Netzwerkaufbau und wechselnde, spannenden Stationen bei vielfältigen PortfoliounternehmenZusammenarbeit direkt mit den C-Levels unserer Unternehmen sowie den Partnern von Liberta PartnersEine Möglichkeit, mit Deiner Tätigkeit direkt die Entwicklung eines Unternehmens zu beeinflussenAmbitionierte Aufgaben, super Entwicklungsperspektiven und ein attraktives GehaltspaketWie geht es weiter Kennlernvideocall mit einem Teammitglied des People & Culture Teams + des Fachteams: Erstes lockeres Kennenlernen sowie kurzer fachlicher Austausch. Videointerview mit einem Partner des Fachbereichs: Wir schauen, ob Deine Erfahrungen und Erwartungen an die Position mit unseren Anforderungen matchen. Onsite Experience Day inkl. Case Study: Du triffst das Team, Peers und interne Stakeholder und besprichst die Ergebnisse Deiner Case Study.Zusätzliche InformationDiese Position bieten wir im Rahmen unseres Traineeprogramms an. Während des Programms wirst Du jeweils für 10-12 Monate in ca. drei Portfoliounternehmen und der Holding Projekte auf Geschäftsführungsebene verantworten und maßgeblich am Unternehmenserfolg mitwirken. Die Position im Portfolio richtet sich nach Deinem Interesse und fachlichem Fokus (Unternehmensführung, Controlling, Marketing, Sales etc.).Daneben bist Du Teil des Liberta Partners Corporate Development Teams, startest die ersten Wochen in der Holding in München und nimmst an unseren Aktivitäten teil. Ziel des Programms ist die Übernahme einer leitenden Funktion in einem Portfoliounternehmen oder auch in der Liberta Partners Holding.Liberta Partners ist eine von Unternehmern gegründete Multi-Family-Holding, die Unternehmen mit operativem Entwicklungspotenzial erwirbt. Wir verbinden die Vorzüge eines Familienunternehmens mit der Professionalität einer Private Equity Gesellschaft und der Agilität eines Start-ups.Operativ verfolgen wir einen überaus aktiven Ansatz, bei dem Gruppengesellschaften von einem dynamischen Management und einem starken Gesellschafternetzwerk aktiv unterstützt und entwickelt werden. So haben wir bereits eine Vielzahl an internationalen und komplexen Transaktionen erfolgreich durchgeführt und die erworbenen Unternehmen aktiv weiter entwickelt.
